loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah lives in Ozamiz City and supports her four daughters by building houses from the ground up. She has availed a loan, which she used to buy building materials, paints, and to pay her workers. Sarah has big plans for her daughters to get an education and escape the life of backbreaking work she has had to endure.

loans.use: to buy building materials, paints & pay her workers

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en: From Plaridel, Misamis Occidental, Philippines, Felicia earns a living through her buy and sell business. She tries to have enough inventory to continuously provide for her family. For her capital needs, PMPC has stood by her since the start of her business. She is happy that she is able to survive the odds of business with determination and her family as her inspiration. To earn more, she applied for a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase more inventory to sell. Felicia hopes to live comfortably with her children finishing their studies.

loans.use: to buy more inventory for her buy and sell business

loans.name: Tsevelmaa

texts.en: Mrs. Tsevelmaa, 45 years old, lives with her husband and son in Darkhan, second largest city in Mongolia. She has been selling underwear since 2008. Her husband makes armature at a construction company. Their son studies at university. She is requesting a loan of 3,000 USD to buy underwear in large amounts. By doing so, she will no longer need to go to China for goods for a good amount of time and also she will sell without worrying about inventory shortage.

loans.use: to buy underwear in large amounts

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou, a responsible mother, requests a loan from Paglaum MPC. She will use the loan to increase her inventory. She wants to buy ingredients for her banana cue, such as oil, sugar, and banana sticks. 

This way, she will be able to sell more products, which will allow her to earn more money and provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her banana cue, such as oil, sugar, and banana sticks.

loans.name: Surmakul

texts.ru: Сурмакул 49 лет, замужем, 3 дочери, образование среднее. Работает в доме культуры, с 1995 года занимается полеводством, на 1,30 ГА собственной земли она выращивает арбузы и кукурузу для внутрихозяйственного потребления и реализации. Экологически чистая продукция Сурмакул пользуется большим спросом среди местных жителей и оптовых покупателей. Сурмакул знает технологию ведения сельскохозяйственной деятельности и умеет вкладывать средства по назначению. Ее ежемесячный совокупный доход составляет около 10,000 сом (KGS). Сурмакул обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на постройку фундамента для будущего дома для ее дружной семьи. На полученные средства она планирует закупить цемент и щебень. Сурмакул намерена построить большой дом, а прибыль от полеводства откладывать на дальнейшее развитие бизнеса.
texts.en:
Surmakul is 49 years old, married and has three daughters. She has secondary education. She works at home, since 1995 she has worked with field crop cultivation on 1.30 hectares of own land. She grows watermelon and sweet corn for own use and sale. 

Surmakul's organic products are in great demand from residents and wholesale customers. She knows how to manage the agricultural business and knows how to invest money. Her total monthly income is around 10,000 som (KGS). 

Surmakul turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 40,000 som (KGS) to build the foundation for the future home of her friendly family. She plans to purchase cement and rubble for the money received. Surmakul intends to build a large house, and the income from the agricultural business she intends to invest in the future development of the business.

loans.use: To purchase cement and rubble for building the foundation of a new house for her family

loans.name: Lyndiza

texts.en:
Lyndiza thought she was in the right place when she joined the microfinance group of Paglaum MPC. She decided to give it a try after she learned she can avail herself of financial assistance for her chosen business. Lyndiza has maintained her membership in good standing without records of default up to this day. She has taken several loans, and all were repaid in a timely manner. 

Recently, she accessed a loan to purchase bags of feed and animal vitamins for her chosen business. Lyndiza wishes to continuously manage her business more effectively with the support of her family.

loans.use: to purchase bags of feed and animal vitamins.

loans.name: Akenese

texts.en:
Akenese is 59 years old and married with ten children. She makes and sells elei printed material to earn a living and has been doing this for twelve years. 

Akenese has requested a loan to buy material, fabric paint, stencils, rollers, fabric paint, and brushes. 

She plans to use her profits to pay for her family’s weekly expenses. She joined SPBD in 2002 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy material, fabric paint, stencils, rollers, fabric paint, and brushes.

loans.name: Sandra Estela

texts.es: La joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 25 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riego, se dedica a la venta de ropa y zapatos en su lugar de residencia desde hace 2 años, tiene mucha clientela por la variedad de productos y los buenos precios, la joven es madre soltera vive en casa propia con su hija, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas mercadería por mayor para surtir su negocio y asi poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
The young woman whose pixelated photo appears above is 25 years old and lives in a high-risk area. She has sold clothing and footwear in a place near her home for the last two years. She has many customers because of the variety of products she sells and the fair prices she charges.

This young woman is a single mother and lives in her own house with her daughter. She is seeking a loan to buy more merchandise in bulk to better stock her business and earn more money.

loans.use: buy clothing and footwear

loans.name: Rosa Lilian

texts.es: Doña rosa de 58 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida y su hijo, ella se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y frijol desde hace varios años, comercializa sus productos en los alrededores de la zona, Doña rosa esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. así como muestra en la fotografía para continuar con sus cultivos ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo
texts.en:
58-year old Sra. Rosa lives in her own house with her husband and son. She has earned her living growing corn and beans for several years and sells the produce in nearby areas.

Rosa is seeking a loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, manure, insecticides, herbicides etc. She is shown in the photo working in her fields. This work is her only source of income.

loans.use: buy seeds, fertilizer, manure, insecticides, herbicides etc.

loans.name: Behruz

texts.ru: Бехруз родился  1996 года. После окончания школы советом родителей он поступил в Таджикский Государственный Экономический Университет. Данное время является студентом 1 курса. Он очень способный молодой человек. Бехруз увлекается спортом и в свободное время читает зарубежную литературу.  Родители не в состоянии оплатить за его учебу в университете. Он запрашивает займ для оплаты учебы в университет. Он ждет вашу доброту. Этот займ поможем молодому человеку окончить университет и реализовать свои знания в будущем.
texts.en:
Behruz was born in 1996. After finishing school, he entered the Tajik State University of Economics on the advice of his parents. He is now a first year student. He is a very capable young man. 

Behruz is interested in sports and in his free time he reads foreign literature. His parents are not able to pay for his university tuition. He requests a loan to pay for it. He awaits your kindness. This loan will enable this young man to finish university and in the future use his knowledge.

loans.use: To pay his tuition

loans.name: Riza

texts.en:
Riza has mastered her hog raising business in Liloy. This is how she makes a living and is able to support her family. She was at her lowest point when she didn't have enough capital for her business. When she joined PMPC, she was truly grateful to avail herself of credit to fully support her business. 

Just as she takes care of her hog raising business, so it is with her membership with PMPC. She wants to maintain her membership in good standing so she can always apply for any financing needs. 

Now, the loan of PHP 14,000 will help her build a concrete pig pen that would support sanitation and care for the environment.

loans.use: to build a concrete pig pen.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 46 years old. She is known in the Ozamiz area for her sari-sari store. She is actively participating in the various programs and services that the co-op offers. She hopes to live comfortably, with a decent house, for which she applied for a loan to purchase plywood, nails, and sticks.

Alma hopes to maintain her membership in good standing, with a good repayment record. It matters that she has been given a priority, as a micro finance member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC). She is thankful that all of the financing needs of her retail business are supported by PMPC.

loans.use: to purchase plywood, nails, and sticks for her house.

loans.name: Nargis

texts.ru: Наргис родилась в 1995 году. Она в прошлом году окончила среднюю школу и целый год готовилась к тому, чтобы поступить в Медицинский Университет. В этом году она поступила на 1 курс Медицинского Университета. Наргис очень рада, что смогла поступить в Медицинский Университет. Теперь она уверена в себе, что в будущем станет хорошим доктором и будет лечить больных людей. Она живет с родителями. Ее родители преподаватели. Наргис должна оплатить за учебный договор, но не имеет денег. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 900 долларов США для оплаты учебного договора. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Nargis was born in 1995. Last year she finished high school and the whole year she spent preparing for entering the Medical University. This year she started her first year. Nargis is very happy that she was able to start the Medical University. She is sure that she will become a great doctor in the future, and will treat sick people. 

Nargis lives with her parents. Her parents are teachers. Nargis needs to pay for her tuition, but does not have the money. She requests a loan in the amount of 900 US dollar to pay for her tuition. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To pay for tuition

loans.name: Kristine

texts.en: Kristine operates a motorcycle transport business.  Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day. For her to continue her business, she took a loan to pay for motorcycle spare parts and repairs. She dreams of owning motorcycle units and being able to provide for the family.

loans.use: to pay for motor spare parts/repair

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is a 49-year-old married woman and the mother of six children from Iloilo, Philippines. She has been engaged in a fishing business with her husband for more than 25 years now. This is the source of their income.

Nida is asking for a loan to buy new fishing gear such as nets, hooks and lead weights. With this new gear, her husband will be able to improve his catch, thus giving them more fish to sell in the market.

In the future, Nida dreams of expanding their fishing business so that it will generate more income. She also wants to save money for the school fees of her children. Nida believes that through hard work, her dreams of improving their way of living is possible.

loans.use: to buy new fishing gear such as nets, hooks and lead weights

loans.name: Easter

texts.en: Easter is 26 years old and married with 2 children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 2 years. Easter needs a loan to buy a spade, a machete, chemicals, fertilizer, new boots and a pair of overalls. She has been a member of SPBD since 2012. Easter will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy a spade, a machete, chemicals, fertilizer, new boots and a pair of overalls

loans.name: Nasiyba

texts.ru: Насийба, 56 лет, вдова, дети Насийбы взрослые, самостоятельные. Насийба проживает вместе с внуком. У нее среднее образование, с 1984 года в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, она занимается животноводством и полеводством. Благодаря упорному труду, в хозяйстве Насийбы на сегодняшний день имеется 1 корова, 1 лошадь и 5 овец. Также есть 0,70 ГА собственной земли, где Насийба выращивает фасоль и клевер для внутрихозяйственного потребления и реализации. На ежедневной основе Насийба продает молоко. В целях увеличения своего бизнеса Насийба обратилась в Банк «Бай–Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 1 дойной коровы. Доходы от кредита Насийба планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, ей нужно закупить корм и сено для скота.
texts.en:
Nasiyba is 56 years old and a widow. Her children are grown-ups and independent. Nasiyba lives together with her grandson. She has secondary education. As a main source of income for her family, she has worked with livestock breeding and field crop cultivation since 1984. Thanks to her persistent work, Nasiyba currently has one cow, one horse and five sheep. She also has 0.70 hectares of own land, where she grows beans and clover for own use and sale. She sells milk on a daily basis. 

With an aim to increase the income from her business, Nasiyba turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) to purchase a cow. She plans to invest the income from the loan in further increasing the number of livestock, and she needs to purchase fodder and hay for the livestock.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow in order to increase the volume of milk for sale

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is 53 years old and married with four children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  

Caroline has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years. 

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more snack foods to sell in her food stall. 

In the future, Caroline would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more snack foods to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Adan

texts.es:
Adán de 52 años de edad, está acompañado, su pareja se dedica a los oficios del hogar, es padre de 2 hijos, ambos mayores de edad y con hogar propio. Nadie más vive con él.

Adán es agricultor desde muy pequeño, aprendió trabajando con su padre, también tiene experiencia en el manejo del ganado y gracias a ello logro sacar adelante a su familia.

El préstamo será utilizado para comprar fertilizantes para su cultivo de maíz, está en la etapa crítica en la que necesita ser fertilizado para dar el mejor rendimiento.

Adán espera gozar de buena salud, y disfrutar su vejez al lado de su pareja, pues agradece a Dios que sus hijos ya son independientes.
texts.en:
Adán is 52-years old, married, and has two children. His wife looks after the household. Both their children are adults and live in their own homes. No one else lives with Adán.

He is a farmer. As a young boy he learned about farming by working alongside his father. He also has experience with livestock. Thanks to this work he has managed to help his family get ahead.

The loan he is seeking will be used to buy fertilizer for his maize crop. This is the critical time for applying fertilizer to ensure a good harvest.

Adán hopes to stay healthy and enjoy his old age with his wife by his side. He is thankful that his children are already independent.

loans.use: buy fertilizer

loans.name: Erdenechimeg

texts.en: Mrs. Erdenechimeg, 42 years old, lives with her husband and son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been working as a train attendant since 1999. Her husband is an electrician and works at a private firm. Their son studies at the university. She is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to buy vacuum insulated windows, hardwood flooring and fiberglass for her apartment renovation. After renovation, her family will live in a comfortable and warm place where energy is efficiently preserved.

loans.use: to renovote her apartment in order to preserve energy

loans.name: Monyeen Starll

texts.en: Monyeen Starll is driven by her passion for selling. At the age of 24 and a single mom in Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte, she runs a store that primarily supports their family. Everyday she never gets tired of tending her store. Monyeen Starll is a full-fledged member of PMPC and has took several loans already. She religiously paid her obligations without records of default. Now, she borrowed another loan to pay for inventories of sugar, milk, oil, and noodles to sell. Having enough inventories will mean income opportunities. In the future, she dreams of sustaining her store to continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to pay for inventories of sugar, milk, oil, and noodles to sell

loans.name: Nefilia

texts.en: Nefilia, a responsible mother, requests a loan from Paglaum MPC, which she will use to increase her inventory. She wants to buy more kilos of fruit and vegetables to sell. This way, she will be able to sell more products, which will allow her to earn more money and provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: To purchase more kilos of fruit and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Anane

texts.en:
Anane is 31 years old and married with one child in school. 

Anane is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Anane has been raising pigs for five years now and has borrowed 10 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Isidro

texts.es:
Isidro de 64 años de edad, Estudio hasta 3° grado de educación básica, sus padres no pudieron pagar su estudio por razones económicas. Está casado y tiene 2 hijos, mayores de edad e independientes con hogar propio.

Isidro es agricultor de granos básicos desde los 14 años, aprendió dicha actividad con su padre a quien ayudaba con las tareas agrícolas.

El préstamo será utilizado en la compra de fertilizante para la última aplicación del cultivo de maíz que establecio, así asegurar una buena cosecha y el alimento para los próximos meses.

Isidro espera algún día repara su casa, y darle a su pareja la comodidad y seguridad que se merece.
texts.en:
Isidro is 64 years old. He went to school until the 3rd grade. His parents were unable to pay for his studies due to economic reasons. He is married and has 2 children who are independent adults with their own homes.

Isidro has been a farmer who grows staple grains for 14 years. He learned this job from his father whom he helped with the farm work.

The loan will be used to purchase fertilizer for the last application on the corn crops that he planted. Thus, he will ensure a good harvest and food for the coming months.

Isidro hopes to someday repair his house and give his partner the comfort and security that she deserves.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Severina

texts.en: Severina is married with three children. Severina is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines. Severina is a farmer and grows eggplant to earn a living. She has been doing this for 15 years. She requested a loan to buy fertilizer for her eggplants. Severina has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Severina hopes to have a rice mill.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Joanna

texts.en: Joanna, a widow of 45 and a mother of five settled for a living in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. She solely provides for her children's needs. She has been running a general store for over seven years and her children help her in her business. While her children were still studying, she had to make ways to augment her business. To improve sales, she borrowed a new loan from Gata Daku MPC micro credit to purchase more grocery goods to sell. She became a member of GDMPC recently and is thankful for the opportunity that they offered. She wants to expand her business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Norjinpagam

texts.en: Mrs Norjinpagam, 39 years old, lives with her husband, son and mother in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She and her husband have been running a dumpling shop since 2013. Initially she and her husband together with two employees handled the sales and deliveries of the dumpling business. Over time, her business has proved to be successful and she hired two more people and increased the freezer number from two to four. Now she is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 MNT to buy meat, flour and two freezers in order to further improve her business. Also after this loan, she is expecting to hire one more employee.

loans.use: to buy meat, flour and two freezers for her dumpling business.

loans.name: Michelyn

texts.en: Michelyn is 21 years old and married with one child. She is known as a hardworking woman in Baybay, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. She is actively participating in the various programs and services that the co-op offers. She hopes to live comfortably with a decent house, for which she has applied for a loan to purchase plywood, nails, and sticks. She hopes to maintain her membership in good standing with a good repayment record. It matters that she has been given priority as a microfinance member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC). This is what she is thankful for when all the financing needs of her retailing business are supported by PMPC.

loans.use: to purchase plywood, nails, and sticks for her house.

location.town: Liloy- Baybay Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Rosabella

texts.en: Rosabella is married with four children. She is 53 years old and lives in Dumalinao ZDS. Rosabella sells pants and shirts to earn a living and has had this business for six years. Each month she earns 4,000 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 14,900 PHP to buy shirts and pants. Rosabella has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, Rosabella hopes to have her own shop selling RTW clothing.

loans.use: to buy shirts and pants to sell

loans.name: Jaylord

texts.en: Jaylord is 29 years old and still single. He is a fisherman and lives in Siquijor, Philippines. This year, 2014, Jaylord applied for his membership in PMPC.  Hearing about all the benefits of being a member in the Coop, he never hesitated to become a member. He wants to obtain financial assistance from Paglaum MPC amounting to PHP 5,000 for the purchase of new nets.  As much as possible, he wants to have all the needed fishing accessories to minimize chances of a low or zero catch. In the future, Jaylord dreams of purchasing a new fishing boat by setting aside some savings from the daily sales. He wishes to have a stable income for his future family.

loans.use: to purchase new nets for fishing

loans.name: Juliene

texts.en: From Enrique Villanueva, Siquijor, Philippines. Juliene is 53 years of age and earns a living through her clothing sales. She seeks to have enough inventories to continuously provide for her family. For her capital needs, PMPC has stood by her since the start of her business. She is happy that she is able to survive the odds of business with determination and her family as her inspiration. To earn more, she has applied for a loan of PHP 12,000 to purchase more clothing inventories to sell. Juliene hopes to live comfortably and that her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing inventories to sell.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en: Lilia is a businesswoman from Siquijor, Philippines. She is 52 years old, married and has expertise in selling. She runs a little sari-sari store and earns a meagre income that sufficiently supports her family. Lilia is a fully fledged member of PMPC and has taken out several loans already. She maintains her membership in good standing without any records of default. Now, she has applied for a loan to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items. Lilia continues to look for better business opportunities, proof that she has the passion and the energy to make ends meet for her family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 57 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Nancy is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She has been raising pigs for eight years and also earns additional income from poultry.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Rosenie

texts.en:
Rosenie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business selling purified drinking water in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of purified water to sell.

Rosenie has been in this business for three years. She earns more income from her internet café.

Rosenie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of purified water to sell.

loans.name: Carlos Enrique

texts.es:
Carlos de 22 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, está acompañado, su pareja trabaja en una tienda como vendedora, no tiene hijos y solo vive con su pareja.

Carlos es agricultor desde pequeño, trabaja una parcela que le pertenece a su madre, también es albañil, tiene 3 años de experiencia, ambas actividades las aprendió con su padre que también es albañil y agricultor.

El préstamo ser utilizado para comprar láminas de techo, pues en su casa se filtra el agua cuando llueve, generando incomodidad y riesgo de salud. 

Carlos manifiesta que este es el primer paso para vivir mejor, espera mejorar por completo su casa, además seguirá estudiando los sábados en la universidad porque quiere ser doctor.
texts.en:
Carlos is 22 years old and graduated from secondary school. He is married and his wife works in a store as a sales person. They have no children and live together with no other family members.

Carlos has been a farmer since childhood. He works a parcel of land that belongs to his mother. In addition, he is a bricklayer with 3 years experience. Carlos learned both activities from his father who is also a bricklayer and farmer.

The loan will be utilized to purchase sheets of roofing, since in his house they filter water when it rains, generating discomfort and a risk to their health.

Carlos says this is only the first step to living better; he expects to improve his house completely.

loans.use: buy sheets of corrugated metal to repair the roof of his house.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie, 40 years old, lives in Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte, Philippines with her husband and two children. Her husband is a construction worker. Unable to sustain the needs of the family with only her husband’s income, she has found ways to attain income through snack and food vending. It began with selling a small amount of viands and snacks to their neighbors. 

She joined Paglaum Cooperative, which helped her in the capitalization of her sari-sari (small grocery) store in January of 2012. She became a MIGS member, which is why she has received loans several times already. 

Now, she is applying for 11,000 PHP to buy merchandise for her sari-sari store. She hopes that her business will continue and someday become a mini-grocery.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Gracelfe

texts.en:
Gracelfe signed up for her membership with PMPC and obtained the needed capital to start up a sari-sari store business. She is thankful for the capital that was extended to a small-time borrower like her. 

Gracelfe is able to turn the tide in her favor and is making good sales these days. She wants to take advantage of the good fortune. Recently, she took a loan to restock her store with basic commodities such as canned goods, oil, and soy sauce. 

In the future, she hopes to build a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock her store with items such as canned goods, oil, and soy sauce.

loans.name: Herminigildo

texts.en:
In 2010, Herminigildo learned about Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative and the financial assistance it gives to start-ups. Herminigildo tried his luck on doing a business, focusing on his farming activities. He feels he owes his fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted him with the money he used as capital. 

Herminigildo is requesting a loan for another amount to pay for seedlings and compost. This will give his farming income a big boost.

Herminigildo looks for better business opportunities and would love to be in the position to help others.

loans.use: to pay for seedlings and compost.

loans.name: Aziza

texts.ru: Азиза родилась в 1996 году. Она в средней школе училась успешно. Азиза всегда хотела поступить в университет. Для того чтобы осуществить мечту Шахнозы ее отец вылечился, так как он был болен и уехал в Россию на заработки. Ее мать работает на местной газете. Она пишет стихи и получает маленькую зарплату. Данное время в доме нет сбережений, все было потрачено на лечение ее отца. Азиза своими силами и стараниями поступила в Таджикский Государственный университет Политики и Бизнеса. Она запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора в университете. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Aziza was born in 1996 and was a successful student in high school. She always wanted to go to college. In order to help her dream come true, her father went to work in Russia after recovering from his illness. Her mother works at the local newspaper. She writes poetry and receives a small salary. The family currently does not have savings because they spent everything on her father’s treatment. Aziza has worked hard to enroll at the Tajik State University of Politics and Business. She is taking out a loan to pay for her college tuition. She awaits your kindness and hopes for your generosity.

loans.use: To pay for her tuition

loans.name: Maria Alicia

texts.es:
La socia Maria Alicia se sigue dediucando al negocio de venta de productos de belleza y tambien zapatos,la socia vende  lapiz labiales,cremas y perfumes,la socia por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante.La socia solicita el credito para comprar lapiz labiales y cremas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Maria Alicia continues dedicating herself to her business selling beauty products and shoes. She sells lipstick, lotions, and perfumes. Through this business, she wants to go forward. She requests the loan to buy lipstick and lotions.

She is happy with the loan and promises to comply with the loan repayments.

loans.use: to buy lipstick and lotions.

loans.name: Bibiana

texts.en:
Bibiana lives in the Philippines and is the married mother of two children. She works hard to support her family. She has a business retailing soft-drinks and earns additional income from selling purified drinking water. Bibiana is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more cases of soft drinks to offer for sale.

Bibiana has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more cases of soft drinks to offer for sale.

loans.name: Jose Narciso

texts.es:
José de 49 años de edad, está acompañado, su pareja se dedica a los oficios el hogar, no tuvo acceso a la educación por falta de recursos económicos, tiene dos hijos, uno todavía vive con él, el otro tiene su propio hogar. Solo su esposa y un hijo viven con él.

José es comerciante de ganado, tiene 4 años de experiencia y con ello ha mantenido a su familia. Todos los martes viaja al tiangue ganadero del municipio más cercano para vender el ganado que compro a las personas que viven cerca de su comunidad, esta forma de trabajar la aprendió de un amigo que se dedica a lo mismo.

El préstamo será utilizado para comprar materiales de construcción, quiere hacer un corral para tener resguardados y seguros los animales que compra.

Con el tiempo y su esfuerzo, espera mejorar su casa para vivir más cómodo con su familia.
texts.en:
Jose is 49 years old and has a partner whose job is to look after the house. He didn't attend school due to a lack of economic resources. He has two children, one of whom still lives with him. The other has his own home. Only his wife and one son live with Jose.

Jose supports his family by trading livestock and he has 4 years of experience in this line of work. Every Tuesday he travels to the livestock market held at the nearest town to sell the livestock he buys from the people who live near his community. He learned this way of working from a friend who makes a living doing the same job. 

The loan will be used to buy construction materials. He wants to make a pen to keep the animals that he buys safe and protected. 

Over time and with his own effort, he hopes to improve his house to live more comfortably with his family.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to make a pen.

loans.name: Iloga

texts.en: Iloga is a 65-year-old widow with eight children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 12 years. Iloga needs a loan to buy fertilizer, a spade, new boots, chemicals, a wheelbarrow, crops and a mini tractor. She has been a member of SPBD since 2002. Iloga will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, a spade, new boots, chemicals, a wheelbarrow, crops and a mini-tractor

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma has signed up for a membership with PMPC and has availed herself of the working capital she needed for her snack vending business. She is thankful for the capital PMPC extends to small-time borrowers like her.

Alma has been able to turn the tide in her favour and has made good sales these days. She wants to take advantage of her good fortune. Recently, she availed herself of a loan to purchase stocks of flour, oil, etc. for snack vending. In the future, she hopes to mount a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of flour, oil, etc. for snack vending

loans.name: Nazeer

texts.en:
Nazeer is a 57-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her one son and two daughters who are doing their studies. Her husband has been running his own business selling clothes for three years. He is the only one responsible for feeding the entire family and managing the household.

He needs to purchase different types of clothes in bulk to resell, but due to insufficient financial means, he is unable to purchase these clothes. Therefore, Nazeer is applying for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can assist her husband to purchase these clothes in bulk for his business. He can also increase the size of his business and earn maximum profit with the help of this loan. 
 
Nazeer is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy clothing for her husband to sell

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
This is Josephine, 38, and a resident of Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Ricky, a bus driver, and they have children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Josephine operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns money by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting an PHP 8,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Josephine dreams to prosper in her business. She hopes to give her children a good and quality education and that her husband will always be safe from harm, especially when driving. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and so she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Feauma

texts.en:
Feauma is a 52-year-old widow with 3 children. She has a small vegetable garden where she grows cabbages and tomatoes that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 4 years.

Feauma needs a loan to buy insect poison, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller, a rake, new gloves and a watering hose. She has been a member of SPBD since 2010. Feauma will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy insect poison, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller, a rake, new gloves and a watering hose

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en: Rowena is aged 43, married to a driver, and blessed with three children. She has owned and managed a retail store in their village for almost 17 years and earns a net income of PHP 400 daily. Her net income from this business is usually spent on their daily expenses. Due to a lack of capital in her business, she would like to avail herself of a loan amounting to PHP 50,000 to purchase rice grain, sugar, coffee, beverages, and milk to sell. She is hoping that her business will continue to improve and become more profitable.

loans.use: to purchase rice grain, sugar, coffee, beverages, and milk to sell.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 42 years old and a mother of four. She is from Cabilinan, Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. She has been operating her general store for over nine years, earning good enough for the family. With her generated revenue, her previous loan that was used for buying stock, has been fully repaid successfully. Her access to Gata Daku MPC services helped her to improve her business. To increase her sales, she took a new loan to purchase more variety of grocery goods to sell.

She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her loan to improve the general living situation of her family and to continue saving little by little for their future needs.

loans.use: to purchase more variety of grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria resides with her family in Campo 1, Aurora, in Zamboanga del Sur. Her husband is a farmer, while she manages her hog-raising business to make a living.

With her income from their farm, Gloria successfully repaid her previous loan used for buying feeds. Her ability to be an entrepreneur was improved after she joined Gata Daku MPC, and with her access to micro finance, her plan of improving her business has become easier.

She took a new loan recently, to purchase feeding supplies. Having a positive outlook on the future, Gloria rests assured that she will have a better living in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase feeding supplies

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
She is Lucia, 42, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Amado, her business partner, and a mother to their four children. One is in high school, two are in elementary school and the youngest is not yet of school-going age. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She and her husband work hard to meet their daily living expenses.

Lucia operates an upholstery business. She has been in this kind of business for 20 years already. She also sells fish on weekends on the side. Her earnings helped a lot in sending her children to school and meeting their daily needs.  Her customers are her neighbors, the people in the community and the passersby from other communities.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan, which she will use to buy materials like fabric, nails, foam and other materials needed in her business.
 
Lucia aims to maintain and grow her business.  She dreams of giving her children the best education possible to ensure them of a better future. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week and finds strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy materials like fabric, nails, foam and other materials

loans.name: Oseas

texts.en:
Oseas, 53 and a father of five, resides at Aurora Zamboanga del Sur with his family. As a farmer for many years, he was able to support his family. It is his main source of income.

Oseas used his previous loans from Gata Daku MPC for his farm and successfully repaid them. He borrowed a new loan to purchase organic fertilizer to restore nutrients to his soil. He is looking forward to the possibility of having more income to use for the renovation of his house.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer to restore soil nutrients

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has a clothing retail business in the Philippines and earns additional income from frozen foods.  Maricel is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF in order to buy more blouses, pants and other ready-to-wear clothing to sell.

Maricel has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more blouses, pants and other ready-to-wear clothing to sell.

loans.name: Analisa

texts.en: To have an additional source of income, Analisa has been engaged in a hog-raising business within her community. She is 43 years old and blessed with three children. Due to the high cost of commodities and school fees, she wants to make her business profitable to generate sufficient income. Having insufficient capital, she would like to avail herself of a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy feed, vaccines and vitamins for her hogs. She is hoping that someday she will further improve the business and sustain the necessities of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccines and vitamins for her hogs.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en: Zenaida is married and operates a general store in their village to earn a living. She earns better income from this business while her husband worked in a private company. She successfully repaid her previous loan used for buying goods. She has found ways to improve her business in order to have a better source of income. She borrowed a new loan recently to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. In the future, she wants to improve the general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Isabel Shirley

texts.es:
Isabel es una mujer de 22 años de edad, soltera, sin hijos y su negocio es la venta de laptops y celulares a crédito.
Ella es emprendedora, fuerte, luchadora, constante, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la zona de Chijini Pampa un lugar caracterizado por su entrada folclórica anual dónde cientos de bailarines se dan cita cada año para danzar y demostrar su fé a la patrona de la zona.
Isabel es de tez morena, estatura mediana, cabello negro largo, su lengua materna es el aymara el cual ya no utiliza más que con su familia, habla español para poder dedicarse al comercio. Su negocio es una tienda de computadoras, laptops, celulares que los vende a crédito para que sus clientes realicen el pago en cómodas cuotas mensuales.
Su vida la comparte con sus padres y tres hermanos, ella por ser la mayor debe ayudar con los gastos de su hogar, también le dedica tiempo al estudio superior en la escuela normal de El Alto, ella estudia para ser profesora de primaria. Ella sueña tener una tienda más grande donde poder ofrecer mayor variedad de productos, también se esfuerza por terminar su carrera y poder ejercerla.
Es por esos motivos que Isabel solicita un préstamo para la compra de artículos electrónicos por mayor e incrementar su capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
Isabel is a 22-year-old woman. She is single, doesn’t have children, and her business is selling laptops and cell phones on credit.

She is enterprising, strong, a fighter, persevering, responsible, and very hard working. She does her work in the area of Chijini Pampa, a place characterized by its annual folk dance festival where hundreds of dancers meet every year to dance and show their faith for the patron saint of the area.

Isabel has brown skin, is of average height, and has long black hair. Her mother tongue is Aymara, which isn’t used much except with her family; she speaks Spanish when she is working. Her business is a store for computers, laptops, and cell phones, which she sells on credit so that her clients can make payments in easy monthly installments.

She shares her life with her parents and three siblings. Since she is the oldest, she helps with the household expenses. She also spends time studying in the teaching school in El Alto. She is studying to become a primary school teacher. She dreams of having a larger store where she will be able to offer a larger variety of products. She also works to finish her degree and be able to work as a teacher.

It is for these reasons that Isabel requests a loan to buy electronics wholesale and to increase the capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy electronics wholesale and to increase capital for her business.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
This is Susana, 52, a resident of Coron, Palawan Philippines. She is married to Servillano, a driver and has one child. She manages her own household while operating the business.  She works hard to continually provide income to meet her family’s daily personal and household needs.
 
Susana operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a 5 PHP-worth of cooking oil, or an egg.  She earns by  buying  supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house.  Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 600 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business and increase her sales she is requesting an 11,000 PHP loan.  She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.  This will definitely boost her income as she expands her business. 

Susana hopes to be able to grow her business and give her family a better life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, beverages and toiletries needed for her General Store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Sarom

texts.en:
Sarom is a 47-year-old, married woman. She has four dependent children who are currently in school and she also has one married child. She lives in a small village of Pursat Province, Cambodia. To make a living and support her family, she manages and operates a farming business, growing rice and selling the crops to local dealers.

Sarom wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in her house now. Therefore, she is taking a loan from Kiva to build a latrine. By doing this, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. 

She is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Kanees

texts.en:
Kanees is a 50-year-old woman who lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her child. Her husband has been working in a public sector organization for many years; he is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the family. Kanees is also providing sewing services and earns an income to contribute with her husband to manage the household. 

She needs different kinds of goods like needles, threads, pieces of cloth, machine oil, etc. for her business, but due to insufficient financial means, she is unable to purchase these accessories. Therefore, she has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase the accessories she needs and will also help her to increase her monthly sales and profit because she will be providing better sewing services.

Kanees is very thankful to Kiva and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase needles, threads, pieces of cloth, machine oil, etc. for her tailoring business

loans.name: Salote

texts.en:
Salote is 58 years old and a widow with 7 children. She owns and operates a small store, selling a variety of items. She has been doing this for 10 years. Salote needs a loan to buy snacks, frozen goods, soft drinks, canned food, sacks of onions, potatoes and a new chest freezer. She hopes to use her profits to pay for the renovation of her house and help pay for her children's education. 

She became a member of SPBD in 2004 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy snacks, frozen goods, soft drinks, canned food, sacks of onions, potatoes and a new chest freezer.

loans.name: Faimeaalii

texts.en:
Faimeaalii is 40 years old and unmarried with 4 children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 2 years. 

Faimeaalii needs a loan to buy a spade, overalls, chemicals, crops, a wheelbarrow and a machete. 

She has been a member of SPBD since 2012. Faimeaalii will use the profits from her sales to pay for her families weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy a spade, overalls, chemicals, crops, a wheelbarrow and a machete.

loans.name: Rosario Marleni

texts.es:
La socia Rosario Marleni se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de productos de belleza,la socia vende lapiz labiales,cremas y perfumes,por medio de este negocio la socia quiere salir adelante.La socia solicita el credito para comprar lapiz labiales y cremas.


La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Rosario Marleni continues to run her cosmetics business and sell lipstick, creams, and perfumes to earn a living and improve her financial situation. She is applying for a loan to purchase lipstick and creams. 

Rosario Marleni is pleased that she's able to obtain a loan and committed to repaying it.

loans.use: to purchase lipstick and creams.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay tuition fees for her son who wants to pursue a masters degree in Public Administration.

loans.name: Nimrod

texts.en: Nimrod is married and is residing in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur with his family. He has operated an electronic repair shop for many years to make a living. He was able to provide for the financial needs of his family and to maintain better services in his business. To meet the possible requests of his clients, he has borrowed a loan from Gata Daku MPC micro-credit to buy a variety of accessories used for repairs. He hopes that in the near future his shop and the general living of his family will improve.

loans.use: to buy a variety of accessories used for repairs.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es: Luz Marina es una mujer casada y madre de tres hijos adultos, que habitan en el municipio de Soledad,  donde tiene un pequeño taller de confecciones,  el cual inició cuando trabajando como empleada en casa de familia, una amiga le propuso hacer un curso de costura, y ella decidida empezó a aprender, hasta que llegó a emprender su propia aventura empresarial. Su principal línea son las confecciones de ropa de dormitorio, como sabanas, fundas, cubrelechos etc. Luz Marina vende directamente a su clientela, quienes son sus vecinos y sus amigos, comprando en el centro de la ciudad,  a los almacenes que le ofrecen el mejor precio, para trasladárselo a sus productos y hacerlos mas competitivos. Su meta principal es mejorar la imagen del negocio y aumentar sus ingresos, para que estos  impulsen el mejoramiento de su calidad de vida. Pero las fuentes de financiación,  son insuficientes para lograr sus sueños de manera inmediata. Esta es la razón por la cual, Luz Marina,  acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la  Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprara tela, hilo y pellón en mayor volumen, con esta inversión su negocio mejorará, pues incrementará sus inventarios de tal manera, que lograría aumentar  sus ventas.
texts.en:
Luz Marina is married and the mother of three grown children. She and her family live in the town of Soledad, where Luz Marina runs a sewing workshop. She began sewing for a family that employed her, and a friend suggested that she take a tailoring course. Luz Marina decided to try, and learned enough to go into business for herself. Her main product line is sheets, pillowcases, blankets, and other types of bedding. 

Luz Marina sells directly to customers, who are her friends and neighbors. She purchases raw materials from the warehouses in the city center that offer the best prices, then uses these materials to make products that can compete in the marketplace. Her main goal is to improve the image of her business and boost sales as the higher income will improve her quality of life. But Luz Marina lacks access to credit that would be sufficient to meet her short-term goals. She is therefore applying for a Kiva loan, the first time she's applied for funds from the  Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. Luz Marina plans to use the loan funds to purchase greater quantities of fabric, thread, and blankets. These investments will improve her business, allow her to expand her inventory, and boost sales.

loans.use: to purchase fabric, thread, and sheepskin blankets in greater quantities.

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en: Leonida is 47 years old and married. She owns and manages a small retail store within her community to help her family income. She has been in this business for almost three years. She aims to further improve her business and generate sufficient income but she has no enough capital. For this reason, Leonida wants to access financial assistance from KIVA lenders amounting to PHP25,000.00 to buy more snack foods, canned goods, noodles, soft drinks, laundry soaps, candies, beverages, seasonings and vegetables to resell. Having this financial assistance, she believes that someday, she will make her business more profitable.

loans.use: to buy more snack foods, canned goods, noodles, soft drinks, laundry soaps, candies, beverages, seasonings and vegetables to resell

loans.name: Bunthy

texts.en: Bunthy is 22 years old, a student and also a worker in a pure drinking water factory. His major at university is Business Administration. He lives with his parents in Svay Reang Province of Cambodia. He can earn $4 a day. Because of a lack of financial support, Bunthy would like to request a loan to pay for his tuition fee. This loan will help him graduate. In the future, he is going to find a better job with better salary to improve his living.

loans.use: to pay for his tuition fee

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 54 years old and married with five children, one of whom is in school.

She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Delia is borrowing PHP 26,000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Delia has been farming sugarcane for thirty years and also earns additional income from fish vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Kabuswa Moricho Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photo is Catherine. She is a member of Kabuswa Moricho Group. She is 52 years old and a mother of 12 children. 

She earns her living by running a tailoring business. She is proud to have acquired Hand in Hand Eastern Africa’s training on enterprise development and financial management.  

She is borrowing a loan to enable her to expand her tailoring business by buying more tailoring materials such as textiles and sewing threads.  She hopes this will enable her to meet the rising demand for clothing, hence an increased income. This will help her support her family needs such as food and education for her children.

Catherine is happy with this loan and grateful to Kiva and their lenders for this help and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: To purchase sewing thread and textiles.

loans.name: Ma. Luisa

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Ma. Luisa works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines and earns additional income from raising livestock.  Ma. Luisa is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

Ma. Luisa has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Emmanuel Women Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photo is Margret, a member of Emmanuel Women Group. She is 37 years old and a mother of four children. 

She earns her living by selling second hand clothes. She is proud to have acquired Hand in Hand Eastern Africa’s training in enterprise development and financial management. She is borrowing a loan to enable her to expand her clothing enterprise.  She hopes this will enable her to meet the rising demand for her products, hence increasing her income. This will help her support her family's needs such as food and education.

Margret is happy with this loan and grateful to Kiva and their lenders for this help and support.

loans.use: To add more stock of second hand clothes.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
The person in the photo is Alice. She is 39 years old and blessed with two children. 

She does potato farming. She has benefited from the training provided by Hand in Hand Eastern Africa on enterprise creation and financial management. She is borrowing a loan to purchase fertilizer and other farm inputs such as certified planting seeds to boost her crop yield. This will enable her to increase her sales and her income. She hopes to meet her family's needs such as food and education without much struggle.

Alice is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay her loan promptly.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Saidbasir

texts.ru: Саидбасиру 18 лет. Он студент 1 курса Таджикского Государственного Университета. Он очень трудолюбивый и успешный студент. В свободное время он увлекается спортом и компьютерными играми. Его родители простые рабочие. Доход его родителей не позволяет оплатить за его учебу в университете. Он запрашивает займ для оплаты учебы. Он ждет вашу доброту. Будущем он мечтает стать хорошим специалистом.
texts.en: Saidbasir is 18 and a first-year student at Tajik State University. He is a very hardworking and successful student who plays sports and computer games in his free time and wants to have a good career in the future. His parents are simple workers whose salaries don't allow them to pay their son's education costs; therefore, he is requesting a loan to cover his university tuition. He awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to pay his university tuition

loans.name: Firuz

texts.ru: Фируз честный молодой человек. Ему 20 года. Он не женат и живет с родителями. Фируз данное время является студентом 3 курса Таджикского Государственного Университета. Он учится по специальности экономиста. Фируз поступил в университет в 2011 году и в течение этих лет, он учится хорошо и отлично. Фируз еще со школьной скамьи мечтал стать экономистом и упорно учился. Он должен оплатить за учебный договор, но не имеет денег для этого. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Firuz is an honest young man of 20. He is not married and lives with his parents. He is a third-year economics student at Tajik State University. Firuz enrolled in university in 2011 and since then he has received both good and excellent grades. He has dreamed of becoming an economist since he was in school and studied hard since then. He needs to pay his university tuition but doesn't have enough money. He awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to pay his university tuition

loans.name: Umeda

texts.ru: Умеда жизнерадостная женщина. Она заботливая мать 5 детей. Ее муж трудовой мигрант в Российской Федерации и поэтому вся семейная забота лежит на нее. Умеда более 17 лет работает в средней школе. Она учительница и имеет большой опыт в сфере педагогической деятельности. Она имеет свою методику преподавания, и ее ученики очень уважают ее. Умеда обеспечивает очень большую семью. Кроме 5 детей еще ее родители мужа живут с ней. Они пенсионеры. Несмотря на все финансовые трудности, ее сын учится в университете за границей. Она должна оплатить за учебный договор своего сына и поэтому она запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 долларов США. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Umeda is a cheerful woman and the caring mother of five children. Her husband is a migrant worker in Russia and therefore her whole family relies on her to make ends meet. For more than 17 years Umeda has been working as a high school teacher. She has a great deal of pedagogical experience and her own methods of teaching, and her students respect her very much. Umeda takes care of a very large family. Besides her five children, her husband's parents, who are retired, live with her as well. Despite all these financial challenges, her son is studying at a university abroad and she needs to pay his tuition, which is why she is seeking a loan of $3,000 USD. She awaits your kindness and hopes for your charity.

loans.use: to pay her son's university tuition

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to improve access to water and sanitation for their family

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase chicks, stock feed and vaccines.

loans.name: Sokchab

texts.en:
Sokchab is 22 years old and a student at a university. His major is Information Technology. He is single and lives with his parents in Pursat Province of Cambodia.

Because of a lack of financial support, Sokchab would like to request a loan to pay for his tuition fee.  This loan will help him graduate. In the future, he is going to find a good job.

loans.use: to pay for his tuition fee

loans.name: Loyce

texts.en: Loyce is a married woman with two children. She describes herself as humble. She operates a beauty salon where she offers beauty services. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are ladies. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of beauty products for use in the salon. Her business goal is to expand within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy more stock of beauty products

loans.name: Mira

texts.en:
Mira is 48 years old, and widowed with four children, one of whom is in school. Mira works very hard to provide for them.

Mira runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Mira has been in this business for 29 years and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, canned goods, noodles and other miscellaneous items. 

In the future Mira would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase goats, vaccines and feed for the fattening of the goats.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase chicks and feed in order to expand her fowl run.

loans.name: Melissa

texts.en:
Melissa is 18 years old and is the 4th of six children in the family. 

She is borrowing 6,000 PHP to pay for tuition fees of the first semester of the school year 2014-15.  Melissa is currently in the 3rd year of her four-year Bachelor of Elementary Education course.

When she graduates, Melissa plans to be gainfully employed.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees

loans.name: Kimanga Group

texts.en:
Amina is aged in her thirties and has got two daughters who are at school. She is married and supporting her family by running two businesses.

Her first business is a pub where she sells soft and alcoholic drinks. A beauty salon is her second project, which she opened with the returns from the pub. Amina sells more than 5 crates of drinks per day and this is good since she is able to realize a good monthly profit. Her business starts working from 8:00 a.m. to midnight daily. 

From Tujijenge Tanzania, this is her fifth credit cycle to be apportioned among Kimanga, a two-member group. The members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.  Amina used the previous credits to expand her pub place and bought drinks together with salon work equipment. She has paid back all loans successfully. She managed to receive extra income which she used to build a house, paid school fees, for home food expenses and to plow back into her businesses.

Amina will invest her new credit to buy more drinks for her business. By doing this, she will be able to be supplied with free transport and with more choices. Her dream is to be successful in business.

loans.use: to buy more drinks for her business

loans.name: Zuhro

texts.ru: Зухро родилась в 1962 году. Она добрая и трудолюбивая женщина. Зухро имеет высшее педагогическое образование. Она преподает русский язык в средней школе. Зухро мать 2 детей. Ее старшему ребенку 27 лет, а младшему 17 лет. Ее муж трудовой мигрант в Российской Федерации. Зухро всегда заботится об образовании своих детей. Ее младший сын в этом году окончил среднюю школу и поступил в университет. Зухро хочет, чтобы ее сын стал высококвалифицированным специалистом. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 2000 долларов США для оплаты учебного договора своего сына. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Zuhro was born in 1962. She is a kind and hardworking woman who has a higher education in pedagogy and teaches Russian language at a high school. Zuhro is the mother of two children aged 27 and 17. Her husband is a migrant worker in Russia. She has always been concerned with her children's education and this year, her younger son graduated from high school and entered university. Zuhro wants him to become a highly qualified specialist and is requesting a loan of $2,000 USD to pay his tuition. She awaits your kindness and hopes for your charity.

loans.use: to pay for her son's education

loans.name: Anusha

texts.ru: Ануша молодая и жизнерадостная женщина. Она родилась в 1996 году. Ануша студентка первого курса. Она учится по специальности экономиста. Ануша старается учиться хорошо и получать отличные оценки. Ануша не замужем и живет с родителями. Ее родители простые рабочие и имеют маленькую зарплату. Ануша нуждается вашей финансовой поддержке, чтобы оплатить за учебный договор. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Anusha is a young and cheerful woman who was born in 1996. She is a first-year student majoring in economics who tries to study hard and receive excellent grades. Anusha is not married and lives with her parents, who are simple workers with small salaries. She needs your financial support to pay her tuition. She awaits your kindness and hopes for your charity.

loans.use: to pay her university tuition

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is a hard working mother who engages in buying and reselling fruits and vegetables within the local community. She is 62 years old, married and has only one child. 

Due to financial hardship, she wants to make her business profitable in order to help her husband in sustaining the necessities of their family. She wants to acquire more stocks of fruits and vegetables to sell but she doesn't have enough capital. For this reason, she would like to take a loan of PHP 20,000 to purchase more stocks of ginger, beans, tomatoes, eggplants, squash and bananas to resell. 

She is hoping that she will get her requested amount to be able for her to improve the business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of ginger, beans, tomatoes, eggplants, squash and bananas to resell.

loans.name: David

texts.en: David is a married man with two children. He describes himself as optimistic. He operates a chemist store where he sells drugs. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in an urban area. He describes his biggest business challenge as lack of funds. He will use the KES 80,000 loan to buy more stocks of drugs to sell. His business goal is to have a wholesale business within 5 years. He hopes that in the future he will have a better life. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stocks of drugs to sell

loans.name: Javed Akhtar

texts.en:
Javed Akhtar is a 33-year-old married man, living along with his family in the area of Gujrat, Pakistan. He is a farmer by profession and likes to cultivate rice every season. He has been hiring a rice harvesting machine and paying huge rent for it. He has sold his last season’s rice crops and wants to buy his own machine but does not have enough money. Therefore, Javed Akhtar has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of the loan amount he will buy a rice cultivation machine so he can avoid paying huge rent. 
Javed Akhtar thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a rice cultivation machine.

loans.name: Ahélé

texts.fr:
-   
Demeurant  à  Lomé dans le quartier Adidogomé,  Ahélé  est  âgée de 34 ans. Elle est mariée  et  mère  de 3 enfants  .  Ahélé   vend  des produits en   alimentation générale. Elle   s’approvisionne  2 fois par  mois  au  grand marché de lomé et  revend  devant sa maison  . Ahélé sollicite un prêt pour agrandir  son commerce et faire plus bénéfice.
texts.en: Ahélé is 34 years old and lives in the Adidogomé neighborhood of Lomé. She is married and the mother of three children. Ahélé sells groceries. She buys her supplies twice a month in the Grand Market of Lomé. She resells her goods in front of her house. She is asking for a loan in order to grow her business and increase her revenue.

loans.use: buy three bags of rice, two boxes of sugar, and three containers of oil.

loans.name: Mogoon Women Group

texts.en: The person standing on the left side on the photograph is Martha, a member of Mogoon Women Group. She is sixty-six years old, married and blessed with five children and two grandchildren. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa so as to benefit from training on enterprise development and financial management. This has helped her improve her knowledge in business management. Her economic activity is dairy farming. She needs a loan to buy higher-quality fodder for her cows. This will increase their milk production and help Martha satisfy the increased demand for milk in Nakuru. She hopes this will increase her income in order to continue supporting her family and in the long run improve their living conditions such as quality education for her children. Martha is very grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the help and support.

loans.use: To buy fodder.

loans.name: Magnodewa

texts.fr:
_ -  
Magnodewa âgée de  38ans célibataire  résident à Adidogomé. Elle  vend  des  poissons. Elle s'approvisionne 2 fois par mois à la  frontière Togo-Ghana et revend au   marché assiyéyé. Magnodewa sollicite ce crédit pour agrandir son commerce afin de faire plus de profit
texts.en: Magnodewa is 38 years old and lives in Adidogomé. She sells fish. She buys her supplies twice a month on the Togo-Ghana border. She resells her goods in the Assiyéyé market. Magnodewa is asking for a loan to grow her business and increase her profits.

loans.use: buy four baskets of fish.

loans.name: Abra

texts.fr:
-   
célibataire âgée de 38 ans, Abra  réside à  Adidogomé. Elle vend  des merceries. Elle  s'approvisionne une fois  par mois au  grand marché de lomé. Elle  revend dans une boutique. Abra sollicite ce crédit pour agrandir son commerce afin de satisfaire sa clientèle et  faire plus de profit.
texts.en: Abra is 38 years old and is single. She lives in Adidogomé. She sells sewing supplies. She buys her supplies once a month in the Grand Market of Lomé. She resells her goods in a shop. Abra is asking for a loan in order to grow her business, satisfy her clientele, and increase her profits.

loans.use: buy nine rolls of poplin and eight packs of zippers.

loans.name: Ami

texts.fr:
- 
célibataire âgée de 35 ans, Ami  réside à  Adidogomé. Elle vend  des mèches et tissages. Elle  s'approvisionne 2 fois  par mois au  grand marché de lomé. Elle  revend dans une boutique. Ami sollicite ce crédit pour agrandir son commerce afin de satisfaire sa clientèle et  faire plus de profit.
texts.en: Ami is 35 years old and lives in Adidogomé. She sells hair extensions and weaves. She buys her supplies twice a month in the Grand Market of Lomé. She resells her goods in a shop. Ami is asking for a loan to grow her business, satisfy her clientele, and increase her profits.

loans.use: buy 45 hair extensions and 23 weaves.

loans.name: Mary Jean

texts.en:
Mary Jean is a married woman with four children. She is 45 years old and all of her children are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Mary Jean has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for eight years. Mary Jean requested a 29,000 Philippine peso loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) in order to purchase more groceries like snack foods, canned goods and school supplies.

In the future, Mary Jean would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries like snack foods, canned goods and school supplies.

loans.name: Claudia Claribel

texts.es:
Claudia de 25 años de edad, estudio hasta octavo grado, esta casada y su esposo reside en estados unidos. Ella vive con sus dos hijos pequeños; una niña de 6 años y un niño de 2 años y su hermano de 18 años.

Claudia tiene un pequeño negocio de crianza de pollos de engorde desde hace seis meses y hasta la vez le ha generado buenos ingresos, ella aprendio este oficio porque trabajo con un vecino que se dedica a eso, y se dio cuenta que era rentable anteriormente solo trabajaba como ayudante.

El prestamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar concentrado y algunos materiales que necesita para sus pollos como vacunarlos, y quiere arreglar la galera para proteger a los pollos contra la lluvia.

A ella el préstamo le mejorara su negocio, su calidad de vida ya que cuida a su familia al mismo tiempo que lograra sustentar los gastos del hogar y ayudar a su hermano y sus dos hijos en los estudios.
texts.en:
Claudia, who is 25 years old, went to school through eighth grade. She is married, and her husband lives in the United States. She lives with her two little children, a girl of 6 and a boy of 2, and her 18-year-old brother.

Claudia has a little business of raising chickens to fatten. She has been doing this for six months, and up to now it has generated good income for her. She learned this work because she worked with a neighbor who did the same thing, and she noticed that it was profitable. In the past she only worked as an assistant.

The loan that she is applying for is to buy concentrated feed and some materials that she needs for her chickens, such as vaccinating them, and she wants to repair the chicken coop to protect her chickens from the rain.

For her, the loan will improve her business and their quality of life, since she cares for her family at the same time that she manages to sustain the household expenses and help her brother and her two children in their schooling.

loans.use: to buy concentrated feed and some materials that she needs for her chickens, such as vaccinating them, and to repair the chicken coop to protect the chickens from rain.

loans.name: Elvin Jose

texts.es: Don Elvin de 34 años de edad, labora para la municipalidad como operario de Limpieza proviene de familia muy humilde y de bajos recursos económicos ha luchado para brindar lo mejor a su familia en la actualidad habita en casa de su mamá con su familia.  El crédito anterior fue invertido en construcción de un cuarto en casa de su mamá donde habita, esta vez necesita crédito para ir comprando materiales de construcción como cemento, arena, hierro, él ya cuenta con una parte de piedras canteras;la idea es que cuando tenga cierta cantidad de materiales posteriormente empezar la construcción de su vivienda en su propio terreno que compro con ahorros y esfuerzos propios donde habitara él y sus familia, como todo padre obligado con sus hijos lucha a diario para darles lo mejor a sus seres queridos.
texts.en: 34-year-old Elvin works for the municipality as a cleaning operator. He comes from a humble family with few economic resources.
