He has fought to bring his family the best and he currently lives in his mother's house with his family. The previous loan was invested in the construction of a room in his mother's house where he lives. This time, he needs the loan to buy construction materials like cement, sand, and iron. He already has some of the stones. After he obtains a certain quantity of the materials he will begin construction of his own home on his own land that he bought with his savings and hard work. As a father, he has an obligation to his children to work hard every day in order to give better things to his loved ones.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for his house.

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr:
Cette femme fait partie du banc villageois qui a été créé le  21 décembre 2012. Il est composé de membres ayant une bonne cohésion sociale. Leurs principales activités sont le commerce et l’embouche. 
Fatou âgée de 52 ans, est mariée et mère de 8 enfants dont 4 filles qui sont toutes mariées.
Avec le prêt, elle envisage faire de l'embouche ovine. Elle va acheter des moutons. Elle achète aussi de l'aliment de bétail pour engraisser les sujets qu'elle compte revendre après élevage.
Les bénéfices sont utilisés pour les besoins de la famille, l'achat de fournitures scolaires, de nourriture pour la famille.
texts.en:
This woman is part of the banc villageois that was created on December 21, 2012.  It is comprised of members who get along well with one another. Their primary business activities include trading and fattening sheep. 

Fatou is 52 years old, married, and the mother of eight children. Four of her children are girls and they are all married. 

With the loan, she plans on fattening sheep. She will buy sheep. She also buys livestock feed to fatten the animals that she will resell after she raises them. 

The profits will be used to meet the needs of her family, to buy school supplies, and to buy food for the family.

loans.use: to buy sheep.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To make bulk purchases of sugar, salt, candles, washing bars, toothpaste and flour.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase chicks and feed in order to expand her business to produce 100 birds every two weeks.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is 47 years old and the widowed mother of three children. She works hard to provide for her family. Corazon runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for eight years and also earns an income from farming rice and fattening pigs. 

Corazon has requested a 15,000 Philippine peso loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) in order to purchase more stock of groceries to sell. She has borrowed and repaid 15 loans from NWTF before this loan. Corazon hopes to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Adonaï (1) Group

texts.en:
Five years ago Rodia was able to start his own drink depot selling cases of water, soda and various other juices in bulk and individually. Only 34 years old, Rodia supports a family of five including his wife and three young children all under the age of seven. Transportation of drinks always poses a problem for Rodia--drivers charge a tax per case of drinks and it can often be difficult to find willing drivers in the first place.

Rodia is full of business savvy however, and overcomes his transportation challenges by befriending drivers that he can call upon later. He has gained a loyal clientele by being welcoming and continues to grow his business by handing out business cards with his contact information for customers to pass along. In 2012, Rodia joined the community bank group AdonaiÏ (1) with HOPE Congo. Rodia is the leader of a subgroup of nine other micro-entrepreneurs in Brazzaville, the Republic of Congo. Now on his seventh loan cycle with HOPE Congo, Rodia would like to take out a loan of 450,000 CFA so that he can purchase additional drinks in bulk.

Eventually Rodia dreams of being able to go even further with his business to the point where he can start importing drinks from foreign countries. By growing his business, Rodia hopes to be able to build and own his own house so that his family no longer has to rent space.

loans.use: to purchase additional soft drinks for his distribution center.

loans.name: Marcela Beatriz

texts.es:
Marcela de 38 años de edad, estudio hasta 6° de educación básica, está casada, su esposo vive en el extranjero, tiene dos hijos uno vive con ella y el otro tiene su propio hogar.

Marcela desde muy pequeña trabajo con su tía, tenía un puesto en el mercado en donde ella barría, lavaba los platos y hacia otras actividades, todo esto al salir de la escuela cuando aún estudiaba. Hoy tiene en su casa un negocio en el que vende helados, aprendió de su esposo que se dedicaba a dicha actividad y decidió poner su propio negocio que desde hace 5 años maneja Marcela.

El préstamo será utilizado para comprar 2 refrigeradoras y reemplazar las que ya tiene, están muy dañadas y no se puede arriesgar a que le fallen teniendo producto.

Marcela espera ampliar su negocio, pues lo único que la detenía era el mantenimiento de su equipo y que será reemplazado tiene vía libre.
texts.en:
Marcela, who is 38 years old, went to school through the 6th grade of basic education. She is married, and her husband lives abroad. She has two children. One lives with her, and the other has his own household.

When she was very little, Marcela worked with her aunt, who had a stall in the market, where she swept, washed the dishes, and did other tasks, all this after school, even when she was going to school. Now she has a business in her house where she sells ice cream. She learned this work from her husband, who was working in this business and decided to set up their own business, which Marcela has run for 5 years.

The loan will be used to buy two refrigerators and replace the ones that she has. They are very damaged, and she can't risk that they fail when they contain her products.

Marcela hopes to expand her business, since the only thing that is holding her back is the maintenance of her equipment, and when it is replaced, she will have a clear path.

loans.use: to buy two refrigerators

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is a single woman. She has two children with ages ranging from four years to eight years. She describes herself to be trustworthy and obedient. She operates a beauty salon where she offers beauty services. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a populated area and her primary customers are ladies. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low stock of beauty products. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more beauty products for use in the salon. Her business goal is to expand within five years. She hopes that in the future she will expand her business and improve her living standards. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more beauty products for use in the salon.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel is a married man. He has 6 children with ages ranging from 7 years to 21 years. He describes himself as humble and trustworthy. Daniel operates a retail business where he sells tree seedlings. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. His business is located in a busy area, and his primary customers are individuals. His biggest business challenge is lack of funds. He will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more seeds. His business goal is to expand within 5 years. This is Daniel's second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank; his previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more seeds.

loans.name: Norma Evelin Del Carmen

texts.es:
Norma de 44 años de edad, estudio hasta 3° grado de educación básica, está acompañada y su pareja se dedica a trabajar con estructuras metálicas como puertas y balcones. Tiene 3 hijos, dos trabajan y la menor estudia bachillerato.

Norma empezó a trabajar desde los 15 años con su madre, le trabajaban a una señora en el mercado y les pagaba $4.00 dólares el día. Desde hace 8 años tiene un negocio que nicio gracias a su madre, vende tortillas todos los días.

El préstamo será utilizado para comprar láminas y pagar mano de obra para reparar el techo de su casa, se filtra el agua y le urge repararlo.

Norma espera mejorar su casa, para dar a su hija un techo digno además del estudio al que ella no pudo acceder.
texts.en:
Norma is 44 years old. She went to school up to the third grade of primary school. She is married and her spouse works with metallic structures such as doors and balconies. She has 3 children. Two of them work and the youngest is in high school.  

Norma started to work when she was 15 years old. She worked for a woman in the market who paid $4.00 a day. For eight years she has had a business that she started thanks to her mother. She sells tortillas every day. 

The loan will be used to buy sheeting and to pay for labor to repair the roof on her house. Water is leaking in and it needs to be repaired urgently. 

Norma hopes to improve her house to give her daughter worthy shelter as well as an education that she wasn't able to access.

loans.use: to buy sheeting and to pay for labor to repair the roof on her house.

loans.name: Marta Yolanda

texts.es: Marta de 52 años de edad desde hace varios años posee una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia, tiene mucha clientela por los buenos precios y la variedad de productos, Marta vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida el cual le ayuda en los gastos del hogar, marta está solicitando un crédito para la compra de azúcar, sal, leche, detergentes, golosinas, refrescos, etc. para surtir mas la tienda y asi tener junto con su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Marta, 52, has had a small store in her house for several years.  She has a lot of customers because she offers good prices and a variety of products.  Marta lives in her own house with her life partner, who helps her with the household expenses.

Marta's requesting a loan to buy sugar, salt, milk, detergent, snacks, soft drinks, and so on to stock her store more.  That way she'll have a better quality of life with her family.

loans.use: to buy sugar, salt, milk, detergent, snacks, soft drinks, and so on

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase chicks and feed in order to expand the fowl run.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a chair to examine clients.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of potatoes and sweet potatoes

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en: Rosemarie is a hog-raiser and farmer within her local community. She has been a widow for four years yet she is still grateful because she has her children with her. Rosemarie currently raises rice crops and six hogs for sale. She wants to make her hogs healthier upon reaching their optimum size but her capital is not enough. For this reason she is seeking for a loan of PHP 15,000 which will be uses to buy five sacks of hog feed and vitamins. She believes that through sustaining her hogs with a complete amount of hog feed and vitamins she could earn a higher price. She is looking forward to having continuous access to financial support to improve her hog-raising and farming business.

loans.use: to purchase vitamins and five sacks of feed for her hogs.

loans.name: Dante

texts.en: "Hard work and patience" has been Dante's guiding principle in improving his variety store business.  He is 61-years-old, married and had four children.  Three of them settled for marriage while the other one left is still single yet working.  Aside from the variety store, he also has a 2,000 square meters of a vegetable garden which serves as an additional source of income for his family.  Dante is planning to purchase grocery items such as soft drinks, canned goods, sugar and cooking oil to sell, but he suffers from a shortage of capital.  In this connection, he is expecting a loan of PHP 5,000 which will be used in supplying all his customers' demands.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items such as soft drinks, canned goods, sugar and cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Judith

texts.en: Judith is a single woman. She has one child. She describes herself to be trustworthy. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes and other items. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a business friendly location and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of sufficient working capital. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. Her business goal is to be prosperous within 5 years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Alex

texts.en: Alex is a single man. He describes himself to be focused and disciplined. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for 3 years. His primary customers are the general public. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the rainy season which affects business. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy another motorcycle. His business goal is to own five motorcycles within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will own a taxi. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle

loans.name: Ma. Socorro

texts.en: Ma. Soccorro is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. Ma. Soccorro is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business. NWTF is relisting Ma. Soccorro's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en: Patricia is a 22-year-old businesswoman who has one child. She currently lives in the remote area of Gokwe North, Zimbabwe, where she has been successfully running a grocery shop from her home village. Patricia sells all basic food items including flour, sugar, corn meal and rice. Patricia is a part-time volunteer as a peer educator at the local secondary school. She will use the requested Kiva loan to make bulk purchases of sugar, flour, rice and beans to increase sales and profits.

loans.use: To make bulk purchases of sugar, flour, rice and beans to increase sales and profits.

loans.name: Edwin

texts.es:
Edwin es un hombre de 24 años de edad, soltero, sin hijos y su negocio es el servicio de tornería.
Él es emprendedor, luchador, constante, independiente, responsable y muy trabajador. Su trabajo lo realiza en la zona de El Torno, que se caracteriza por su pintoresco paisaje y su topografía levemente ondulada, cubierta por vegetación tropical; posee una importante riqueza forestal y diversidad de fauna silvestre y es el centro de acopio de una gran variedad de productos del campo. 
Edwin es de tez morena, estatura mediana, cabello negro corto, su lengua materna es el español. Su negocio es la fabricación de piezas de metal para todo tipo de máquinas. Su negocio necesita constantemente material de trabajo, como piezas de metal; metales ferrosos (aceros al carbono, aceros bonificados, aceros inoxidables, etc), metales no ferrosos (aleaciones de aluminio, aleaciones de bronce), plásticos (delrin, polipropileno, etc) y demás (titanio, etc). Su sueño es tener un negocio grande y rentable para mejorar su calidad de vida. 
Es por esos motivos que Edwin solicita un préstamo para la compra de material de trabajo para mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Edwin is 24 years old, single, and has no children. He makes a living offering his services as turner. He is enterprising, tenacious, persevering, independent, responsible, and very hardworking.

He works in the zone of El Torno, which is characterized by its picturesque landscape and slightly undulating topography covered by tropical vegetation. It has an important forest and diversity of wildlife. It is the supply center of a great variety of agricultural produce.

Edwin is tanned, of medium height and short black hair. His native tongue  is Spanish. His business is the production of metal components for all kinds of machines. His work constantly needs materials such as metal pieces, ferrous metals (carbon steels, tempered steels, stainless steels, etc.), non-ferrous metals (aluminum alloys, bronze alloys), plastics (Delrin, polypropylene, etc.) and others (titanium, etc.).

His dream is to have a big and profitable business to improve his quality of life.  With that goal, Edwin is requesting the loan to buy work materials.

loans.use: to buy materials for his work, so as to improve his quality of life.

loans.name: Khawlah

texts.en:
Khawlah is a 49-year-old married woman from a village near Jenin city.  She is a mother of four sons and eight daughters. Khawlah and her husband work as farmers in their own land. They plant seasonal crops and sell them to the local traders. It is a very good business but seasonal.

Khawlah took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her and her husband to buy more seeds and seedlings to increase and improve the farm.  They will be able to also improve the family's living conditions.

Khawlah appears in the photo while she was harvesting a crop.

loans.use: to help her and her husband to buy more seeds and seedlings for their farm

loans.name: Jactone

texts.en: Jactone is married and he has 2 children. He describes himself to be ambitious. For the past 3 years, Jactone has operated a retail business selling bricks, sand and other building materials. His business is located in a competitive location. He describes his biggest business challenges to be lack of capital and transport difficulties. Jactone will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of bricks and building materials to sell. He hopes that, in the future, he will build rental houses. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank; the previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of bricks and building materials to sell

loans.name: Maria De La Paz

texts.es:
María, con el préstamo anterior tuvo recursos económicos para comprarse la materia prima para elaborar la venta de tortillas y antojitos, le ha sido de ayuda para mejorar la productividad y generar más ingresos, sus deudas han sido canceladas y las circunstancias familiares son mejores.
Con el propósito de mantener su negocio funcionando solicita un nuevo préstamo para invertir en la compra de maíz, gas, leña, etc., de esta manera seguirá trabajando y mantendrá a sus clientes satisfechos.
texts.en:
With the previous loan, María had the financial resources to buy the raw material to make and sell tortillas and snacks.  It was a help to her so that she could improve her productivity and generate more income.  She has repaid her debts, and her family circumstances are better.

In order to keep her business functioning, she is requesting a new loan to buy corn, gas, and firewood, etc.  This way she will continue working, and she will keep her customers satisfied.

loans.use: to buy corn, gas, and firewood, etc.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is a married woman. She has 4 children. She describes herself to be good in character. She operates a retail business where she sells grains. She has been involved in this business for 15 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are the general public. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. 

She will use the KES 50,000 loan to pay school fees for her children. Her business goal is to be successful within 5 years. This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to pay school fees

loans.name: Unnyati Mahila Samuha Group

texts.en:
Chunchun, Kosallya, Rekha, Shanti and Pinki formed a group called "Unnyati Mahila Samuha" to help each other and to achieve a better standard of living. Chunchun (with a hand raised) is the featured borrower of this group. 

Chunchun is the mother of four sons. She is a widow; she lost her husband a few years back. After her husband’s death, a vacuum was created. Her elder son is trying to bridge the vacuum. She and her sons are engaged in a decorating business. One of her son runs an auto-rickshaw. Chunchun is carrying on her business in the memory of her husband. She is struggling to increase the volume of the business. She is requesting a loan to buy items in bulk and stock up. She hopes to make some profits and save so that she can renovate their house.

Like Chunchun, the other members are also seeking a loan to improve their livelihood. To improve their businesses on a large scale, they need sufficient capital. So, they seek a loan, which they will invest in their respective endeavors. 

Your loan will help five hardworking and deserving families take a big step towards improving their livelihoods and lives.

loans.use: to buy decorative items for her decorating business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for fabric, cloth, thread, needles and other materials needed in his business.

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es:
María, vive con dos hijas mayores de edad, que le ayudan en su negocio; por necesidad de salir adelante con su familia inicio por cuenta propia su negocio, el cual consiste en vender pupusas, antojitos (tortadas, enchiladas, tamales de gallina y elotes) y flores artificiales, hasta la fecha es su fuente de ingresos y no representa dificultades en administrar el negocio.
Con el crédito que solicita comprara verduras, maíz, elotes, condimentos, etc., para la venta de antojitos, el resto lo utilizara para adquirir alambre y papelería para elaborar las flores, así podrá tener materia prima para mejorar la productividad y calidad de sus productos, la inversión la realiza esperando tener mejores ingresos y un negocio más reconocido.
Sus proyectos son mejorar la rentabilidad del negocio para lograr trabajar con capital propio y mejorar el estilo de vida familiar.
texts.en:
María lives with her two grown daughters who help her in her business. Out of the need to get ahead with her family, she started her own business, which selling pupusas, snacks (tortadas, enchiladas, chicken tamales and corn on the cob) and artificial flowers. So far, it is her source of income and she has had no difficulties managing the business. 

With the loan she is asking for she will buy vegetables, corn corn on the cob, seasonings, etc. for selling snacks. She will use the rest to acquire wire and paper to make the flowers. This way, she will have raw material to improve productivity and the quality of her products. She is making this investment hoping to improve her income and make her business more well known.  

Her projects are to improve the profitability of the business to be able to work with her own capital and improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, corn, corn on the cob, seasonings, etc. for selling snacks. She will use the rest to acquire wire and paper to make flowers.

loans.name: Por La Gracia De Dios Group

texts.es: El grupo está formado por cuatro socias emprendedoras y microempresarias, la cual la coordinadora del grupo es la señora Yadira de 52 años de edad, es soltera y se dedica a la venta  de mercadería en general tales como, calzados para niños, jóvenes  y adultos, también vende cosméticos de la Avon, Zermat etc. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de materia prima y muebles para ubicar su mercadería como vitrinas, etc. Maria Mercedes tiene 43 años y se dedica a la venta de carne; Mariana tiene 27 años y se dedica a la venta de ropa y zapatos y Patricia de 51 años vende cosméticos desde hace 10 años.
texts.en:
The group has four members, enterprising microentrepreneurs.  Yadira, 52, is the coordinator of the group.  She's single and earns a living selling general merchandise such as footwear for men, women, and children.  She also sells Avon, Zermat, and other cosmetics.

Yadira will invest the loan in buying raw material and furniture such as display cases for her merchandise.

María Mercedes, 43, sells meat; Mariana, 27, sells clothing and shoes; and Patricia, 51, has sold cosmetics for 10 years.

loans.use: to buy basic merchandise such as clothing, shoes, and cosmetics

loans.name: Jose Humberto

texts.es:
José, actualmente es soltero, vive con su madre, no tiene parientes en el extranjero, ha aprendido por esfuerzos propios a trabajar en el campo cultivando granos básicos y a comercializar cerdos, de esta manera José genera ingresos con los que puede costear sus gastos personales y apoya a su madre a cubrir las necesidades de su hogar, trabaja desde laS 7:00 a.m. a 3:00 p.m., es apoyado por su mamá. Su ventaja es que trabaja en terrenos propios.
Invertirá en la compra de 2 qq de abono para dar mejor desarrollo a una manzana de terreno cultivada de frijol y 2 qq de concentrado para alimentar a los cerdos, así podrá asegurar una cosecha abundante y cuidar mejor de los cerdos para obtener mejores ganancias, de esta manera mejorar la calidad de vida familiar y cancelar su deuda sin problemas. Los riesgos de su negocio son plagas en los cultivos y enfermedades que afecten la porqueriza.
Sus sueños son mantenerse trabajando, tener un negocio más rentable, mejorar la situación económica, apoyar a su madre y formar un patrimonio para en un futuro poder formar su propia familia y ofrecerles una buena alimentación, educación, vestuario y salud.
texts.en:
José is singe now. He lives with his mother and has no relatives abroad. He learned farm work on his own initiative, growing basic grains and selling pigs. This way, José generates income to pay for his personal expenses and to support his mother cover the household necessities. He works from 7:00 a.m. to  3:00 p.m. and is supported by his mother. The advantage he has is that he works his own land. 

He will invest in buying 2 quintals of fertilizer to give better development to the plot of land planted with beans and 2 quintals of concentrate to feed his pigs. This way, he can ensure an abundant crop and care for his pigs better so he can obtain better profits. This way, he can improve his family's quality of life and pay off his debt with no trouble. The risks to his business are pests in the crops and illnesses that could affect his pigs. 

His dreams are to keep working, have a more profitable business, improve his financial situation, help his mother and have assets so that in the future he can start his own family and offer them good food, education, clothing and health.

loans.use: to buy 2 quintals of fertilizer to have better development on his plot of land planted with beans, and 2 quintals of concentrate to feed the pigs.

loans.name: Raquel Guadalupe

texts.es:
Raquel, ha tenido buenos resultados con la inversión del financiamiento anterior en la tienda que posee, su nueva situación económica le permite tener un mejor estilo de vida familiar y cancelar sus deudas, Raquel ya es madre de un bebe de un mes de nacido.
Se decidió por solicitar un nuevo préstamo para comprar bebidas, especias, golosinas, pan, granos básicos entre otros productos para mejorar el inventario de su tienda, así podrá ofrecer mejor mercadería a sus clientes y mantendrá su fuente de ingresos funcionando.
texts.en:
Raquel had good results from her investment in her store with the previous loan.  Her new financial situation allows her to have a better style of family life and pay back her debts.  She's already the mother of a one-month-old baby.

Raquel decided to request a new loan to buy beverages, spices, snacks, bread, basic grains, and other products to improve the inventory in her store.  That way she'll be able to sell her customers better merchandise and keep her source of income working.

loans.use: to buy beverages, spices, snacks, bread, basic grains, and other products

loans.name: Everlyne

texts.en:
Everlyne, a married mother of two,  describes herself as ambitious. For five years now she has been operating a retail business selling shoes and clothes in a good location. Her biggest business challenge is a lack of finances. 

Everlyne will use this Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stocks of shoes and clothes. She will use the anticipated profits to purchase even more stock.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of shoes and clothes for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy 200 chickens, 10 sacks of concentrate and other products. She will pay for the rent of the land where she has her crops and fertilizer for them.

loans.name: Saye's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 20 membres fait partie du banc villageois qui a été créé le  21 décembre 2012. Il est composé de membres vivant une fraternité exemplaire. Leurs principales activités sont le commerce et l’embouche.
Ndèye, debout à droite de la photo et levant la main, mariée,  est âgée de 42 ans. Elle fait comme activité principale l’embouche ovine.
 
Elle achète les moutons lors des marchés hebdomadaires et aussi  de l'aliment pour bétail; les nourrit pendant une durée de 04 mois puis les revend dans les mêmes marchés ou dans sa localité quand l’occasion se présente. En parallèle, elle fait un commerce de draps. Elle part s’approvisionner dans les grandes ville et elle les revend à sa clientèle dans le village.

Les bénéfices vont lui permettre à renforcer ses activités, son épargne et à payer ses intérêts.
texts.en:
This 20-member group is part of the banc villageois, which was founded on December 21, 2012. The group is comprised of members who have an exemplary relationship. Their primary business activities are trading and fattening. 

Ndèye, standing at the right of the photo with her hand raised, is 42 years old and married. Her main business is fattening sheep. 
 
She buys sheep and livestock feed during the weekly markets. She feeds the animals for four months and then she sells them in the same local markets when the opportunity arises. At the same time, she sells sheets. She buys her supplies in the city and resells to her clients in the village.

The profits will allow her to strengthen her business and savings and pay back her interest.

loans.use: to buy sheets and sheep.

loans.name: Raymond

texts.en:
Raymond, a married father of four, describes himself as self reliant. For seven years now, he has operated a farm in a rural area where he grows tea. His primary customers are small scale, and his biggest business challenge is insufficient funds. 

His previous loans repaid, Raymond has requested his fourth one with SMEP Microfinance Bank for Kes 80,000 loan to buy tea leaves for resale and farm inputs. He hopes that in the future, he will be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy tea leaves for resale and farm inputs

loans.name: Camilo

texts.es:
Camilo, vive con su compañera de vida y una hija de 28 años, es el único que trabaja para cumplir con las responsabilidades del hogar; él se dedica a realizar cultivos de granos básicos, además practica la crianza de ganado y cerdos, estas actividades las heredo de sus padres, la desempeña junto a su familia desde hace 35 años, en un horario de seis de la mañana a tres de la tarde, por su experiencia comenta que son actividades que consumen mucho tiempo y deben realizarse son mucho cuidado.
Con el capital que está solicitando comprara concentrado para ganado e insumos agrícolas, así podrá fortalecer el negocio para incrementar sus ingresos, espera tener más clientes satisfechos  y mejorar el estilo de vida familiar, los riesgos son muchos entre los cuales podemos mencionar: alto costo del alimento para ganado y cerdos, enfermedades en los animales, un mal invierno y plagas en el cultivo.
Sus proyectos son mantenerse trabajando para tener mejores ingresos para dar a su familia un estilo de vida más digno y tener en un futuro un negocio más rentable.
texts.en:
Camilo lives with his life partner and his daughter who is 28 years old. He is the only person that works to meet the responsibilities of his home. He works growing basic grain crops. In addition, he raises livestock and pigs. He inherited these activities from his parents. He has practiced them together with his family for 35 years with a schedule that lasts from 6 in the morning until 3 in the afternoon. Based on his experience he told us that these activities consume a lot of time and that they must be completed with a lot of care. 

With the capital that he is seeking he will buy concentrate for his livestock and agricultural inputs so he can strengthen his business in order to increase his earnings. He hopes to have more satisfied customers and to improve his family's standard of living. There are many risks involved, some of which we can mention: high costs of feed for livestock and pigs, sicknesses among the animals, a bad winter and diseases among his crops. His goals include continuing to work to obtain better earnings, giving his family a standard of living that is more dignified and having a more profitable business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase concentrate for his livestock and agricultural inputs so he can strengthen his business in order to increase his earnings.

loans.name: Rose Marie

texts.en: Rosemarie is 43 years old, married and has four children attending school. Despite the hardship of living, she and her husband want to educate their children so that they will earn a degree and find a good job someday. Due to the high cost of school fees, Rosemarie operates their motorcycle transport while her husband cultivates their farm. To continuously operate her motorcycle, she is in need of additional capital of PHP 25,000 to buy gasoline, spare parts and accessories needed for her motorcycle. Being a patient and industrious mother, she believes that she will generate sufficient income and provide safe transportation for her passengers.

loans.use: to buy gasoline, spare parts and accessories needed for her motorcycle

loans.name: Celina Del Carmen

texts.es:
Celina  de 29 años de edad, madre soltera de una niña de 10 años de edad, quien estudia tercer grado en la escuela de la comunidad. Celina se ha crecido con sus abuelos pues sus padres murieron en la guerra civil que hubo en el país.  Desde pequeña ella ha luchado muy duro para ver de ganar para la comida diaria.

 Actualmente esta estudiando el ultimo año de bachillerato a distancia, ya que tiene que trabajar durante la semana para obtener ingresos para su hija. Con esfuerzos ella ha logrado construir una casa de bloque, pues siempre había soñado vivir aparte con su hija.

Celina trabaja en pequeña escala en la agricultura y hoy ha aprendido hacer huertos caseros (hortalizas de repollo, tomate, chiles y pepino) Gracias al crédito anterior mejoro el piso de la vivienda ya que era de tierra y lo hizo de cemento y arena (fraguado)

También, Celina ha trabajado  en la ciudad en un comedor y ademas lava, plancha ropa en la comunidad a personas ajenas. Hoy en día ella con muchos esfuerzos esta estudiando a distancia y tiene que madrugar para tomar el bus e irse al centro escolar.  

Ahora en día también se dedica a la venta de productos de lencerías por catálogos de donde obtiene ingresos para ir saliendo adelante.

Esta solicitando el préstamo en CREDICAMPO,  para cancelar los gastos de su graduación del bachillerato que esta finalizando a distancia en donde invertirá $300.00 el resto lo necesita para hacer unos pequeños arreglos en la vivienda, pues el piso que anteriormente mejoro con el crédito anterior se le ha dañado una parte y necesita repararlo.

con el crédito Celina, podrá tener una casa mas digna para la familia, pues estará ya prácticamente terminada. 

Celina pretende en el futuro hacer un muro de contención en la vivienda, ademas esta con el objetivo de seguir estudiando y apoyar a su hija con los estudios básicos y prepararla para el futuro.
texts.en:
Celina, age 29, is a single mother.  She has a ten year old daughter, who is in the third grade in the community school.  Celina grew up with her grandparents because her parents died in the country’s civil war.  Ever since she was little, she has struggled very hard to earn her daily food.

She is currently in her last year of high school by distance learning.  She has to work during the week to get income for her daughter.  With effort, she has managed to build a house from cement blocks.  She had always dreamed of living independently with her daughter.

Celina works on a small scale in agriculture.  She has now learned to make home gardens (cabbage, tomatoes, chilies, and cucumbers).  Thanks to the previous loan, she improved the floor of the house.  It was a dirt floor, and she changed it to cement and sand (solidified).

In addition, Celina has worked at an eatery in the city .  She also washes and irons clothes for other people in the community.  

Now, with a lot of effort, she is engaged in distance learning.  She has to get up at dawn in order to take the bus and go to the educational center.  

Nowadays she also sells lingerie by catalog, and this gives her income to get ahead.

She is requesting the loan from CrediCampo to pay for the high school graduation expenses, which she is now completing by distance learning.  She will spend $300 on this.  She needs the rest to make some small repairs to the house.  Part of the floor that she improved with the previous loan has become damaged, and she needs to repair it.  With the loan, Celina will be able to have a more respectable house for her family.  It will almost be finished.

In the future Celina plans to build a retaining wall at the house.  She also has the objectives of continuing to study, to support her daughter in her basic education, and to prepare her for the future.

loans.use: to pay for her high school graduation expenses and to make small repairs on her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, insecticides and seeds to complete the cultivation of  a crop of basic grains just in time.

loans.name: Flor Exelsa

texts.es: Flor es una pequeña comerciante que tiene una pulpería en su vivienda. Es casada, tiene 3 hijos, todos mayores de edad. Su esposo es albañil. Empezó el negocio junto a su hermana, ella anteriormente vendía ropa. El crédito solicitado será para invertir en el negocio, comprará gaseosas, golosinas y pan variado. Espera en un futuro  invertir más en el negocio, obtener más ingresos y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Flor is a small businessperson who has a small store in her house. She is married and has 3 children, all of them adults. Her husband is s bricklayer. She started her business with her sister and used to sell clothing. The loan will be used to invest in her business, buying soft drinks, sweets and a variety of breads. She hopes to invest more in her store in the future to get more revenue and improve the quality of living for her family.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, sweets and a variety of breads.

loans.name: Alba Elizabeth

texts.es:
Alba, está acompañada, tiene una hija, viven todos juntos; no tiene ayuda económica del extranjero, por necesidad de apoyar en los gastos de su hogar, se decidió a vender tortillas, elabora la venta todos los días y sale a vendar de manera ambulante en su colonia, las distribuye en comedores y casas de sus vecinos.
Utilizará el capital para invertir en mejorar la infraestructura de la galera en la que elabora la venta, así trabajara sin tener inconvenientes como la lluvia o el sol, le ayudara a mejorar el servicio, mantener su negocio funcionando y generando los ingresos que necesita para mejorar la calidad de vida familiar.
Alba sueña con apoyar a su hija para que se gradúe como doctora y comprar su casa propia.
texts.en:
Alba, has a significant other and a daughter. They all live together. She does not get any assistance from outside of El Salvador. 

Because she needed to contribute to the household expenses, she decided to sell tortillas. She makes the tortillas to sell every day and goes out to sell them door-to-door in her neigborhood. She distributes to dining halls and to her neighbors' homes

She will use the capital to invest in improvements to the infrastructure of the shack where she makes the tortillas. That way she can work without any problems, such as rain or sun. It will help her improve service, keep her business running and generating the income that she needs to improve her family's quality of life. 

Alba dreams of supporting her daughter so she can graduate as a doctor and of buying her own house.

loans.use: To invest in improvements to the infrastructure of the shack where she makes the tortillas, so she can work without any problems.

loans.name: Maria Angelica

texts.es:
María, es propietaria de una tienda de productos varios y elabora panes con pollo para vender, la venta de panes lo hace desde hace un año y la tienda funciona desde hace 10 meses, con estas actividades económicas puede generar  los ingresos necesarios para costear los gastos de su hogar; María está acompañada, no tienen hijos, junto a su esposo administra el negocio.
Invertirá en la compra de pan, pollo, aceite, gas propano, verduras, bebidas, aderezos, golosinas, etc., son insumos para elaborar la venta de panes con pollo y surtir la tienda, así su negocio podrá mantenerse en el mercado generando ganancias y permitiéndole tener un mejor desarrollo.
Las aspiraciones de María son tener un negocio más grande, administrar de buena manera sus ganancias, cancelar su deuda y formar un patrimonio para cuando decida tener hijos poder apoyarlos en que sean doctores.
texts.en:
María is the owner of a store with a variety of products and she makes chicken sandwiches to sell. She has been selling the sandwiches for one year and has had the store operating for 10 months. With these economic activities she can generate the necessary revenues to pay the household expenses.

María is in a relationship, has no children and runs the store together with her spouse. She will invest in buying bread, chicken, oil, propane, vegetables, drinks, dressing, candy, etc. These are supplies to make her sandwiches for sale and to stock the store. So she can maintain her business generating profit and allow her to develop.

María's dream are to own a larger business, administer the profits well, pay off her debt and make an inheritance for when she has children and she can help them become doctors.

loans.use: to buy bread, chicken, oil, propane, vegetables, drinks, dressing, candy, etc.

loans.name: Ana Mercedes

texts.es:
Ana, necesita capital para invertir en la compra de aceite, maíz, condimentos, pollo, yuca, etc., tendrá la materia prima para elaborar la venta de tamales y antojitos, así seguirá manteniendo la continuidad de su buen desarrollo económico.
Con la ayuda del crédito anterior equipo mejor su negocio y tuvo materia prima para mantenerse trabajando, con lo que tiene estabilidad económica, tiene nuevos clientes y su estilo de vida familiar es más digno.
texts.en:
Ana needs capital to invest in the purchase of cooking oil, corn, seasonings, chicken, yucca, and more to have the ingredients for making tamales and snacks to sell in order to maintain the continuity of her successful economic development.

With the help of her previous loan, she improved her business with ingredients she needed to keep working. It have her economic stability. She has new clients and her family's lifestyle is more dignified.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to make tamales and snacks

loans.name: Alba Luz

texts.es:
Alba, es viuda, es madre de 4 hijos, de los cuales solo una hija depende de ella, los otros ya son independientes; como una forma de contar con ingresos para cubrir las necesidades de su familia se dedica a la venta de comida a empleados y tortillas las cuales distribuye en la colonia donde vive.
Requiere de un préstamo para invertirlo en la remodelación del  local en el que tiene ubicado el negocio, de esta manera mejorara la vistosidad y comodidad para sus clientes, podrá atraer nuevos clientes  y  mejorar las circunstancias económicas.
Sus aspiraciones son mantenerse trabajando para mejor el estilo de vida familiar y apoyar a sus hijos para salir adelante.
texts.en: Alba is a widow. She is the mother of 4 children only one of whom, a daughter, is dependent on her while the others are currently independent. As a way of obtaining reliable earnings to cover the needs of her family she works selling food and tortillas which she distributes to workers  around the town where she lives. She needs a loan to invest in the remodel of the place where her business is located. This way she can improve the aesthetics and comfort for her customers and she will attract new customers and improve her economic circumstances. Her aspirations are to continue working to improve the standard of living of her family and to support her children so they can get ahead.

loans.use: to invest in the remodel of the place where she has located her business.

loans.name: Astou's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 22 membres fait parti du banc villageois qui a été créé le  21 décembre 2012. Il est composé de membres solidairement liés. Leurs principales activités sont le commerce et l’embouche. 
Khardiata, debout à droite de la photo et levant la main est âgé de 47 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 06 enfants dont 03 filles et la cadette n’a que 12 ans. Elle exerce comme activité principale un petit commerce. Elle achète des cartons de savons en morceaux et des sachets de savon en poudre au marché hebdomadaire pour le revendre en détail dans sa localité. 
Les bénéfices lui permettront de payer les intérêts et de renforcer son épargne d’une part, et d’autre part elle améliore aussi les conditions de vie de sa famille dans l’alimentation et les frais scolaires.
texts.en:
This group of 22 members is part of the ’banc villageois’ that was created on December 21, 2012. It is composed of members bound together with solidarity. Their main work involves commerce and the fattening of livestock. 

Khardiata, standing at the right in the photo with a hand raised, is 47 years old and a married mother of six children, including three girls, and the youngest is only 12 years old. Khardiata’s main work involves small-scale commerce. She buys boxes of whole soap and pouches of powdered soap at the weekly market, and then she resells the goods retail in her town. 

The profits will enable her to pay the interest and to bolster her savings, as well as to improve her family’s living conditions regarding food and schooling.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of grocery items

loans.name: Antoinnete

texts.fr:
_ 
Antoinnete âgée de  30ans célibataire  résident à Adidogomé. Elle  vend  des  poissons fumés. Elle s'approvisionne 2 fois par mois à  Dehu et revend  au   marché assiyéyé. Antoinnete sollicite ce crédit pour agrandir son commerce afin de faire plus de profit
texts.en: Antoinnete, aged 30, is unmarried and a resident of Adidogomé. She sells smoked fish. She gets her supplies twice a month in Dehu and resells the goods at the Assiyéyé market. Antoinnete is requesting this loan to expand her commerce in order to make more profit.

loans.use: to purchase two baskets of fish

loans.name: Nazario

texts.es:
Nazario es un hombre de 59 años de edad, no estudio debido al conflicto armado que en ese momento sufrió el país. Se caso hace ya mas de 20 años con su esposa, con quien ha procreados dos hijos quienes estudian en la escuela de la comunidad, para lo cual tienen que viajar todos los días de lunes a viernes por las mañanitas para llegar a las clases y se regresan por la tarde algunas veces a pie, ya que no hay transporte en la comunidad, su esposa se dedica a los oficios del hogar.

De  Nazario dependen su esposa , sus dos hijos y su suegra a quien apoya, pues para él ha sido como una madre ya que sus padres murieron.

Nazario se dedica a los trabajos de la agricultura (siembra de maíz, frijoles y sorgo) para la familia y además parte de las cosechas las vende en la ciudad cuando alcanza buenos resultados, además se dedica a los trabajos de jornalero, tiene una picadora de zacate que en las temporadas también realiza ingresos para la familia. Aprendió gracias a sus padres quienes lo crecieron en el trabajo y gracias a un amigo quien siempre lo motivo a que tenia que salir adelante, pues no tenia donde vivir y vivía alquilando; pero gracias a su esfuerzo ha logrado comprar un pequeño lote de tierra donde tiene su hogar con la familia.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO,  es para comprar abono pues tiene 7,000 metros cuadrados de frijoles sembrados, cancelara $100.00 en el pago de alquiler de la tierra, además necesita el resto para hacer unos arreglos a la picadora de zacate y el resto lo necesita para unos gastos personales en el hogar.

Esto le ayudara de mucho pues espera asegurar la alimentación para sus hijos y tener preparada la maquina de picar para cuando empiece la temporada de donde el obtiene ingresos económicos para la familia.

 Nazario expresa que sus objetivos son de seguir trabajando para darle el estudio a sus hijos y que ellos logren culminar sus carreras en la escuela y logren obtener una carrera universitaria. Además quiere comprar unas dos vacas lecheras para trabajar con ganado y obtener otros ingresos que le permitan un mejor desarrollo familiar
texts.en:
Nazario, 59, could not study due to the armed conflict that his country suffered during that time. He has been married to his wife for over 20 years. They have two children who are attending the community school that they have to travel to from Monday through Friday morning to get to classes. They return in the evening, sometimes on foot, because there is no transport in the community. His wife does household tasks. 

His wife and two children are Nazario's economic dependents. He also supports his mother-in-law since the death of his own parents, she is like his own mother. 

Nazario is dedicated to the work of agriculture (planting corn, beans and sorghum) for the family and also part of the crop is sold in the city when he has a good harvest. His is also a laborer. He has a machine that grinds fodder for livestock which he uses for extra income for the family. 

He learned his work from his parents and a friend. Thanks to them, he always had a reason to work to get ahead. He had no place to live and had to rent a house but thanks to his efforts, he has managed to buy a small plot of land where he has his home with the family. 

He is applying for a loan from CREDICAMPO to buy fertilizer to plant 7,000 square meters of beans. He has already paid $100 in land rental but also needs more rent money for farmland, to make some repairs to the grinder for fodder, and for personal expenses at home. This will help ensure that he will be able to feed his family and prepare his equipment for when the farming season starts and he gets income for the family.

Nazario says that his goals are to continue working to give his children the opportunity to study and achieve success in school and obtain a university degree. He also wants to buy a pair of dairy cows to have another source of income to allow for better development for his family.

loans.use: to fertilize his bean fields, rent farmland, and repair equipment

loans.name: Vanessa

texts.en: Vanessa is a 30-year-old mother of two managing her own fish pond while her husband works as a school driver. She takes responsibility of this business in order to make a living. Vanessa is residing in Tangub City with her family. Her children are still in elementary school but she needs to plan for their higher education. She joined Gata Daku MPC and borrowed a loan to buy fish and shrimp fingerlings. She wants to see her children succeed in the future.

loans.use: to buy fish and shrimp fingerlings

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en: Hellen is a married woman. She has 4 children. She describes herself as promising. She operates a posho mill where she grinds maize to produce maize flour. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. She describes her biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy a new posho mill. Her business goal is to own a large posho mill within 5 years. She will use the anticipated profits to open a cereals store.

loans.use: to buy a new posho mill

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of materials for making jikos

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to grow coffee

loans.name: Kouméalo

texts.fr:
-   
Demeurant  à  Lomé dans le quartier Adidogomé,  Kouméalo  est  âgée de 36 ans et mère de 3 enfants. Elle est veuve .  Ama   vend  des   boisson locale. Elle   s’approvisionne  une  fois  par  mois  à  Anié  et  revend a son domicile . Kouméalo sollicite un prêt pour agrandir  son commerce et faire plus bénéfice.
texts.en: Staying in Lomé, in the Adidogomé district, Kouméalo, aged 36, is a mother of three children. She is a widow. [She] sells local beverages. She gets her supplies once a month in Anié and resells her goods at her home. Kouméalo is requesting a loan to expand her commerce and to make more profit.

loans.use: to purchase three sacks of millet

loans.name: Maria Armandina

texts.es:
María tiene 58 años, es viuda, vive con 01 hijo quien es independiente, vive en casa propia en sector denominado Santa Sofia. Ella cuenta con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales, su es familia unida. La comunidad donde vive es una comunidad dedicada al comercio, agricultura y ganaderia; y está ubicada en el distrito de Cayaltí, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

María se dedica a crianza y venta de chivos, carneros, patos y pollos. Ella necesita del crédito para la inversión en mejora de vivienda en la parte exterior del hall y asumirá gastos personales. Con ello mejorará su calidad de vida y así podrá habitar en mejores condiciones.
texts.en:
María is 58 years old, widowed, and has one child who is independent. She lives in her own home in the sector of Santa Sofia. María has many good personal and work references. Her family is close. The community where she lives is dedicated to trade, agriculture, and livestock breeding. It is located in the District of Cayaltí in Chiclayo Province, which is in the region of Lambayeque on the northern coast of Peru.

María raises and sells goats, sheep, ducks, and chickens. She needs this loan in order to invest in home improvements, such as the hallway exterior, and the payment of personal expenses. This will improve her quality of life, which will allow her to live in better conditions.

loans.use: to pay for home improvements and personal expenses.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase charcoal, rice and pork

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more chicks and feed.

loans.name: Darling Virginia

texts.es:
La Joven Darling  de  18  años de edad  es casada y vive con su esposo en su casa de habitación, vive en una comunidad de San Lorenzo al sur de Honduras,  cuenta con un puesto de achinería ubicado en las afueras de un colegio del municipio donde vive.
Darling  la  ubicación  de su negocio le permite tener mucha clientela siendo sus  clientes principales los alumnos  de dicho colegio,  sus ventas son de lunes a sábado, es conocida por ser una joven dedicada a  su trabajo gracias a que sus padres fueron  quienes le enseñaron lo importante que es el trabajo. 
Darling  está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de ropa interior,  relojes, aretes, colas, ganchos de pelo, etc.  Con el apoyo de este préstamo espera mejorar sus ingresos y que a su vez mejore un poco su calidad de vida. 
Su sueño es  crecer más en su negocio.

San Lorenzo, Honduras  -   Agosto del 2014
texts.en:
Darling is 18 years old, she is married, and lives with her husband in their home. She lives in the city of San Lorenzo in the southern part of Honduras. She has a booth to sell low-cost consumer goods on the outside of a high school in the city where she lives.

The location of Darling's business allows her to have many customers since the majority of her customers are students at the school. She sells Monday through Saturday, and is known for being a young person who is dedicated to her work thanks to her parents teaching her how important work is.

Darling is requesting a loan to buy underwear, watches, earrings, soft drinks, hair clips, etc. With the support from this loan she hopes to improve her revenues and at the same time improve her quality of life a little. Her dream is to keep growing her business.

loans.use: to buy underwear, watches, earrings, soft drinks, hair clips, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Cornelius

texts.en: Cornelius is a married man. He has 3 children. He describes himself as committed. He operates a retail business where he sells fuel filters, suspension kits and other automobile items. He has been involved in this business for 4 years. His business is located in an area fit for business and his primary customers are of all types. He identifies inadequate funds as being his biggest business. He will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more stock of fuel filters, suspension kits and other items. His business goal is to be successful within 5 years. He hopes that, in the future, he will be happy and have a prosperous business. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fuel filters, suspension kits and other automobile items

loans.name: Nyamiryango Womens Group

texts.en: Yusta is a member of Nyamiryango Womens Group where each member guarantees each other so as to access credit. Yusta is aged 50 with 6 children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. Yusta is a tailor and has a tailoring business which she runs 12 hours a day. She faces challenges of inadequate capital, but she has hopes of educating all of her children to higher levels of learning. Yusta needs a loan to buy materials (clothes) for sewing and selling.

loans.use: to buy materials (clothes) for sewing and selling.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of bricks

loans.name: Shingirirai

texts.en: Shingirirai is a 19-year-old businesswoman living in Gokwe North, Zimbabwe. She is currently running a poultry project from her home to support herself. The business has been running for one year and Shingirirai would like to see it expand. She has a current capacity of 50 birds every 3 weeks. This Kiva loan will help her increase her chicks from fifty to one hundred once she purchases stock feed and vaccines for the birds. The loan will also help her continue her education after she makes profits. When she is not feeding her chickens you will find Shingirirai volunteering at her local secondary school as a Camfed Learner Guide teaching students life skills.

loans.use: To increase her chicks from fifty to one hundred once she purchases stock feed and vaccines for the birds

loans.name: Dora Yamileth

texts.es:
Dora de 30 años de edad, madre soltera de una niña, quien estudia el nivel básico en el municipio mas cercano y tiene que ir a dejarla y ha traerla de lunes a viernes por las mañanas. Dora se creció con sus cuatro hermanos todos mayores de edad y quienes ya tienen sus propias familias, ella vive solo con su hija y su madre a quien cuida,  Dora estudio a hasta sexto grado y dejo de estudiar pues tenia que trabajar para ayudar a su madre.

Dora se dedica a la venta de ropa desde los quince años de edad y también vende productos de lencería como lociones y cremas de donde ella obtiene ingresos económicos para sacar adelante a su hija y ayudar a su madre, sale a vender tres a cuatro días a la semana en las comunidades aledañas, antes  trabajo por dos años en un comedor en la ciudad.

Ella compra la mercadería en la ciudad, pues le es mas cómoda, ella va a comprar sola pues en eso su hija le apoya cuidando a su madre. Vende por las tardes ya cuando su hija ha venido de la escuela, se decidió gracias al apoyo que le brindo una amiga de la zona. También hacen cultivo de maíz para el cual tiene que pagar mosos que le apoyen en los trabajos.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para comprar ropa para todas las edades, para  posteriormente comercializa en las comunidades, de momento no tiene mercadería pues tuvo unos gastos en la salud de su hija y quiere tener mercadería para salir a vender ropa y productos de lencería.
Esto le ayudara de mucho, pues espera obtener ingresos económicos para darle el sostén a su familia.

Dora sueña con seguir apoyando a su hija en los estudios para que logre culminar sus estudios en la escuela y siga en el instituto y si puede apoyarla en la universidad, sino que pueda alcanzar un trabajo digno. Además espera con sus pequeños ahorritos comprar en el futuro tierra donde hacer su vivienda.
texts.en:
Dora is 30 years old, the single mother of one daughter who studies in primary school in the nearest municipality. She has to drop her off and pick her up every morning from Monday to Friday. Dora grew up with her four brothers who are all adults now and have their own families. She lives alone with her daughter and her mother, who she takes care of. Dora studied up to Grade 6 and left school as she had to work to help her mother.

Dora has been working selling clothing since she was 15 years old. She also sells lingerie items like lotions and creams to get economic revenues to get her daughter ahead and to help her mother. She goes out to sell 3 or 4 times per week in the neighboring communities. She worked in a cafe in the city for two years. She buys her merchandise in the city as that is more convenient. She goes alone to buy and leaves her daughter in the care of her mother. She sells in the afternoons when her daughter has come back from school. She decided thanks to the help that a friend in her area gave her. She also grows corn and pays for labor to help her with the work.

The loan that she is requesting from CREDICAMPO is to buy clothing for all ages to later sell in the communities. At this time she has no merchandise as she had a couple of medical expenses for her daughter. She wants to have merchandise to go out and sell clothing and lingerie products. This will be of great help to her as she can generate the income she needs to support her family. Dora dreams of supporting her daughter in her studies so that she can finish her studies at the school and if possible support her to study at university so that she can find dignified work. She also hopes one day to buy land for her house with her modest savings.

loans.use: to buy clothing for all ages.

loans.name: Sokhna Mb's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 05 femmes fait parti du banc villageois qui a été créé le 04 novembre 2009. Ce banc regroupe des membres du même village et ceux des environs. Leurs activités c’est le commerce et l’embouche.
Aissatou assise à droite de la photo et levant la main, est âgée de 40 ans. Elle est célibataire sans enfants.
Avec le prêt, elle envisage d’acheter du tissu et du fil pour une valeur de 150000f. Elle va acheter aussi 4 moutons avec les 150000f.
Les bénéfices servent à soutenir son frère dans la gestion de la famille, à assurer la dépense quotidienne et à renforcer son épargne.
texts.en:
This group of five women belongs to the village finance association created on November 4, 2009. The association gathers members from one village and its surrounding area. Their businesses are retail and animal husbandry.

Aissatou, who is sitting to the right with her hand raised in the photo, is forty years old. She is single and does not have children.

With the loan, she plans to purchase fabrics and thread for 150,000 XOF. She will also purchase four sheep with the 150,000 XOF.

Profits will be used to help her brother provide for the family, to pay for daily expenses, and to increase her savings.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and sheep.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of potatoes

loans.name: Augustine

texts.en:
Augustine is a married man with one child living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He has been running a hardware / plumbing shop for the past five years and with the proceeds he has been able to buy land and build a residential house. 

Augustine used his previous loan to buy hardware items such as nails, cement and rods to sell. Like most traders in the developing world, he still faces hardships of inadequate capital and the high cost of living. However, he hopes to increase his profits and have a known plumbing shop.

Augustine is requesting a loan to buy more plumbing items such as pipes to sell.

loans.use: to buy more plumbing items such as pipes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase her stock by purchasing sugar, cooking oil, rice and flour in bulk so as to cut costs and maximize her profits.

loans.name: Maria Elemena

texts.es:
La señora  María   de  54  años  de edad  es casada y vive con su esposo en su casa de habitación, en un municipio de San Lorenzo al sur de Honduras,  se dedica a su negocio el cual es una pulpería ubicada  a orilla de calle y  se distingue por ser una persona luchadora y emprendedora.
Doña María  en su negocio  vende una gran variedad de abarrotería, está muy contenta por el apoyo que se le ha brindado  en veces anteriores y actualmente quiere invertir más en su pulpería.
Doña María  está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de arroz, azúcar, frijoles, aguas, café, leche, aceite, etc. con el apoyo de este préstamo espera mejorar sus ingresos para seguir apoyando a su familia.


San Lorenzo, Honduras -  Agosto del 2014
texts.en:
Señora Maria, who is 54 years old, is married and lives with her husband in their house in the township of San Lorenzo, in the south of Honduras. She works in her business, which is a grocery store located beside the street, and she stands out for being a hard-working and entrepreneurial person. In her business, Doña Maria sells a great variety of groceries. She is very happy about the support that has been offered to her in the past, and now she wants to invest more in her grocery store.

Doña Maria is applying for the loan to purchase rice, sugar, beans, water, coffee, milk, oil, etc. With the support of this loan, she hopes to improve her income to continue supporting her family.

San Lorenzo, Honduras -  August 2014

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, beans, water, coffee, milk, oil, etc. for her business

loans.name: Suyapa Concepcion

texts.es:
La señora Suyapa Concepcion de  45 años de edad,  es casada,  tiene  02 hijos que dependen de ella, vive en su propia casa en una comunidad de Nacaome, valle al sur de Honduras, se dedica desde hace  20 años  al negocio de la venta de tortillas.
Doña Suyapa Concepción sus ventas son de forma ambulante, es una mujer emprendedora que hace muchos años lucha para sacar adelante a sus hijos, se levanta temprano a moler el maíz, para elaborar las tortillas y luego las vende en el mercado de Nacaome.
Doña Suyapa Concepción está solicitando el préstamo para la compra maíz, leña y cal. que es la materia prima para su negocio de tortillas.   Con el apoyo de este préstamo espera mejorar sus ingresos y por ende su calidad de vida, es un cliente que solicita su octavo  préstamo para capital de trabajo. Su sueño es mejorar su casa.

San Lorenzo, Honduras -  Agosto del 2014.
texts.en:
Señora Suyapa Concepción is 45 years old. She is married and has two children who depend on her. She lives in her own house in a community of Nacaome, Valle, in the south of Honduras. She has worked for 20 years in her business of selling tortillas.

Doña Suyapa Concepción makes her sales as a street vendor. She is an entrepreneurial woman who for many years has worked hard to raise her children. She gets up early to grind corn to make tortillas, and later she sells them in the market of Nacaome.

Doña Suyapa Cencepción is applying for the loan to purchase corn, firewood, and lime, which are the basic ingredients for her tortilla business. With the support of this loan, she hopes to improve her income and as a result, her quality of life. She is a client who is applying for her eighth loan for working capital. Her dream is to improve her house.

San Lorenzo, Honduras -  August 2014.

loans.use: to purchase corn, firewood, and lime for her business

loans.name: Bahodur

texts.ru:
Этот предприниматель по имени Баходур живет в районе Мастчох города Худжанд. Он 38-летний женатый мужчина. Баходур имеет высшее медицинское образование и работал по своей профессии в течение 10 лет. Год назад он перешел на бизнес в сфере услуг и открыл свою столовую. Его столовая создана для клиентов со средним уровнем достатка, и цены на продукцию в ней невысокие. В своей столовой Баходур предлагает клиентам разнообразный ассортимент вкусных блюд, как правило, это салаты, первые блюда, гарниры, напитки, выпечка, молочные продукты. И за маленький промежуток времени его столовая уже приобрела своих постоянных клиентов. 
В данный момент Баходур хочет расширить свой малый бизнес и для этой цели нуждается в кредите в размере 4000 долларов США. На эту сумму он хочет приобрести большую духовку, холодильник и кондиционер в свою столовую. Баходур надеется на вашу отзывчивость.
texts.en: This entrepreneur by the name of Bahodur lives in the Mastchoh district of Khujand.  He is 38, married, and has a university education in medicine.  He worked in medicine for 10 years, then made a switch to the restaurant business a year ago and opened his own diner.  His diner caters to the average person, and has reasonable prices.  He has a variety of tasty offerings for his customers, such as soups, salads, side dishes, drinks, baked goods, and dairy products.  Though it hasn't been open for very long, his diner already has a number of regular customers.  Currently, Bahodur would like to expand his small but flourishing business, and is seeking a loan of $4000 USD to buy a bigger oven, a refrigerator, and an air conditioner for his diner.  He is counting on your kindness and compassion.

loans.use: buy a new oven, refrigerator and air conditioner for his diner

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to construct a room in her house.

loans.name: Elvia

texts.en:
Elvia is 64 years old and married with seven children. Elvia works very hard to provide for them.

Elvia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Elvia has been in this business for eleven years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future Elvia would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy new agricultural supplies for maintaining her coffee plantation this season.

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en:
Andrew, who used his previous loan to buy cattle to rear, is a married man with seven children. He lives in Kamwenge- Uganda. 

He is a cattle farmer and also grows maize and sorghum. Diseases and limited farmland still pose a challenge to the growth of his business, however he intends to grow his business into a large farm.

Andrew is requesting a loan to buy more cattle to rear.

loans.use: to buy more cattle to rear.

loans.name: Ifthkar

texts.en:
Ifthkar is a 45-year-old married man who lives in the area of Lahore, Pakistan, with his family. He is the father of two children. One of his children goes to school, and one helps him in cattle farming. 

Ifthkar is a cattle trader and does most of his trading within his home area. He breeds cattle in his yard at home and sells at a local market. 

Recently, a healthy cow died, due to a fetal disease. Ifthkar had been increasing his cattle stock by breeding that cow, but now his breeding activity has been affected badly.

With the contribution of his savings, Ifthkar wants to buy a cow to keep constant his breeding activity. But he does not have a sufficient amount to buy a cow for breeding. 

Therefore, Ifthkar has requested a loan from Kiva's field partner Brac Pakistan. He will use the loan to buy a cow to continue his breeding activity. 

Ifthkar is very pleased after receiving this loan and thankful to Brac Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a cow to continue his breeding activity.

loans.name: Cosmas

texts.en:
The person appearing in the photo is Cosmas. He is married and a father of five. He is forty two years old.

He does dairy farming as his economic activity. He needs a loan to buy higher-quality fodder for his cows. This will increase their milk production and help Cosmas keep up with the increased demand for milk. He hopes this will increase his income level in order to continue supporting his family. In the long run he hopes to improve their living conditions and provide quality education.

Cosmas is grateful to Kiva and its lenders for their help and support

loans.use: to purchase high quality fodder for his cows.

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en:
Felisa, aged 60 and married, resides in Mantik, Tangub City with her family.  

She has been operating a general store for many years. She has successfully repaid her previous loan, used for purchasing supplementary goods for sale. Her business is doing well and yet she still wants more income as she plans to save a portion of her returns. Recently, she took a new loan from Gata Daku MPC to purchase additional grocery goods for her store. 

In the future, Felisa hopes that her business will improve, as well as the general living standard of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods for her store

loans.name: Prosper

texts.en:
Prosper lives in Masindi-Uganda. She is aged 50 and rears pigs and sells the produce. She started the business to cater for her family's needs. Her dream is to educate her children but inadequate capital hinders her business.

She wants to buy more pigs for her farm.

loans.use: to buy more pigs for her farm.

loans.name: Geofrey

texts.en:
Geoffrey is a 33 year old, married, Ugandan living in Masindi-Uganda. He has got a shop that sells general merchandise such as sugar, maize flour and soap.

The demands of his family motivated him to start up a business. Geoffrey wishes to expand his business to larger markets. However he is challenged by seasonal changes.

He wants a loan to buy sugar, maize flour and soap to sell.

loans.use: to buy stocks of sugar, posho (maize flour) and soap to sell.

loans.name: James Fran

texts.es:
James  de 27 años de edad, un joven muy emprendedor y luchador en la vida, desde pequeño gracias a los esfuerzos que durante su niñez le apoyaron sus padres, estudio hasta el quinto grado en el municipio donde residió por muchos años, luego se acompaño hace siete años con su esposa quien trabaja en el cuido del hogar y de sus hijos mientras él trabaja de jornalero y los pequeñitos estudian.
James se creció con sus padres y sus hermanos trabajando de jornaleros y en la agricultura.
james se dedica al trabajo de la agricultura en la comunidad donde reside, hace cultivos de maíz, frijoles y del cultivo de maicillo desde los diez años cuando su padre lo llevaba a las milpas que él hacia, también trabaja cuidando especies menores como cerdos y aves de corral. Antes también trabajaba en un taller mecánico arreglando automóviles de los 17 a los 23 años de edad.
Cuando no trabaja en los cultivos se dedica a trabajar desde las tres de la mañana hasta las diez de la mañana en las artesanías (haciendo cumas y machetes) tiene que caminar media hora para llegar a su lugar de trabajo, se va caminando por caminos en las colinas cercanas.
El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para comprar cuatro, ocho sacos de harinilla, abono para el cultivo de maíz y pagar el alquiler de la tierra donde hace sus cultivos.
James  sueña con comprar una tarea de tierra, ya que donde reside anda alquilando con su esposa y sus cuatro hijos, y él lucha cada día para alcanzar sus sueños y darle a sus hijos una vivienda digna.
texts.en:
James, at the age of 27, is a young man who has been very entrepreneurial and hard-working in life since he was very young, Thanks to the efforts with which his parents supported him during his childhood, he went to school through fifth grade in the town where he lived for many years. Then seven years ago he married his wife, who cares for the house and their children while he works a a laborer and the little ones go to school.

James grew up with his parents and his siblings working as laborers and in agriculture.

James does agricultural work in the community where he lives. He has raised corn, beans, and sorghum since he was 10 years old, when his father took him to the fields that he had. He also cares for small animals such as pigs and barnyard fowl. In the past, from ages 17 to 23, he also worked in a mechanics shop repairing automobiles.

When he is not working in his fields, he works from 3 in the morning until 10 in the morning in handicrafts (making knives and machetes). He has to walk half an hour to arrive at his place of work. He walks along roads in the nearby hills.

The loan that he is requesting from CrediCampo is to buy eight sacks of ground blue corn and compost for his cornfield and to pay for the rental of the land where he raises his crops.

James dreams of buying an area of land, since he is renting the place where he lives with his wife and his four children, and he strives every day to achieve his dreams and give his children a worthy home.

loans.use: to buy eight sacks of ground blue corn and compost for his corn planting, and to pay the rent for the land where he raises his crops

loans.name: Saheli Mahila Samuha Group

texts.en:
Rani, Basanti, Nemali, Champa and Rukmani formed a group, "Saheli Mahila Samuha", to help each other and to achieve a better standard of living. 

Rani (with a hand raised) is a housewife, and her husband works as an auto-rickshaw driver. Apart from this, Rani has a dairy farm. She sells about 1.5 liters of milk every day near Deoghar in Jharkhand. She has four children: two boys and two girls. Three of her children are studying and the other one is working. The income that they are generating now is not adequate to cover the family's expenditures, so she is requesting a loan to add one more cow to her farm and to repair the auto. This will help them have a better income and also provide a better education for the children.

Like Rani, the other members are also seeking a loan to improve their livelihood. To improve their businesses on a large scale, they need sufficient capital. So they seek a loan, which they will invest in their respective endeavors.

Your loan will help five hardworking and deserving families take a big step towards improving their livelihoods and lives.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Fatou's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 17 femmes fait parti du banc villageois qui a été créé le 04 novembre 2009. Ce banc regroupe des membres du même village et ceux des environs. Leurs activités c’est le commerce et l’embouche.
Amy debout à droite de la photo et levant la main, est âgée de 62 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 6 enfants.
