Elle fait comme activité le commerce  de friperie. Avec le prêt, elle va acheter 4 balles de friperie à 25000f l’unité cela dépend de la taille. Pour chaque balle elle compte faire un bénéfice de 25000f, l’écoulement  se fait dans les marchés hebdomadaires de  la zone.
Avec les bénéfices, elle soutient ses enfants dans la gestion de la famille, la nourriture  et tous autres besoins.
texts.en:
This group of 17 women is part of the "banc villageois" loan association which was established November 4, 2009. Members of this "banc villageois" are from the same village and those nearby. Their business is commerce and livestock fattening.

Amy is standing on the right of the photo and raising her hand. She is 62 years old, married with six children.

Her business activity is the trade of used clothing. She will use the loan to buy four bales of used clothing at 25,000 francs a unit, depending on the size.

For each bale she expects a profit of 25,000 francs. Sales are conducted at weekly markets in the area.

The profits will help support her children by managing the family, taking care of food and all other needs.

loans.use: buy used clothing

loans.name: Ifthkar

texts.en:
Ifthkar is a 38-year-old man, who lives with his wife and four children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

He owns a poultry farm beside his home and he has many hens for producing eggs to sell. He supplies eggs to the bakery, general stores and wholesalers. His business is going very well and he is generating enough profit for his family. As the winter weather approaches, the demand for eggs increases as well. To cope with the demand and generate maximum profit he wants to buy more hens for producing more eggs to sell. Due to household expenses, utility bills and miscellaneous expenses he is unable to buy more hens. Therefore, Ifthkar has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that he can buy more hens and earn maximum profit in the winter season.
 
Ifthkar is very thankful to Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy hens for producing eggs to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy phones and accessories for resale

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma works hard to support her family. Emma is married and has a restaurant business in the Philippines.

She requested a 22,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase more ingredients like canned goods, meat, vegetables, etc.

Emma has been in this business for 20 years now.

In the future, Emma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more ingredients like canned goods, meat, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Virgen De Las Nieves Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “VIRGEN DE LAS NIEVES”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Consuelo ella es viuda y tiene 58 años y tiene 4 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de restaurant, la socia prepara diferentes platos como pollo con papas, sopas y saltados de carnes, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 10 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de restaurant. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar productos para cocinar como pollo, carne y verduras.

Los socios que estan pegados a la foto grupal se les tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pidieron permiso por motivos de trabajo.
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de venta de celulares, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the "Virgen de las Nieves" communal bank. This bank is located in the district of Cusco, which belongs to the province of Cusco, in the department of Cusco.

The member is Consuelo. She is a widow, 58 years old, and has 4 children. She works in her restaurant business. She makes different foods, such as chicken with potatoes, soups, and a beef with french fries dish. She works from 8:00am until 5:00pm. She has had this business for 10 years and it is going very well for her. Her dream is to expand her restaurant. She is requesting the loan to buy products for cooking, such as chicken, beef, and vegetables.

The members who have thier photos next to the group photo had their photos taken after the meeting because they couldn't be there due to their work.

The other members have businesses selling clothing, selling mobile phones, small grocery stores, and restaurants.

Consuelo is grateful to those who are a part of her dream through this program and she pledges to make her payments within the established time frame.

loans.use: to buy products for cooking, such as chicken, beef, and vegetables.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 26-year-old married man from a village near Hebron city called Yatta. He is a father of two sons and two daughters. He works as a construction worker with a low and unstable income. He decided to improve the family's living conditions, so he worked extra hours as a farmer on his land. He plants olive and lemon trees.

Mahmoud took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more seedlings for his farm. By taking this loan, Mahmoud will be able to increase the farm productivity and also, he can improve the family's living conditions. 

Mahmoud appears in the photo on his farm.

loans.use: to buy more seedlings for his farm.

loans.name: Shirly

texts.en:
Shirly is a 51-year-old married woman and a mother of six children from Iloilo, Philippines. She has been engaged in a fishing business with her husband for more than 15 years now. Shirly also operates a small sari-sari (or variety store) in her place.

Shirly is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, and additional stock for her store, such as canned goods, noodles, soda, soap and toiletries, cooking ingredients and seasonings.

Through this, she will be able to improve their catch as well as her sales in her store. In the future, Shirly has hopes of making her business a success.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets and additional stocks for her store such as canned goods, noodles, soda, soap and toiletries, cooking ingredients and seasonings

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a divorced man. He has six children. He describes himself to be determined. He operates rental houses where he offers housing services. He has been involved in this business for 20 years. His business is located in an area with potential, and his primary customers are of all types. He describes his biggest business challenge to be late payment by tenants. 

He will use the 50,000 Kenyan shillings loan to renovate his rental houses and build a fence around the houses. His business goal is to be financially stable within five years. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. A previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to renovate his rental houses and build a fence around them

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 42 years old, single and works hard to support her parents.

She has a buying and selling of fruits business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling dried fish.  Vilma is borrowing 11,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to buy additional fruits to sell for her fruit business.

Vilma has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional fruits to sell

loans.name: Los Gigantes De Santiago De Chacan Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LOS GIGANTES DE SANTIAGO DE CHACAN”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Anta, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco

La socia es la Sra. Josefa ella es casada y tiene 50 años y tiene 1 hijo; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de cereales, la socia vende maiz, trigo y quinua, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 4 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los cereales. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar trigo, maíz y quinua.
.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de cereales, negocio de venta de animales, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the "Los Gigantes de Santiago de Chacan" communal bank. This bank is located in the district of Anta, which belongs to the province of Anta, in the department of Cusco.

The member is Josefa. She is married, 50 years old, and has 1 son. She works in her business selling cereal grains. She sells corn, wheat, and quinoa. She works from 8:00am until 5:00pm. She has been in this business for 4 years and it is going very well for her. Her dream is to have a store where she could sell her cereal grains. She is requesting the loan to buy wheat, corn, and quinoa. 

The other members have businesses that sell cereal grains, sell animals, grocery stores, and restaurants.

Josefa is grateful to those who are sharing in her dream through this program and she pledges to make her payments within the established timeframe.

loans.use: to buy wheat, corn, and quinoa.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis is a married man. He has four children. He describes himself as honest. He operates a retail business where he sells books. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a competitive place and his primary customers are of all types. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of books. His business goal is to own a big book shop within five years. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy more stock of books

loans.name: Dédé

texts.fr:
_ -  
Agée de 77 ans . Dédé est  Veuve  et  mère de 8 enfants  résidant  à Tokoin. Elle a commencée  son activité de  commerce  en  vendant  des  produits alimentaires et des céréales. Elle s'approvisionne  2 Fois  par mois au  Grand marché de lomé  et  revend à son  domicile  dans sa   boutique.  Dédé  sollicite  un crédit pour agrandir son commerce afin de satisfaire sa clientèle et  faire plus de profit.
texts.en:
Dédé is 77 years old, widowed and mother to eight children.  She lives in Tokoin and works selling food and cereal products.  She buys her supplies twice a month at the main market in Lomé.  She then sells her products from her shop at her home.

Dédé has requested this loan in order to expand her business to meet the needs of her customers.  In this way, she expects to make more profit.

loans.use: to buy 1 sack of gari (manioc or cassava flour), 8 packets of sugar and 5 bags of peanuts for resale.

loans.name: Moussa

texts.fr:
Moussa est chauffeur de profession depuis plus de 10 ans. Il habite à quelques kilomètres du quartier où se situe l’IMCEC. Il vient pour la première fois, solliciter un petit crédit afin de renforcer sa deuxième activité génératrice de revenus : l’aviculture qu’il a démarrée juste un an. Avec cette somme elle va acheter une bande de 50 poussins en plus de leurs aliments. Il possède une clientèle qui ramasse les poulets dès qu’ils sont à terme.
Moussa est marié et père de 4 enfants dont son ainé, une fille âgée de 20 ans et la cadette, de 12 ans. Moussa tient seul son taxi, il travaille de 8h à 20h et s’il est fatigué, il gare le véhicule pour minimiser les pannes. 
Avec les revenus des deux activités, il met un peu d’argent de coté, afin de pouvoir acquérir un jour un autre véhicule.
texts.en:
Moussa has been a professional driver for more than ten years.  He lives a few kilometres from the field partner, UIMCEC's, office.  This will be his first loan with UIMCEC, and he will use it to strengthen his second source of income.  Moussa began raising chickens around one year ago.  He plans to buy a flock of 50 chicks and food for them.  He already has clients who buy the chickens once they are ready.

Moussa is married and has four children. The eldest is a 20-year-old girl and the youngest is 12 years old.

Moussa works alone as a taxi driver, he starts at eight in the morning and finishes at eight in the evening.  He tries to look after his vehicle well in order to minimise break-downs.

Between his two sources of income, Moussa manages to save some money which he plans to use to buy another vehicle one day.

loans.use: to buy a flock of 50 chicks to raise and then sell on.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a married man. He has three children. He describes himself as determined. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for two years. His business is located in a busy area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of finances. He will use the KES 25,000 loan to buy a motorcycle. His business goal is to have a transport company within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will have a better standard of living.

loans.use: buy a motorcycle

loans.name: El Hadji Mansour

texts.fr:
Âgé de 53 ans, monsieur El Hadji Mansour s’active dans la maçonnerie depuis le jeune âge, il a acquis une expérience de 34 ans dans ce domaine. Il a fait l’apprentissage pendant des années, avant de créer sa propre entreprise. Il travaille de 7h du matin jusqu’à 18h. Il vient solliciter un crédit pour acheter du bois de coffrage environ 50 planches afin d’améliorer son profit. Au lieu de louer des planches pour exécuter un chantier, il prendra son propre matériel et cela lui fera moins de charges d’exploitation. 
Il est divorcé et père de 2 enfants : un garçon et une fille âgés respectivement de 5 et 7 ans. El Hadji s’occupe de la dépense quotidienne de sa famille. 
Il souhaite voir son capital augmenter pour améliorer davantage son activité.
texts.en:
El Hadji Mansour is 53 years old and has worked in masonry from a young age, so he has 34 years' experience in his trade.  He undertook several years of apprenticeship before starting his own business.  He works from seven in the morning until six in the evening.

El Hadji has requested this loan in order to buy around 50 planks of formwork timber.  This will help him to earn greater profits.  Instead of having to rent planks for use on his building sites, he will be able to use his own material and avoid the rental charges.

El Hadji is divorced and has two children, a boy and a girl, aged five and seven years respectively. He is solely responsible for the day-to-day expenses of his family.

El Hadji would like to increase his working capital so that he can improve his business even further.

loans.use: to buy formwork timber to rent out or for use on his building sites.

loans.name: Povi

texts.fr:
-  
Povi a 42 ans, Mariée et mère de 2 enfants résident à Tokoin. Elle vend des Friperies. Elle s'approvisionne une Fois par mois au  marché hédzranawé et  revend dans sa  baraque de son domicile. Povi sollicite ce crédit pour agrandir son commerce afin de faire plus de profit
texts.en:
Povi is 42 years old, married and has two children.  They all live in Tokoin.  Povi sells second-hand clothing.  She buys her supplies once a month from the Hédzranawé market.  She sells her clothing from a stall at her home.

Povi has requested this loan in order to expand her business and increase her profits.

loans.use: to buy 75 outfits of second-hand clothing for resale.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is a married woman. She has nine children. She describes herself as jovial. She operates a retail shop where she sells sugar, bread, cooking oil and other items. She has been involved in this business for 12 years. Her business is located in a rural area and her primary customers are locals. She will use the KES 60,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, bread, milk and other items. Her business goal is to expand within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be happy. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, bread, milk and other items.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself as visionary and ambitious. She operates a tailoring shop where she makes clothes. She has been involved in this business for seven years. Her business is located in a shopping centre. She will use the KES 80,000 loan to buy more stock of tailoring materials. Her business goal is to open another outlet within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will open more business branches.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tailoring materials.

loans.name: Akossiwavi

texts.fr:
_ -  
Mariée et mère de  2 enfants à 27 ans, Akossiwavi  réside à Tokoin. Elle vend  des produits alimentaires. Elle  s'approvisionne 4 Fois par mois au  Grand marché de lomé. Elle  revend  au marché de Bové. Akossiwavi sollicite ce crédit pour agrandir son commerce afin de satisfaire sa clientèle et  faire plus de profit.
texts.en:
Akossiwavi is 27 years old, married and has two children.  They all live in Tokoin.  Akossiwavi sells food products which she buys 4 times a month from the main market in Lomé.  She then sells her products at the market in Bové.

Akossiwavi has requested this loan in order to expand her business and better satisfy the demands of her customers.  In this way, she will earn greater profits.

loans.use: to buy 1 sack of rice, 1 drum of oïl and 3 boxes of spaghetti for resale.

loans.name: Jeralden

texts.en: Jeralden is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 14,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell for her fish vending business. Jeralden has been in this business for five years. She earns more income from a general store. Jeralden has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en: Edna has been operating a retail business for over eight years and she is earning well from this. She settled in Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental with her family for her living. She always wants to see improvements to her business. With her generated income from this business, she successfully repaid her previous loan used for buying goods. She started to offer more goods in order to please her customers. Recently, she took a new loan to purchase additional grocery goods like cans and grains to sell. She is thankful to Gata Daku MPC for the services offered to entrepreneurs like her who want to augment their living situation.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods like cans and grains to sell.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en: Daisy is married with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She is 39 years old and her two children are in school. Daisy has a fishing business in the Philippines and she has been in this business for four years. Daisy has requested a 13,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy additional fishing nets. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing nets.

loans.name: Kagusu Tukwatanize Group

texts.en:
Patrick lives with his wife and their four children in Fort Portal. He is still in the same business of brick laying and sand extraction. To supplement his income, he engages in farming. His two business enterprises allow him to provide for his family.

Patrick is a member of a group where members guarantee each other to help get a loan. He used the previous loan to pay for labor to lay bricks. Currently, Patrick faces the challenge of inadequate firewood to use in the final process of producing bricks. He is therefore requesting for a loan to pay for labor to lay bricks. Patrick's eventual goal is to buy more land so that he can expand his farming enterprise.

loans.use: to pay for labor to lay bricks.

loans.name: Zafer Iqbal

texts.en:
Zafer Iqbal is a 48-year-old married person, living along with his family in the area of Gujrat, Pakistan. He is a poor farmer and cherishes his family by hook or by crook. He has to pay fair by using a rental tractor for preparing the soil to plant seeds and collect the harvest. He wants to buy a tractor of his own with the contribution of his savings, but he does not have enough cash in hand to buy a new tractor.

This is the reason that Zafer Iqbal has contacted Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan and requested a loan, so he can buy a tractor with the contribution of his savings. He is motivated and after receiving this amount, he hopes for a productive turnover after utilizing this amount. 

Zafer Iqbal thanks Kiva and the field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a tractor.

loans.name: Sih

texts.en: A loan of $1,500 is offered to Sih to improve her business. She has a kiosk where many people come to shop every day. She will buy some additional supplies to keep in her kiosk such as slippers, eggs,  noodles, biscuits, sardines, cooking oil, soy sauce, detergent, sugar, coffee and other things to sell. She has been involved in business activities since 2011, with her own working capital of $600. She has good revenue every day because many people come to buy her items, so now she is taking a loan from Tuba Rai Metin because she wants to improve her management and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy slippers, eggs,  noodles, biscuits, sardines, cooking oil, soy sauce, detergent, sugar, coffee and other things to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new camera for his job.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is 34 years old with two children, one of whom is in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has been in this business for two years. She requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

In the future Josefina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou works hard to support her family. Marilou is married and has a van transportation business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years now.

Marilou has requested a 19,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase materials for the maintenance of her business. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase materials for the maintenance of her van transportation business

loans.name: Komlan

texts.fr: Jeune homme de 28ans, Komlan est électricien auto et revendeur de pièces détachées.  Aidé par 02 personnes, il sollicite l’aide de WAGES par un troisième crédit pour acheter des marchandises.  Komlan désire avoir une autre boutique à l’avenir et avoir une meilleure condition de vie. Il est mariée et père d'un enfant de 02 mois.
texts.en: A young man of 28, Komlan is a vehicle electrician and a reseller of auto parts. Assisted by two people, he is requesting WAGES' help in the form of a third loan to buy merchandise. Komlan wishes to open another shop in the future and to improve his circumstances. He is married and father to a two month old child.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts.

loans.name: Virgen Del Rosario Del Cusco Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “VIRGEN DEL ROSARIO DEL CUSCO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco

La socia es la Sra. Sonia ella es casada y tiene 37 años y tiene 4 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de restaurant, la socia prepara diferentes platos como pollo con papas, sopas y saltados de carnes, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 10 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de restaurant. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar productos para cocinar como pollo, carne y verduras.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de venta de granos, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de artesanía

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These borrowers belong to the "Virgen del Rosario del Cusco" communal bank in the Cusco district of the province and department of the same name.

One member is 37-year-old Sonia; she is married and has four children. Sonia has a restaurant where she prepares different dishes, such as chicken and potato, soups and meat stir fries. She works from 8am until 5pm. Sonia has had the business for ten years and it is going very well. Her dream is to expand it. Sonia is applying for this loan in order to buy products - such as chicken, meat and vegetables - to cook.

The other members of the loan group have different businesses, including selling grains, a grocery store and a handicrafts business.

Sonia is grateful to those helping to make her dream come true and promises to make her loan repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy products - such as chicken, meat and vegetables - to cook.

loans.name: Rene

texts.es:
El socio se sigue dedicando al negocio de transporteel socio realiza servicio urbano,por medio de este negocio el socio quiere salir adelante,el sueño del socio esw comprarse un carro nuevo.El socio solicita el credito para comprar llantas para su carro.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This borrower continues to work at his transport business. He works providing urban taxi services and, through this business, wants to get ahead. Rene's dream is to buy a new car. He is applying for this loan in order to buy tyres for his car.

Rene is happy with this loan and promises to make the repayments.

loans.use: to buy tyres for his car.

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
La socia Celia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de comida, la socia por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante, la socia hace platos como pollo al horno, sopas entre otros, el sueño de la socia es ampliar su negocio de venta de comida. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar verduras, pollo y carne.


La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Celia continues to work at her business selling food. Through this business, she wants to get ahead. Celia prepares dishes such as roast chicken, soup and more. Celia's dream is to expand the business. She is applying for this loan in order to buy chicken, meat and vegetables. 

Celia is happy with this loan and promises to make her repayments.

loans.use: to buy chicken, meat and vegetables.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy food stuffs for her restaurant

loans.name: Pho's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area located in the Borseth district of Kampong Speu province, Pho is 55 years old and married. She has been farming rice and working for others for a fee for almost 10 years. Her current business earns her about 40,000 KHR per day.

Pho is just with VisionFund for this cycle. Now she is leading her group to seek a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to build a decent latrine. She hopes to have a clean latrine to use in her family.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Fidèle

texts.fr:
_ -  
Fidèle a 25 ans, Mariée et mère de 2 enfants résident à Tokoin. Elle vend des  Produits cosmétiques. Elle s'approvisionne 2 Fois par mois au  Grand  marché  de  lomé  et  revend dans son  quaritier  environnant. Fidèle sollicite ce crédit pour agrandir son commerce afin de faire plus de profit
texts.en: Fidèle is 25 years old. She is married and the mother of two children, and lives in Tokoin. She sells cosmetic products, and stocks up on supplies twice a month in the Grand Marché in Lomé, and she trades in her local area. Fidèle is requesting this loan in order to grow her business and to make more profit.

loans.use: to purchase ointments and hair treatments.

loans.name: Ezi

texts.fr: Revendeur d'ordinateurs depuis 2009, Ezi âgé de 29ans est marié à une informaticienne. Pour augmenter son stock de marchandises, il sollicite un premier crédit à WAGES. le profit tiré de la vente lui servira d'améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille tout en gardant pérenne son activité.
texts.en: A computer retailer since 2009, Ezi is 29 years old and married to a computer technician. In order to expand his stock of product, he is requesting a first loan from WAGES. He will use the profit from these sales to improve his family's living conditions, whilst ensuring the continued success of his business.

loans.use: to purchase computers.

loans.name: Eden Marie

texts.en:
Eden Marie is 27 years old with one child. She works very hard to provide for her family.

Eden Marie runs a charcoal business in the Philippines, and has requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more charcoal to sell. She has been in this business for two years.

In the future, Eden Marie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal to sell

loans.name: Katherine

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al traqbajo como guia de turismo y tambien sigue teniendo su hospedaje por medio de este trabajo y negocio la socia quiere salir adelante,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de hospedaje.La socia solicita el credito para comprar colchones para las camas de su hopedaje.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: The borrower continues working as a tourism guide and also continues offering lodging accommodations. Through this work and business she wants to be successful; her dream is to expand her hotel business. The member seeks a loan to buy mattresses for the hotel beds. Katherine is happy for the loan and promises to make her payments.

loans.use: To buy mattresses for the hotel beds.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.es:
Daisy es de la ciudad de Carapeguá, comenta que su meta es poder estudiar para poder aumentar su rubro y poder mejorar sus ingresos. Es una mujer que quiere salir adelante, es por eso que se está esforzando bastante.
Está estudiando para ser docente, ya que quiere ser una profesora muy buena que ayude a los demás.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de las cuotas de su universidad, y también para poder invertirlo en cubrir sus gastos de tesis.
texts.en:
Daisy is from the city of Carapeguá and says her goal is to study to increase her skills and improve her income.  She is a woman who wants to get ahead and therefore makes a considerable effort.

She is studying to be a teacher and wants to be a very good one so she can help others.  The loan she is requesting is to cover university fees and also pay the costs of her thesis.

loans.use: To cover university fees and pay for her thesis.

loans.name: Elen Angelica

texts.es: La socia Elen Angelica  se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de productos de belleza, la socia vende lápiz labiales, cremas y perfumes, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los productos de belleza. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cremas, lápiz labiales y perfumes.
texts.en: Elen Angelica continues with her beauty products business selling lipsticks, creams and perfumes.  Her dream is to have a shop where she can sell her products.  The loan she is requesting is to buy creams, lipsticks and perfumes.

loans.use: To buy creams, lipsticks and perfumes.

loans.name: Agahikaine Kiryanga Group

texts.en: Lydia is a 48-year-old widow living in Kagadi, Uganda with two children, aged 24 and 17. She owns a produce store and also trades local brew, commonly known as waragi. She started this business to be able to educate her children after the death of her husband four years ago. Her dream is to build a house and educate her children. She is a member of the Agahikaine Kiryanga Group where each member guarantees the others to get a loan. Lydia wants a loan to buy maize and beans to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize and beans to sell.

loans.name: Rafaqat Ali

texts.en: Rafaqat Ali is a 36-year-old married man living with his wife and children in Lahore. He is a wholesaler of rice; he buys the rice from harvesters at a low price and sells in Lahore to retailers. He buys rice of various kinds, such as basmati, super kernel, etc. He has been doing this for many years and has many reputable retailers who like to buy rice from him in large quantities. Over the years, he has built up positive relationships with retailers, which has resulted in more customers. With the increase in new customers, he wants to buy rice in bulk so that he can easily cope with the rapid increase in demand. In this way, he would be able to increase his monthly income and savings as well. This is the reason Rafaqat Ali has requested a loan from Kiva's field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so he can buy rice of various types in bulk. Rafaqat Ali thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy rice in bulk for resale

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
Miguel es estudiante de la carrera de Derecho, tiene un hijo por quien se está esforzando para poder hacer de él, el día de mañana una persona con educación.
Es casado y comenta que su señora es Doctora en Medicina, este año él se recibe de abogado y se ve ejerciendo su profesión. Le gustaría montar una oficina en el centro de la ciudad y de esa forma poder seguir creciendo.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su universidad, y de esa forma poder estar más cerca de cumplir con su meta de ser un profesional exitoso.
texts.en:
Miguel is a law student and has a son who he works hard for in an effort to give him a good education.  Miguel is married and says his wife has a medical doctor's degree.  This year he will graduate and become a lawyer and sees himself practicing his profession.  He wants to set up an office in the city center and continue growing.

He is requesting a loan to pay university fees so he can be closer to meeting his goal of being a successful professional.

loans.use: To pay university fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy crockery and cosmetics for resale.

loans.name: Sally

texts.en: Sally is 37 years old and has three children who are in school. She works very hard to provide for them. Sally runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 23,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell, such as canned goods, eggs, milk, coffee, etc. Sally has been in this business for five years. In the future, Sally would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell, such as canned goods, eggs, milk, coffee, etc.

loans.name: Geetanjali

texts.en:
Geetanjali is 45 years old and a widow who lives in Rourkela city, Odisha, India with her two sons who are 26 and 23 years old. Her elder son works in a private company as a clerk and her younger son goes to the university. She owns a variety store where she sells personal care products, modern fashion items, gifts items and stationery items. She earns 8,000 INR per month from this activity. She is a very responsible and hardworking woman. She keep open her shop from 7 am to 10 pm daily.

Geetanjali wants to expand her business by adding more varieties of personal care products and gift items and for this she has requested a loan of 30,000 INR. She says, "Now-a-days customers every time ask for new types of gift items so this loan will help me to maintain a broad range of gift items in my store. " She is very happy with this loan and thankful to Kiva for this kind support.

loans.use: To purchase different varieties of personal care products and gift items to sell

loans.name: Nhóm 07, Ngọc Bản, Vạn Hòa Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hạnh works in agriculture raising poultry. She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

Hạnh is 39 years old and married with two children. She is the leader of a three-member group, the Nhóm 07, Ngọc Bản, Vạn Hòa solidarity group. 

In 2014, Hạnh joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business and has successfully repaid two loans. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Hạnh faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In the future, Hạnh hopes for her children to find a good job, for her business to do well, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is grateful that she was granted a 49,000 PHP loan which she used to purchase various grocery items and products needed in her general store. Through her earnings she is able to send her children to school and meet their daily living expenses.

She would now like to apply for a 50,000 PHP loan to buy more quantities of grocery items like rice, coffee, soda, rice and other products. She knows that more items in her store will yield more sales and thus increase her earnings. Her husband also make balusters (balustrades) and she sells them in their community.  Her earnings from her store and making balusters is a stable source of income to sustain her family's basic needs and for the education of her children. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given to her.

Edna dreams of having a bigger general store and aims to give her children the best education possible to ensure them of a better future. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God, which she studies.

 *All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma works hard to support her family. She is a widow and has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

Alma has been in this business for seven years now.

In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: M. Arif

texts.en:
M. Arif is a 40-year-old married man living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. He is the father of two children. 

He is a cobbler by profession and very expert in his arts. He has been manufacturing shoes for many years. This is the reason he has a lot of experience in his profession. He sews leather and rexine shoes by machine, then attaches the sole by stitching with his hands. In this way, he is generating income for his family. He has been making shoes at home. Now he established a shop to continue his business on a wider level, but he does not have cash in hand to buy the initial raw materials for making shoes.

Therefore, M. Arif has requested a loan so he can buy the initial raw material such as leather, rexine, buckles, laces, polish etc. for making shoes.

M. Arif thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy leather, rexine, buckles, laces, and polish to make shoes.

loans.name: Ny's Group

texts.en:
Age 31 years old, Ny is a married mother of two children living in a rural village of the Borseth district, Cambodia. To support her big family, Ny has been farming rice for 13 years in the village. The current business earns her about 35,000 KHR per day. 

Ny’s group consists of five members and she is the leader of this group. She is a third cycle client with VisionFund. She has successfully used the past loans from VisionFund to better support her family. Now requesting a new loan, she will use her portion to build a clean latrine for use by her family. She hopes to have it to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to build a clean latrine for use by her family

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia is married with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Ofelia is 48 years old and three of her children are in school.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines. Ofelia requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase fishing materials like paints, wood, fishing net, etc for the maintenance of her business.

Ofelia has been in this business for seven years. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fishing materials like paint, wood, and fishing net

loans.name: Romelia

texts.en:
Romelia is 43 years old and has eight children. She is married and four of her children are in school.

She is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Romelia requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Romelia has been raising pigs for five years now and has borrowed 24 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Romelia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Najwa

texts.en:
Najwa is a 49-year-old married woman from a village near Jenin city. She lives with her husband and six kids in a small simple house. Her husband is a worker who gets a low income. This income is barely enough to cover all the family's needs. Najwa works at raising sheep to help her husband with the family expenses. She makes diary products and sells them in the local market. 

Najwa took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy more sheep for her business. By taking this loan, Najwa will be able to improve her  productivity and the family income. 

Najwa appeared in the photo while she was working

loans.use: to buy more sheep for her business

loans.name: Pov's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village of Kampong Spuer province’s Borseth district, Pov is a 33-year-old mother of three dependent children. She has been making a living through farming rice and working for others for a fee. Having been in this business for two years, she is able to earn about 30,000 KHR per day.
 
Pov’s group consists of five female members and she has been with VisionFund for two cycles. She completely paid back the loans with VisionFund. The past loans have helped her better support her family. Now she and her group member are applying for a loan. As the leader, she will use her portion to construct a decent latrine for use by her family. She wants to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to construct a decent latrine for use by her family

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more sheep for her business.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Alicia works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell of rice business in the Philippines and earns additional income from buying and selling fish. Alicia is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell. 

Alicia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 24 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en: Benjamin is a Ugandan male aged 38 years living in Kagadi, Uganda. He is married with 4 children between 4 and 14 years old and all attend school. He owns a drug store and supplements his income with proceeds from farming and selling produce. His dream is to finish up his residential house and upgrade his business to a clinic. He is challenged by competition from similar businesses. He wants a loan to buy drugs to sell.

loans.use: to buy drugs to sell

loans.name: M. Riaz

texts.en:
M. Riaz is 57 years of age and lives with his wife and four children in the area of Gujrat, Pakistan. 
He supplies eggs to the general store and bakeries as well as to the common people.  His monthly net income is too low to meet the household needs because there are too many competitors in the market. Due to reasonable prices most of the customers like to buy eggs from him. He wants to buy eggs in bulk to increase the stock on a daily basis, but he does not have enough cash in hand to buy eggs in large quantities. Therefore, M. Riaz has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that he can buy more eggs to sell. 
M. Riaz is very happy after receiving this loan; he thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy eggs in bulk for reselling.

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina is 53 years old and married with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks such as soap, shampoo, sardines, bread and chips to sell.

Divina has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 25 years and also earns an income from rice retailing.

Divina aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks such as soap, shampoo, sardines, bread and chips to sell

loans.name: Nathalia

texts.es:
Nathalia vive con sus padres, ella trabaja y a la vez estudia. En lo Personal es una persona responsable humilde y trabajadora ya que tiene como ejemplos a sus padres, ella tiene como Objetivo llegar a culminar sus estudios Universitarios y llegar a recibirse de abogada. 
Luego tiene también pensado continuar con la Maestría de dicho campo. Para así llegar a su meta que es llegar a tener y manejar su propio negocio y llegar a independizarse y tener una familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder cubrir sus gastos de titulación, que le será de mucha ayuda para poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Nathalia lives with her parents. She works and studies.  She is a simple, responsible and hardworking person. Her parents are role models for her. Her goal is to finish her university studies and become a lawyer. She would also like to pursue a Master’s degree in that area, which would help her to achieve her goals and start her own business. She will be able to become independent and have her own family.

Nathalia is requesting a loan to cover some graduation costs in order to be able to continue with her studies.

loans.use: to cover some graduation costs.

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es:
Fernando es el mayor de una familia de seis hermanos, trabaja en una zapatería para costear sus estudios universitarios.
Está estudiando para poder ser perito, en el futuro desea ser un Perito renombrado y reconocido por su buena labor, es por ello que se está esforzando cada día.
Pide este préstamo para poder cubrir sus gastos de cuotas y transporte, agradece por la ayuda que recibe, que le será muy útil.
texts.en:
Fernando is the oldest in a family of six children. He works in a shoe store to pay for college education. He is studying to become an appraiser. In the future, he wants to be a renown and well known appraiser because of his good work. That is why he is working hard every day. 

He is asking for this loan to cover his college tuition and transportation costs. He is grateful for the help he is receiving and it will be very useful.

loans.use: to pay for college education and transportation.

loans.name: Cinthia

texts.es:
Cinthia proviene de una familia de escasos recursos, la misma se desempeña en el área Administrativa de una facultad para costear sus estudios. Está estudiando la carrera de economía, y comenta que su meta es culminar sus estudios con las mejores calificaciones y ser una reconocida economista y así mejorar la calidad de vida de sus padres.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en pagar sus cuotas de la universidad.
texts.en:
Cinthia comes from a low-income family. She works for the administrative area of one of the faculties, in order to pay for her studies. She studies Economics, and says that her goal is to graduate with the best grades and become a renowned economist in order to help her parents and improve their living conditions.

Cinthia is requesting a loan to pay the university fees.

loans.use: to pay the university fees.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
Jose tiene 28 años es un estudiante muy sacrificado y trabajador, su meta es ser alguien en la vida.
Está estudiando la carrera de criminalista, sus aspiraciones son la de poder tener una oficina propia para poder trabajar más tranquilamente.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de las cuotas de su universidad, de manera a poder seguir luchando por sus sueños.
texts.en: Jose is 28 years old. He is a student and hardworking. His goal is to be someone in life. He is studying to be a criminal defense lawyer. His goal is to have his own office to work more peacefully. He is asking for this loan to be able to invest it in paying for college tuition. This way, he can keep fighting for his dreams.

loans.use: to pay for college tuition.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.es:
Fatima quiere ser una escribana útil a la sociedad en todas las cuestiones puestas a su consideración, es por ello que se esta esforzando cada día, comenta que su préstamo anterior lo uso para poder pagar los gastos de su universidad que le fue muy útil.
Hoy pide un nuevo préstamo para poder pagar sus cuotas, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios luchando por su meta de ser una buen profesional.
texts.en:
Fatima wants to be a notary public, useful to society in all matters brought for her consideration. That is why she is striving every day. She says that she used her previous loan to be able to pay for college tuition and it was very useful for her.  

Today she is asking for a new loan to be able to pay for her tuition. This way, she can continue with her education, fighting for her goal to be a good professional.

loans.use: to pay for college tuition.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.es:
Jessica es de la ciudad de Pilar, vive con sus padres, tiene un hermano. 
Comenta que es Abogada, pero que está haciendo un curso de diplomado, de manera a poder seguir incrementando sus conocimientos, y así ser una mejor profesional, ella es una persona que está luchando y se sacrifica.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su diplomado, de manera a poder seguir con sus estudios y ser una profesional útil a la sociedad.
texts.en:
Jessica is from the city of Pilar. She lives with her parents and has one brother.

Jessica is a lawyer but is also doing a diploma in order to increase her knowledge and be a better professional. She is fighting and making sacrifices for her goals.

Jessica is applying for this loan in order to pay tuition fees. She can then continue with her studies and be a professional who will be useful for society.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees.

loans.name: Nicolas

texts.es:
Nicolas es de la ciudad de Pilar, vive con su madre, actualmente está estudiando la carrera de Ingeniería en informática, y quiere, por medio de su carrera ayudar a su familia.
Es una persona que lucha por salir adelante, y pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su universidad, y de esa forma poder seguir luchando por su meta.
texts.en: Nicolas is from the city of Pilar. He lives with his mother, is currently studying for a degree in informatics engineering, and he wants to help his family by means of his career. He is someone who strives to get ahead, and he is asking for this loan to be able to pay his university fees. In this way, he will be able to keep striving towards his goal.

loans.use: to pay university fees

loans.name: Blanca

texts.es:
Blanca es de la ciudad de Villarrica, está estudiando la carrera de enfermería, es una persona muy luchadora que quiere salir adelante para poder ayudar a sus seres queridos.
Blanca quiere seguir estudiando para el día de mañana ayudar a las personas que necesiten atención en su salud.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su universidad, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios, luchando por mejorar.
texts.en: Blanca is from the city of Villarrica and is studying for a degree in nursing. She is a very hardworking person who wants to get ahead to be able to help her loved ones. Blanca wants to keep studying so that she can help people who need health care in the future. She is asking for this loan to be able to pay her university fees. In this way she will be able to continue with her studies, striving to improve.

loans.use: to pay university fees

loans.name: Shyrley

texts.es:
Shyrley está siguiendo la carrera de químico farmacéutico, y comenta que le ayuda mucho en su carrera que su familia tenga una farmacia.
Él está luchando por salir adelante y poder ayudar a su familia por medio de su carrera, está luchando por poder sobresalir.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de las cuotas de su universidad, y así poder seguir luchando por mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en: Shyrley is studying the career of Pharmaceutical Chemistry, and she says that it is helpful to her career that her family has a pharmacy. She is struggling to move ahead and be able to help her family thanks to her career. She is working hard to be able to excel. She is requesting a loan to pay college tuition fees and to be able to keep improving her life conditions.

loans.use: to pay college tuition fees.

loans.name: Sanie

texts.es:
Sanie es una profesional médica, ella sigue estudiando la especialidad de medicina familiar.
Comenta que como medica puede ayudar a las personas en algo tan importante como es la salud, pero que le gustaría poder ir un poco más allá, es por ello que está buscando especializarse.
Pide este préstamo para poder cubrir las cuotas de su curso de especialización, para que de esa forma pueda seguir luchando y cumplir con su meta anhelada.
texts.en: Sanie is a medical professional. She continues studying for the specialization in family medicine. She says that as a doctor she is able to help people in something as important as health, but she would like to go a bit further. This is why she is seeking to specialize. She is asking for this loan to be able to pay the fees for her specialization course of study so she will be able to keep striving and achieve her desired goal.

loans.use: to pay for specialization fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new camera.

loans.name: Lote Guasu Group

texts.es:
Este grupo está en su segundo ciclo del programa de comité de mujeres, ellas están luchando por poder crecer y salir adelante. Cada una está poniendo su mejor esfuerzo para crecer y ayudar a su familia.
Daisy se dedica a las ventas varias, y comenta que pide este préstamo para poder surtirse con todo tipo de productos, como comestibles, verduras, productos de limpieza y demás, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas.
Ella es una persona muy luchadora que a pesar de los problemas e inconvenientes quiere salir adelante.
texts.en:
This group is in its second cycle of the women's committee program. They are striving to be able to grow and get ahead. Each woman is making her best effort to grow and to help her family.

Daisy makes a living selling various things, and she says she is asking for this loan to be able stock up on all kinds of products, such as groceries, vegetables, cleaning products and other items, in order to be able to keep selling. She is a very hardworking person who wants to get ahead in spite of problems and inconveniences.

loans.use: to buy groceries, vegetables, cleaning products and other items

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El grupo Mujeres Unidas está en su primer ciclo del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan unidas, es por ello que el grupo lleva ese nombre. Todas quieren ayudar a sus familias por medio del trabajo en conjunto.
Claudia tiene una mercería bien surtida donde trabaja para poder ayudar a su familia y a sus seres queridos, es por eso que está luchando cada día. Ella quiere que su familia tenga una mejor vida, y es por ellos que está luchando. Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de prendas de mercería, como ser artículos de bazar, prendas varias, y otros, de manera a poder seguir mejorando su estilo de vida.
texts.en: The group "Mujeres Unidas" is in its first cycle of the program of the women's committee, where all women work together. This is why the group has this name. Everyone wants to support their families through joint work. Claudia has a well stocked sewing supply shop where she works to support her family and loved ones, the reason why she struggles day by day. She wants her family to have a better life, and for them she works hard. She is requesting this loan to invest in buying sewing supplies such as bazaar items, diverse garments and others, so that she can continue improving her life style.

loans.use: to buy bazaar items, diverse garments, and other things.

loans.name: Pascal

texts.en: Pascal is a 27-year-old single man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He owns a bar with a lodge alongside. He faces the challenges of having limited time to supervise. However, he hopes to have a fully furnished lodge and bar. Pascal needs a loan to buy four beds for his lodge.

loans.use: to buy four beds

loans.name: Dilafruz

texts.ru: Дилафруз 21 год. Она одна из женщин , которые занимаются продажей варенного гороха.Дилафруз полна радости и желания жить не смотря на то , что ее семья не имеет большую прибыль и поэтому она после окончания школы не смогла поступить в университет.  Она обратилась в "Арванд" впервые, когда узнала, что есть возможность получить финансовую поддержку.Она хочет поддержать своего племянника и оплатить его учебу. Она надеется , что в будущем также сможет получить  образование. Сама Дилафруз живет в сельской местности. Чтобы иметь доход на пропитание, Дилафруз занимается своим бизнесом. Дилафруз очень надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит "Арванд"  за поддержку.
texts.en: Dilafruz is 21. She is one of the women who sells boiled peas. She is full of life and joy even though her family does not have a large income and she was therefore not able to attend university. She first applied for a loan with Arvand when she learned it was possible to receive financial assistance. She wants to help her nephew and pay for his studies. She hopes that he will be able to get an education. Dilafruz lives in a rural area and has her business to earn income. She is hoping for a positive outcome and thanks Arvand in advance for their support.

loans.use: to pay for her nephew's tuition

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is 59 years old, married and works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling charcoal and firewood in the Philippines. She also earns additional income from food vending.  Elsie is borrowing PHP 26,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal and firewood to sell for her business buying and selling charcoal and firewood.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she is requesting an additional loan to further build her business.

Elsie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 30 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal and firewood to sell

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Gloria works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending.  Gloria is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to  purchase additional stocks like biscuits, noodles, sardines, etc. to sell for her general store business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she requested additional loan to further build her business.

Gloria has been sustaining her business activities through her past 8 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like biscuits, noodles, sardines, etc. to sell

loans.name: Net's Group

texts.en:
Net is 30 years old and married. She lives with her husband and five children in a rural area of the Borseth district of Kampong Spuer province. She and her husband are rice farmers. Having been in this business for 30 years, together they can earn about KHR 35,000 per day. 

Net is a first cycle client with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she wants to use her portion to build a latrine. She hopes that this loan will enable her to have a clean latrine for her family to use.

loans.use: to build a latrine for her family to use.

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Christopher used the previous loan to  purchase a new motorcycle. He is still in transport and faces challenges of bad roads and competition. However, he hopes to educate all his children to higher levels of learning. 

Christopher needs a loan to buy cement and sand and pay workers for constructing his house.

loans.use: to buy cement and sand and pay workers for constructing his house.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 34 years old and single. She was assigned to manage the school canteen within the local community. She aimed to continue and improve this business to generate sufficient income. 

She wants to acquire more snack foods and school supplies to sell, but she has inadequate capital. For this reason, she would like to access financial assistance from Kiva lenders amounting to PHP16,000 to buy junk food, soft drinks, juice, banana cue, fruits and other snack foods to sell. 

She is hoping that she will obtain her loan request to be able for her to improve the business.

loans.use: to buy junk food, soft drinks, juice, banana cue, fruits and other snack foods

loans.name: Manzura

texts.ru: Манзура молодая 20-летняя девушка, проживающая в районе Дж.Руми вместе с братьями и сестрой. Она самостоятельная и независимая девушка. Два года назад Манзура начала зарабатывать путем предоставления услуги швеи. Она умеет шить и кроить и научилась этому делу у своей матери. Манзура сейчас хочет обновить свою швейную машинку, так как она часто ломается и причиняет ей много неудобств в процессе работы. За счет суммы кредита Манзура хочет приобрести новую модернизированную швейную машинку, благодаря которому она расширит свою деятельность. Этот кредит действительно важен Манзуре.
texts.en: Manzura is a young 20-year-old woman who lives in the J.Rumy district with her brothers and sisters. She is an independent and self-reliant woman. She started earning money as a seamstress two years ago. She learned how to cut and sew from her mother. Manzura currently wants to update her sewing machine since it is always breaking and causing her trouble with her work. She wants to use the loan to buy a new, modernized sewing machine in order to expand her business. This loan is very important for Manzura.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Dinah

texts.en:
To make a living, Dinah operates a general store in their village. She settled for a living in Bonifacio with a sibling who helped her in running the business. For many years, this has been the only source of income for this single entrepreneur who wants to have success in her business. 

She has repaid successfully her previous loan from Gata Daku MPC, used for purchasing grocery goods for her store. 

To offer more to her costumers, she took a new loan recently to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to sell.

loans.name: Vanansio

texts.en:
Vanansio is a 43-year-old man with 10 children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He does farming and lumber. He faces challenges of limited capital, however, he has hopes of educating all his children to higher levels of learning. 

He has asked for a loan to buy a forest for tree cutting to make timber.

loans.use: to buy a forest for tree cutting (timber)

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick used the previous loan to buy tyres for his vehicle. He is still in the same business of transport and in addition he owns rentals. He faces challenges of bad roads and unpredictable weather changes. 

His dream is to educate all his children to higher levels of learning. 

Patrick needs a loan to buy materials and tiles for his house construction.

loans.use: to buy materials and tiles for his house construction.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is a 38-year-old married man with three children living in Fort Portal, Uganda.

He rears goats to sell. He faces hardships of limited capital, He has hopes of educating all his children to higher levels of learning. 

Francis needs a loan to buy goats for rearing.

loans.use: to buy goats to raise.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is a 44-year-old married man with four children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. 

He sells produce and faces challenges of limited capital.

He hopes to educate all his children to higher levels of learning. 

Robert needs a loan to buy maize, beans and ground nuts to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize, beans and ground nuts to sell.

loans.name: Connielyn

texts.en:
Connielyn has faithfully paid back her previous loan, which she used for her business. She has been operating her own tailoring business for years, and she earns well from this. Having a bigger responsibility requires more effort to provide for their needs, especially for her children. Connielyn had to work hard, with the determination of having better income, to provide her child with a better education. 

To improve her profit, Connielyn would like to apply for a new loan. With PHP 25,000, she could already purchase more quantities of raw materials like fabric, thread, and other materials for her business. She sincerely lets you know her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

In the future, Connielyn hopes to grow her business, as well as improve the living condition of her family and give her children a better education. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and from studying the word of God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fabric, cloth, thread, and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Theav

texts.en:
Theav is 19 years old, a student at a university, and also a bellboy at a hotel. He is single and lives with his parents in Seam Reap province of Cambodia. Being a bellboy, he can earn approximately $3 a day. 

Because of a lack of financial support, Theav would like to request a loan to pay for his tuition fee. This loan will help him graduate. 

In the future, he is going to find a better job with a better salary and, if possible, he wants to buy a plot of land to build his own house.

loans.use: to pay for his tuition fee

loans.name: Rashid

texts.en:
Rashid is a 37-year-old married man with two children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. 

He owns a spare parts business and offers repairing services. He faces hardships of competition, but he hopes to become a wholesaler. 

Rashid needs a loan to buy motorcycle spare parts such as rim tubes and lubricants to sell.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle spare parts such as rim tubes and lubricants to sell.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a 53-year-old married man with six children living in Fort Portal, Uganda.

He owns a furniture workshop and works as a chair man. The high cost of timber affects his business in terms of pricing. He hopes to expand his business to new areas so as to generate more income. 

Charles needs a loan to buy timber for making furniture.

loans.use: to buy timber for making furniture.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To repair his house.

loans.name: Santa Elena Group

texts.es:
En total son 19 mujeres inspiradas que se esfuerzan día a día para solventar los gastos del hogar y por sobre todo aumentar sus ingresos.
La Sra. Flora se encuentra contenta por formar parte del comité que mediante eso ella pudo emprender una actividad para ganarse la vida, ella elabora comestibles y se dedica a la venta de manera ambulante. Ella pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de verduras, carne, condimentos, etc., lo que le ayudará a seguir con su trabajo y mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
La Sra. Flora y demás compañeras integrantes del grupo están constantemente incentivadas para que sean verdaderamente mujeres emprendedoras con ganas de trabajar y superar la pobreza.
texts.en:
There are 19 inspired women in all who put forth great effort day to day in order to pay the household expenses.  They strive, above all, to increase their earnings.

Flora is happy to be part of the communal bank.  By doing so, she was able to undertake a business activity in order to earn a living.  She makes food, and she sells it in an itinerant manner.

She is requesting the loan to buy vegetables, meat, and condiments, etc.  This will help her to continue with her work and improve her living conditions.

Flora and her colleagues, who are members of the group, are constantly motivated. They are truly entrepreneurial woman who have the desire to work and overcome poverty.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, and condiments, etc.

loans.name: Filomena

texts.en:
Filomena wants to buy some additional supplies to keep in her kiosk, but her working capital is not enough.

She hopes to take a loan from Tuba Rai Metin to add to her working capital because she wants to buy more needed items to keep in her store including biscuits, candies, eggs, noodles, coffee and other things to sell. 

She has been involved in business activities since 2008 with her own working capital of $250. She is requesting a loan of $600 from Tuba Rai Metin because she wants to improve her business and she hopes to open a big store in the future. 

Filomena also cultivate animals in her place like cows, pigs and chickens.

loans.use: To buy biscuits, candies, eggs, noodles, coffee and other things to sell.

loans.name: Rabab

texts.en:
Rabab is a 36-year-old married woman from a village near Jenin. She lives with her husband and six children: one son and five daughters. All of them attend school. 

Rabab and her husband have a small farm where they plants olive trees. They sell the fresh olive oil in the local market.
 
Rabab took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy more olive seedlings for her farm. By taking this loan, Rabab will be able to increase the farm productivity and also her income. This will help her to improve the family's living conditions.
 
Rabab appears in the photo at the family farm.

loans.use: to buy more olive seedlings for her farm.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Jane, appearing on the photo, works tirelessly to support her family. She is 25 years old. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2012, and she gained business management, savings and financial management skills. This has helped improve her life. 

She does dairy farming. She is financially constrained and this makes her borrow a loan to buy high quality fodder for the dairy cows. This will increase the milk production, hence, more milk supply. Jane looks forward to increased income and hopes she will be able to educate her children and provide them with basic needs. 

Jane is grateful for Kiva and their lenders for the support.

loans.use: to buy fodder for the dairy cows.

loans.name: Long's Group

texts.en:
Living a wooden house in Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Long is 45 years old and married with one child. The main sources of her family’s income are farming rice and working for others for a fee. Having been in this business for 27 years, she is able to earn about 30,000 KHR (Cambodian riels) per day.

This is the first loan for Long with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan to buy a clean latrine to use in her family. She hopes to have a clean latrine to use in her family.

loans.use: to buy a clean latrine to use in her family

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is a 43-year-old, hardworking, married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He deals in the making and selling of soft drinks, that is bushera (porridge), which he started so as to improve his standards of living and educate his children. He also earns additional income from farming. His main challenges are inadequate capital and price fluctuations, though he hopes to increase his profits and have educated children.
 
He is requesting a loan to buy materials for making bushera (porridge).

loans.use: to buy materials for making bushera (porridge).

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
The person in the photo is Martha. She is 25 years old, married and blessed with three children.

Martha does dairy farming, which she has been able to manage and expand after Hand in Hand Eastern Africa training, where she has acquired skills on savings, enterprise development and proper financial management.

In early 2014 she borrowed 10,000 Kenyan shillings from Hand in Hand Eastern Africa Enterprise Incubation Fund to expand her farming activities, which she repaid promptly.

She is borrowing a loan to buy quality fodder for her dairy cows. She hopes her supply will increase, and hence, more income. It is from these profits that she will ensure food security in her household.

She is happy for Kiva for the financial support.

loans.use: To buy fodder for her dairy cows

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for tuition fees and buy school materials for his son

loans.name: Ayuda Mutua Group

texts.es:
El grupo Ayuda Mutua es de la ciudad de San  Juan, ellas son unidas y solidarias entre ellas trabajan en actividades, donde están conformes y sienten el apoyo del programa de comité de mujeres.
La Sra. Patricia es la presidenta del grupo, ella vive con su hijo y su marido en su modesta casa de la ciudad de San Ignacio, todos en la casa colabora en el desarrollo y el crecimiento del nivel de vida de la familia. Patricia es peluquera muy trabajadora y luchadora.
La Sra. Patricia solicita  este préstamo para invertir  en artículos de peluquería ya que esa es su actividad, necesita algunos productos para poder contar con más clientas, eso dará más ingreso a su casa y  así poder satisfacer sus necesidades y la de su familia.
texts.en:
The Ayuda Mutua group is from the city of San Juan.  They are united and supportive of each other.  They work in business activities where they are content and feel the support of the women’s committee program.

Patricia is the president of the group.  She lives with her son and her husband in a modest house in the city of San Ignacio.  Everyone in the house contributes to the development and growth of the family’s standard of living.  Patricia is a very hard-working and tenacious hairdresser.

Patricia is requesting the loan to buy hairdressing items because that is her business activity.  She needs some products to be able to have more customers.  This will provide more income for her household.  This way she will be able to meet her needs and those of her family.

loans.use: to buy beauty salon items like dyes, scissors, and creams, etc.

loans.name: Sokha's Group

texts.en:
Sokha, 43, is from a rural village located in Borseth district of Kampong Speu province. She is married with four children. She and her husband have earned a living through farming rice for 25 years. The current business earns her about 30,000 KHR (Cambodian riels) per day.

This is Sokha’s Group microloan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, and they are first-time borrowers with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy a clean latrine. She hopes have a decent latrine to use in her family.

loans.use: to buy a clean latrine

loans.name: Chesa Self Help Group

texts.en:
The person standing on the left side on the photo is Dorcas. She is a member of the Chesa Self Help Group. She is married and a mother of 11 children. Dorcas is 71 years old.
 
She does maize, bean and potato farming. With the training she got from Hand in Hand, she has been able to commercialize her farming, and now she is able to get more profits from her farming as compared to before. She is borrowing a loan to purchase farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizer. This will enable her to increase the crop yield, hence resulting in more sales and thus meeting the demand for maize and beans in her locality. This will ensure she improves her income, and hence, be in a position to support her family.

She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for this support.

loans.use: To purchase planting seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Ustawi Group

texts.en:
Wema is a mother of two schooling sons. She is married and aged in her early forties. She has had a genge (grocery store) business, selling fruits, vegetables and charcoal, for 10 years now. Wema is working from 5 a.m. to 9 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit. 

From Tujijenge Tanzania, this is her more than tenth credit cycle. Wema used the previous credits to extend her charcoal capital from 30 to 50 bags and bought more genge stock to attract more customers. She has paid back all loans successfully. She used the profit to cover school fees and household expenses. Her desire is to one day be able to expand her business and be successful in life. She is now back again to request a loan, which she will use to buy fruits and vegetables for her genge. 

Wema will share this loan with her loan group, "Ustawi," which consists of two members. The group members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables for her genge (grocery store).

loans.name: Bunyoro Tourism And Environment Group

texts.en:
Charles is a Ugandan male aged 50 years. He is living in Kagadi, Uganda, and is married with seven children aged between 31 and 6 years. He is into fish farming and owns several ponds. He also earns from other farming activities, like tree planting and the growing of beans and maize. His dream is to buy a plot in Kagadi Town.
