However, Charles has limited capital, but he hopes the loan will enable him to expand and diversify his business. 

He is a member of the Bunyoro Tourism and Environment Conservation group, where each member guarantees the other to get a loan. Charles wants a loan to buy fish to restock the ponds.

loans.use: to buy fish to restock the ponds.

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en:
This is Cheryl, 28, of Coron, Palawan, Philippines. She is married to Gerlou, a teacher, and they have one child who is not of school age yet. She manages her own household while operating the business. She works hard to augment their income to meet her family’s daily personal and household needs. 

Cheryl operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood.  It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5-pesos-worth of cooking oil or an egg. She earns by buying  supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 300 PHP (Philippines pesos) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business and increase her sales, she is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. This will definitely boost her income as she expands her business. 

Cheryl hopes to be able to grow her business and give her family a better life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, beverages and toiletries for her general store.

loans.name: Mujeres Activas Group

texts.es:
Este grupo forma parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, donde a través de el podrán conocer la situación de vida de cada una de ellas.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Ofelia, directora general del Comité, quien en su encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel tres, lo que quiere decir que ha ido mejorando con su esfuerzo y trabajo.  Ella vende comidas que hace y que luego sale a vender de manera ambulante, es una mujer muy luchadora que ayuda a su familia por medio de ese trabajo que realiza.
La Sra Ofelia solicita de este préstamo para la compra de mas insumos varios para la elaboración de comestibles, como ser carne, condimentos, verduras, hortalizas y demás, de manera a poder seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en: This group was formed as part of the Poverty Stoplight program through which each member gets to know their life situation. One of the members is Ofelia who is the Director General of the Committee, who in the survey showed a level three on the poverty scale. Which means she is getting better by way of her work and effort. She sells meals that she makes and later sells them in the streets. She is a very determined woman who helps her family through the work she does. Ofelia is requesting this loan to buy  more supplies to make her meals like meat, spices, vegetables and others. In this way she can continue with her work as she has been doing. She is grateful for the support she is receiving which will be a lot of help.

loans.use: meat, spices, vegetables and others.

loans.name: Vya Renda Group

texts.es:
Vya Renda  está en su Quinto ciclo del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas se comprometieron a trabajar y a ayudarse entre todas para salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde todas están luchando por salir adelante.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Blanca, quien en su  encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno, lo que quiere decir que debe seguir trabajando para mejorar sus condiciones de vida. Blanca se dedica a la venta de carne de cerdos, y es por medio de su trabajo que lucha para poder ayudar a su familia y a sus seres queridos. Blanca es una persona muy trabajadora con ganas de salir adelante.
texts.en:
Vya Renda is in its fifth year. This group of women commit to working together to help each other to make progress. They are part of the program designed to help lift them out of poverty.

One of the group members is Sra. Blanca. The survey has shown that she is at poverty level 1 which means that she has to continue working to improve her standard of living. She sells pork and it is through this work that she manages to support her family and her loved ones. Blanca is a very hardworking person with a great desire to get ahead.

loans.use: buy pork to resell

loans.name: Nueva Vida Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “NUEVA VIDA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es Juli Karina la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de ropa, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día  su negocio, la socia vende chompas, casacas entre otros, la socia desea poder continuar trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
 La socia solicita el crédito para comprar casacas.
 Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de venta de zapatos, negocio de tienda de abarrotes, brindando el servicio de taxi.
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the "NUEVA VIDA” communal bank which is located in the district of Cusco, belonging to the province and department of the same name.

Juli Karina is one member who alternates her daily activities with her business of selling clothing. She has been doing this business for a long time and things are gong well for her thanks to the determination that she puts into her work each day. She sells sweaters and jackets amongst other things. She wants to continue to work in order to support her family. She is requesting the loan to buy jackets.

The other members work in businesses selling clothing, selling shoes, a grocery store and providing taxi service. Juli is grateful to those who form part of this dream through the loan and promises to pay the installments of her loan on time.

loans.use: to buy jackets.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy ingredients in bulk, and restaurant furniture such as tables and chairs

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es:
La socia Marisol ,la socia continua dedicándose a su negocio de  bordado con hilos y realiza por ejemplo de cojines, alfombras, mantas, capas, manteles y otros con hilos,  la socia lleva años dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia pertenece al banco comunal "Cusco" .
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de hilos, tijeras entre otros.
La socia  se siente contenta por el préstamo y se compromete a pagar las cuotas puntuales y con mucha responsabilidad. Agradece a todos los inversionistas por el préstamo y desea que sigan apoyando a los demás proyectos.
texts.en: Marisol continues in her business of embroidery with thread and making cushions, rugs, blankets, capes, tablecloths and others with thread. She has been working in this business for years and things are going well for her thanks to the determination she puts into her business each day. She belongs to the "Cusco" communal bank. She is requesting a loan to buy thread, scissors amongst others. She is very happy for the loan and promises to pay the installments of her loan with great responsibility. She is grateful to all the lenders for the loan and wants them to continue to support the other projects.

loans.use: to buy thread, scissors and other things.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for school tuition for her son.

loans.name: Florenda

texts.en: Florenda is 60 years old and widowed. She was gifted with five children who are all now adults. They live happily in a rural community. To have an additional source of income, Florenda raises hogs in her community. She aims to improve this business in order to earn a higher income. Having inadequate capital, she would like to avail a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy hog feed, vitamins, and vaccines for her hogs. She believes that this financial assistance will enable her to improve the business.

loans.use: to buy hog feed, vitamins, and vaccines

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en: Lorna is 49 years old, married and the mother of six children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur who earns a living by buying and selling fish in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 20,000 loan from NWTF to buy more boxes of fish to sell. She has repaid a previous loan and plans to use this new one to expand her business. Lorna has been in her current line of work for 15 years. Her goal for the future is to save enough money to build a house for her family to live in.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 56 years old and has six children. She lives in her own home that is made out of rustic materials. She has very good personal and work references in her community, located in the remote village of Mogenge, Kisii area of Kenya. 

Mary is a farmer with 15 years of experience, specifically in practicing dairy farming. She passionately loves dairy farming. Milking and feeding her own cow are the most enjoyable parts about farming. She is very appreciative that dairy farming has been able to sustain farmers in her village. Profits from milk sales have enabled her to take care of her family, and she has always yearned to have more dairy cows. 

Mary requested a loan, which she will use to buy a good breed of dairy cow. She has already identified the breed of cow that she will buy. The cow will be producing between 15-20 liters of milk daily. This breed of cow will be producing milk referred to as the ideal drinking milk, because it will contain an adequate amount of fat and the desirable quantities of protein. This cow will boost milk production on her farm, which will translate to more sales volume and better income for her and her family. Because of this high milk production potential, Mary will save more money to fully repay the loan. She believes that through careful selection and the application of the strict standard of excellence in keeping her dairy cow, she will have more income, which will improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase a quality dairy cow

loans.name: Joyce’S Group

texts.en:
Joyce and her 4 friends thank Kiva lenders for their previous loan that impacted their lives. Group members used the loan to buy good quality maize seeds and fertilizers, and were also trained on better maize farming techniques. As a result, Joyce's maize production doubled that she had produced 3 seasons ago.

Joyce used her income from maize sales to pay school fees for her three children, who are currently enrolled in private primary schools. She used part of the money to rent new land where she plans to plant more maize this season. However, Joyce and her friends were challenged by drought last season that affected their harvests.

Joyce and her friends request for a new loan to continue with maize production, they will use this loan to buy more farm inputs and get training in making manures and simple irrigation skills.

Joyce continues to collect money to buy a piece of land and she believes with this loan, her income will increase and she will be able to achieve this goal.

loans.use: To buy good quality maize seeds and fertilizers and get training in making manures for their gardens

loans.name: Florence's Group

texts.en:
Florence and her group members thank Kiva lenders for their previous loan. The members used their loans to buy piglets and chicken breeds. Florence used her loan to buy two exotic piglets and each of them have given birth to six and eight piglets. She is so excited about her progress and she wants to expand her piggery project. Florence's current problem is food security for her pigs. 

She therefore wants to start growing crops and she has a new land she wants to cultivate. Florence and her group members are requesting for a new loan to establish crop gardens and be in position to get food for eating as well as food for their animals.

PS. The other two members in Florence's group photo are Annet's child (carried by Annette in the middle) and Dinah's child (carried by Dinah first from the right). Annet and Dinah willingly accepted to take the loan photo with their children.

loans.use: To cultivate new gardens and buy good quality seeds, fertilizers and farm tools

loans.name: Meer Ali

texts.en:
Meer Ali, age 32, deals in the business of animal selling and purchasing. He buys baby goats, heifers, bull calves, etc. at low prices, raises them, and sells them in the market at higher prices near the occasion of Eid-ul-Azha (a religious event in Muslim countries).  He sells the bull calves to the butchers. He makes enough through his business to contribute to the family income, but he needs to improve his business to bear his household expenses. For this reason, Meer Ali has contacted BRAC Pakistan and applied for a loan to purchase more heifers and bull calves for reselling. He is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, he will definitely expand his business and income level.

Meer Ali thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy heifers and bull calves for reselling.

loans.name: Pethias

texts.en:
Pethias, 38, is a farmer in Kapiri Mposhi, Zambia where he lives with his wife and 4 children. He is asking for a loan so that he can obtain a water pump that will help him irrigate and expand his garden. 

Last season, Pethias grew tomatoes and soya beans by drawing water by hand from a nearby stream in order to irrigate them. This season, he has big plans to expand his production, and will need a water pump in order to keep up with the irrigation required during Zambia’s dry season.

Rent to Own has worked with Pethias and will deliver a water pump directly to his farm. Rent to Own also provides Pethias with training on how to properly use and maintain the water pump, and will check in to provide support until he has paid off the loan.

With the water pump, Pethias is planning on growing soya beans, onion and tomato throughout the dry season, supplying the busy markets in Zambia’s Copperbelt province.

loans.use: to obtain a water pump for irrigation

loans.name: William

texts.en: This is William, he is in his last year studying for a diploma in computer engineering at Nairobi Institute of Business Studies. He is interested in technology and wants to develop his society with the knowledge he will gain from school. He aims to study until a masters level. Currently he is having financial difficulties. A loan from Kiva will help William pay for his school fees and finish his education.

loans.use: to pay for his school fees

loans.name: Lenard

texts.en:
Lenard, 62, is a farmer in Kapiri Mposhi, Zambia where he lives with his wife and 6 children. He is asking for a loan so that he can obtain a water pump that will help him irrigate and expand his garden.

Lenard has been growing tomatoes, onions, watermelon, maize and fresh greens on his farm to supply local markets in Kapiri Mposhi. Using buckets, he has been drawing water from a nearby well to irrigate his crops. This is an extremely labour intensive task, especially now that the dry season has begun.

Rent to Own has worked with Lenard and will deliver a water pump directly to his farm. Rent to Own also provides Lenard with training on how to properly use and maintain the water pump, and will check in to provide support until he has paid off the loan.

Lenard hopes to one day be able to sell his produce to large-scale buyers and be able to open his own shops in nearby towns.

loans.use: to obtain a water pump for irrigation

loans.name: Ma. Marites

texts.en: Ma. Marites is a hardworking entrepreneur who runs a food-vending business in the Philippines. She is requesting a loan for PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients such as cheese, flour and sugar to make items to sell to her customers. She supplements the income she earns here by buying and selling meat. She has successfully repaid a previous loan and plans to use this new one to further build her business. Ma. Marites has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make food items to sell.

loans.name: Tha's Group

texts.en: Tha’s group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Tha makes a living cultivating rice and raising the cows with her family and she also does extra work as tailor and factory laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en: This is Julius. He is a 30 years old dairy farmer and a father of 3 children. Farming and dairy income has enabled Julius build his family house and feed his family without much strain. Another cow will help him increase milk production and save school fees for his children. A loan from Kiva will help him secure the future of his children.

loans.use: to buy an extra cow to boost milk production

loans.name: Lutfiya

texts.ru:
Большая часть женщин в Таджикистане занимаются торговлей. Таким образом они зарабатывают на жизнь. Женщины как мы все знаем очень ответственные, стрессоустойчивые, выносливые. 
Каждое утро Лутфия в 4:00 утра идет на работу. Она в основном продает чакку (простоквашу). Она заранее покупает свежий продукт из районов Таджикистана у сельских жителей. 
Лутфия жительница города Душанбе. Ей 43 года. Она разведена. Лутфия живет вместе с дочерью. Она берет кредит для улучшения жизненных условий. Лутфия берет кредит для приобретения чакки и аренды торгового места на рынке под ангар. 

Для получения информации о том? каким образом готовится чакка (простокваша) в Таджикистане см. по ссылке https://www.facebook.com/pages/CJSC-MDO-HUMO-/275560785910916
texts.en:
A large number of women in Tajikistan is involved in sales. This is how they earn a living. Women, as we all know, are very responsible, able to handle stress and strong. Lutfiya goes to work at 4 in the morning every day. She primarily sells chakka (prostokvasha or strained yogurt). She buys her fresh product in advance from the rural residents of the Tajikistan districts. Lutfiya is a resident of the city of Dushanbe. She is 43 years old, divorced and lives with her daughter. She is requesting this loan to improve her living conditions. Lutfiya is requesting the loan to buy chakka and lease a retail space at the market for a hangar. 

To obtain information on how to prepare chakka (prostokvasha) in Tajikistan, please this link - https://www.facebook.com/pages/CJSC-MDO-HUMO-/275560785910916

loans.use: to buy chakka and lease a retail space at the market for a hangar

loans.name: Suphorn's Group

texts.en: Suphorn’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Suphorn makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as factory laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water.  Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Rosalita

texts.en: Rosalita is married and works hard to support her family by buying and selling rice in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 13,000 loan from NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell. Rosalita has been in this business for three years, and would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Mom's Group

texts.en: Mom’s group live in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Mom makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water.  Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family and to save money on medical expenses

loans.name: Sreymet's Group

texts.en: Sreymet’s group live in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Sreymet makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family and save time boiling water

loans.name: Rommanit's Group

texts.en: Rommanit’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Rommanit makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as factory laborer and seller buy selling porridge at factory to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Sopheap's Group

texts.en: Sopheap’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Sopheap makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as factory laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Sreymao's Group

texts.en: Sreymao’s group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Sreymao makes a living cultivating rice and raising pigs and she also does work selling groceries and as a traditional doctor to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family and save money on medical expenses

loans.name: Sokunthea's Group

texts.en: Sokunthea’s group live in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Sokunthea makes a living cultivating rice and farming to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.name: Lang's Group

texts.en: Lang’s group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Lang makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work selling groceries to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Dovush

texts.ru: Довуш, так зовут эту жительницу района Вахш. Ей 51 год. Она деятельная и трудолюбивая женщина. У Довуш большая семья: муж, четверо дочерей, двое сыновей и двое невесток. В течение 12 лет их семья ведет торговый бизнес. У них имеется продуктовый магазин и прибыль с его продаж является главным источником дохода семьи. Довуш сейчас хотела бы увеличить ассортимент продуктов в своем магазине, так как товар уже заканчивается и половина полок магазина пустует. Однако Довуш не имеет достаточных средств для реализации цели. Поэтому она обратилась за кредитом. Довуш надеется получить финансовую поддержку. Она нуждается сейчас в этом кредите для продолжения их семейного торгового бизнеса.
texts.en: The name of this resident of the Vakhsh district is Dovush. She is 51 years old. She is an active and hardworking woman. Dovush has a large family: husband, four daughters, two sons and two daughters-in-law. Her family has been running a retail business for 12 years. They have a food market, and the sales profit provides the sole source of income for the family. Dovush now wants to expand the product selection at her store because the current selection is running out, making half of the store shelves empty. However, Dovush does not have enough money to achieve her goal. This is why she requested a loan. Dovush hopes to obtain financial support. She needs this loan now to continue her family retail business.

loans.use: to buy food products for her store in order to continue the family business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cologne amongst others.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy meat, rice and other things.

loans.name: An's Group

texts.en: An’s group lives in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. An makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as factory laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family to improve their health and save time

loans.name: Dominga

texts.en: Dominga is married, the mother of three children and lives and works in Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. Her husband is a farmer and she has helped him for many years by also working their farm, which is the family's main source of income. Dominga is a member of Gata Daku MPC and has successfully repaid her previous loans, which she used to buy farm supplies. She is requesting a new loan to buy organic fertilizer for her farm. Organic farming has been introduced in her community because it helps to restore farm nutrients. In the future, Dominga would like to continue to improve her farm.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer for her farm.

loans.name: Luch's Group

texts.en: Luch’s group lives in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Luch makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as village volunteer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family to improve the health of their families

loans.name: Sok's Group

texts.en: Sok’s group live in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Sok makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Sokuntea's Group

texts.en: Sokuntea’s group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Sokuntea makes a living cultivating rice with and she also does extra work as construction worker and factory laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water.  Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Bophea's Group

texts.en: Bophea’s group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Bophea makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as farm laborer and factory laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Khan's Group

texts.en: Khan’s group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Khan makes a living cultivating rice and raising the ducks with her family and she also does extra work as factory laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family to improve their health

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en: Shazia is aged 32 years old; she is the mother of two children. Shazia lives in Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. For the past days, his rickshaw has not been working properly, making him unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible. However due to a lack of money, her husband finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing his rickshaw. Therefore, Shazia has requested for a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of repairing his rickshaw. This will help her husband to continue his business. Shazia is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to cover the repair cost of her husband's rickshaw

loans.name: Laing's Group

texts.en:
Laing is aged 35 years old and married. She lives with her husband and six children in a rural area located in the Borseth district of Cambodia. She is a rice farmer. She has been in this business for 35 years now and she also works as a garment worker to earn additional income for her family. The current business earns her family about 18,700 KHR per day to feed the family, but she manages to save about 8,700 KHR each day.
This is the fifth loan for Laing with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Laing is now leading her group to ask for a loan. As the group leader, Laing wants to use her portion to buy a latrine. She hopes to have a clean latrine for her family's use.

loans.use: to buy a latrine for her family's use

loans.name: Masa

texts.en: Masa is a 24-years-old married woman from Nablus city. She lives with her husband and one small son. Her husband is an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. This income is barely cover all their family needs. Masa is a student in a local college where she studies nursing. She would like to finish her studies and find a job to help her husband with part of their expenses. Masa has applied for a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to pay the university fee installments for this semester. By taking this loan, Masa will be able to complete her studies and find a job faster.

loans.use: to pay the university fee installments for this semester.

loans.name: Mary Luz

texts.es:
La socia Mary, la socia continua con su negocio de artesanía como por ejemplo muñecas, guantes, gorros y entre otros, la socia  pertenece al banco comunal "Cusco”, la socia lleva años dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de chompas de alpaca.
La socia se siente contenta por el préstamo y se compromete a pagar las cuotas puntuales y con mucha responsabilidad y agradece a todos los inversionistas por el préstamo y desea que sigan apoyando a los demás proyectos.
texts.en:
Mary is continuing with her handicraft business making items such as dolls, gloves, knitted hats etc. She belongs to the Cusco communal bank and has had her business for many years. All is going well thanks to the effort she puts in every day. Mary wishes to be able to continue working so that she can support her family.

She is seeking a loan to buy alpaca sweaters. She is happy to have the opportunity for a loan and promises to make the repayments punctually and responsibly. She is grateful to all lenders for the loan and hopes they will continue to support other projects.

loans.use: buy alpaca sweaters

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is widowed with five children and all her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of any additional family members. She has a business of selling local gin and has been in this business for 5 years now. She has applied for a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more jerrycans of local gin, spirits and crates of beer. She generates additional income from selling maize flour. She works at the market six days out of every week and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality. She aspires to become a wholesaler as well as also to buy a plot of land and build her own house. She resides in a rented house and her family has no access to electricity nor piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent, school fees and feeding her family.

loans.use: to buy jerrycans of local gin, spirits and crates of beer

loans.name: Muhammadhadiskhon

texts.ru: Мухаммадхадисхон родился в 1996 году. Он целеустремленный молодой человек. Мухаммадхадисхон живет вместе со своей семьей в столице. У него большая и дружная семья. В этом году он успешно окончил среднюю школу и поступил в университет. Он теперь студент первого курса и срочно должен оплатить за учебный договор первого курса. Однако его родители не имеют денег, чтобы оплатить за его учебный договор. Поэтому Мухаммадхадисхон запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора в университете. Если он не оплатить за учебу, то его исключат с университета. Он ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Muhammadhadiskhon was born in 1996. He is a goal-oriented young person. Muhammadhadiskhon lives with his family in the capital. He has a large and happy family. He successfully graduated from a secondary school this year and was accepted to a university. He is now a first-year student and has to pay for his first-year tuition. However, his parents do not have money to pay for his tuition. This is why Muhammadhadiskhon is requesting a loan to pay for his university tuition. If he does not pay, he will be expelled from the university. He awaits your kindness and hopes for your mercy.

loans.use: to pay for his university tuition

loans.name: Bernadeth

texts.en: Bernadeth is 48 years old and married with six children, three of whom in school. Bernadeth works very hard to provide for her family. Bernadeth runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. Bernadeth has been in this business for 7 years now. In the future, Bernadeth would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as shampoo, groceries, etc

loans.name: Jose Serafin

texts.es:
Jose es un hombre joven de 21 años de edad, soltero, sin hijos y su negocio es la atención de un centro de fotocopias.
Él es emprendedor, soñador, luchador, constante, inteligente, responsable y muy trabajador. Su labor la realiza en la avenida Landaeta un lugar caracterizado por el servicio para autos; repuestos, chapa y pintura, llanterías, lavado, etc.
Jose es de tez morena, cabello negro corto, estatura mediana, su lengua materna es el español y conoce el aymara. Su trabajo es la atención de un centro de fotocopias, él se encarga de sacar fotocopias, realizar anillados, impresiones de todo tipo. Actualmente se encuentra realizando la carrera de diseño gráfico en un instituto privado, sus padres con quienes vive en la misma casa le ayudan con el pago de sus mensualidades; el necesita realizar el pago de sus mensualidades por adelantado y realizar la compra de una laptop para terminar su carrera.
Su sueño es poder trabajar como diseñador gráfico para incrementar sus ingresos económicos y ayudar a sus papás.
Es por esos motivos que Jose solicita un préstamo para el pago de sus mensualidades por adelantado y financiar la compra de una laptop para terminar su carrera profesional.
texts.en:
Jose. 21, is single, childless and works in a photocopying business. 
He is an entrepreneur, a dreamer, a fighter, loyal, intelligent, responsible and hardworking. He works on Landaeta Avenue, a place that is well-known for car servicing; repairs, paint and body work, washing etc.
Jose is of dark complexion, with short black hair, of medium height, and his first language is Spanish although he also knows Aymara. 
His job is to be in charge of the photocopy centre and is responsible for making copies, spiral-binding and printing of any kind.
Currently, he is working on a graphic design career in a private school. His parents, who live in the same house, help him to pay his monthly payments; he must pay his monthly installments in advance and purchase a laptop to finish his studies. 
His dream is to work as a graphic designer to increase his income and help his parents. 
It is for these reasons that Jose requesting a loan, to pay his monthly payments up front and purchase a laptop to finish his studies.

loans.use: to pay his monthly payments in advance and finance the purchase of a laptop to finish his studies.

loans.name: Elmer Jules

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal SEÑOR DE HUANCA-TERMINAL, él banco eta ubicado en el departamento de Cusco.
El socio continua dedicándose a brindar  el servicio de transporte interprovincial, el socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia, el socio lleva buen  tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le trae satisfacciones tanto personales.
El socio solicita el crédito para comprar llantas para el carro.
El socio se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank "Senor de Huanca-Terminal", the bank is located in the department of Cusco. The member continues to provide interprovincial transportation services. He wants to continue doing this job to be able to support his family. He has been working on this for a good amount of time and this brings him a lot of personal satisfaction

The member is requesting a loan to buy tires for his car. He is grateful for the loan and commits to meet the repayment terms.

loans.use: to buy tires for his car.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
The person in the photograph is Mary. She is a widow living with two of her children out of the six she has been blessed with. In 2012, Mary joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in order to benefit from training courses on financial management and enterprise creation.

Mary does dairy farming and poultry farming. She intends to expand her enterprise. So she is requesting a loan so that she can buy cow feed.  She hopes that their productivity will increase, as will her income level. She plans to use the increased profit to provide basic necessities such as food for her household.

She is grateful to Kiva for assisting her in improving her farming practices.

loans.use: To buy cow feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a laptop for personal use.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy various types of fabric for resale.

loans.name: Carmelina

texts.en:
Carmelina is 77 years old and widowed with seven children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 29,500 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more household goods to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, noodles and chips.

Carmelina has borrowed and re-paid 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns an income from loading up prepaid mobile phones.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more household goods to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, noodles and chips.

loans.name: Saif Ullah

texts.en:
Saif Ullah is a 29-year-old married man living in the area of Gujrat, Pakistan. 

He sells fertilizer in the nearby village, where most of the people are harvesters. For this reason, there is lot of demand for fertilizer. His shop is situated within a poor society and most of his customers have been taking sacks of fertilizer on a credit basis and do not pay back for many days. Now, his credit amount has gone to such a limit that even he cannot buy fresh stock to sell. 

Saif Ullah is a poor person and cannot sustain these kinds of irregularities in payments because this fertilizer shop is only one way of generating income for his family. Therefore, Saif Ullah has requested a loan so he will be able to buy sacks of fertilizer to sell.

Now, he will avoid selling goods on a credit basis, and he hopes that this loan can easily fulfill the deficiencies.

Saif Ullah is very thankful to Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan for this honorable support.

loans.use: to buy sacks of fertilizer for reselling.

loans.name: Chemchem Group

texts.en:
Hadija, who is in her late thirties, is married and has got five children: four sons and one daughter, all of whom are in school. 

For eight years now, she has been running a business selling cooked food: rice, ugali, banana with meat, beans, and vegetables (mamalishe). Fish selling is her second business. Hadija works from 6 am to 7 pm daily and is able to make a good profit each month. 

Chemchem is a new loan group comprising nine members who are requesting a loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. The loan will be apportioned among the members, who will be accountable for paying it back. Hadija is one of them and is requesting her first cycle. She will invest her loan to replenish the cooking ingredients for her business. She wants to buy more stock of meat, beans, rice, and cooking oil so as to meet business demand. 

Her desire is to provide a better education to her children and be successful.

loans.use: to replenish the ingredients for selling cooked food.

loans.name: Juma

texts.en:
Juma is 51 years old. She is widowed. Juma has 3 children. She has brought up her children alone and has experienced a lot of difficulties. 

Juma has been busy with buying and selling food items for more than 6 years. Juma is very glad that she started this business 6 years ago. Her business is the main source of family income; Juma organized the marriage party of her children from the profit of her business. 

Juma is going to use the loan to increase her working capital. She is asking for a loan of 5000 Somoni to buy food items and to increase her working capital. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy food items.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is 48 years old and married with one child.

Cecilia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell like soap, shampoo, coffee, soft drinks, etc.

Cecilia has borrowed and repaid 8 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 4 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Cecilia aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell like soap, shampoo, coffee, soft drinks, etc

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for school tuition and purchase educational equipment for her son.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 55 years old, married, and has one child. She lives in Tangub City. She sells home products and different kinds of personal accessories, which she has been doing for over eight years. 

Emma requested a loan from Gata Daku MPC, which she will use to purchase new items to expand product offerings. In the future, she wants to build a little shop in town for her business expansion.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offerings

loans.name: Hadijah

texts.en:
Hadjah is single and has six children who attend school. She operates a food stall, which she has been doing for 10 years. She works at the market seven days a week and sells on a retail basis only. Her major business challenges include seasonality, thieves, and defaulters.   

Hadjah requested a loan from MCDT-SACCO for 1,600,000 Uganda shillings, which she will use to buy more bags of Irish potatoes, tomatoes, ground nuts, cassava, sweet potatoes, and onions. She hopes to become a wholesaler and to buy a plot of land and start growing fruits and vegetables. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, rent, and food.

loans.use: to purchase Irish potatoes, ground nuts, cassava, sweet potatoes, and onions

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane works hard to support her family. Jane is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional bundles of fishing net.

Jane has been in this business for 8 years now.

In the future, Jane would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional bundles of fishing net.

loans.name: Mumbi

texts.en:
Mumbi is a married woman who lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food and water. 

For the past three years, she has operated an agricultural business, selling produce from home to her neighbours and passers-by. She faces a major challenge of disease outbreak, leading to losses. She dreams of expanding her business to generate more income. 

With the loan that she is requesting of 20,000 KES, she wants to purchase more seedlings and pesticides. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase more seedlings and pesticides

loans.name: Sabiti

texts.en:
Sabit has applied for a loan of 1,000,000 UGX.  Its his first time loan.  He is single, has no children, and has 4 dependents (his parents and two sisters).

He grows pineapples and coffee and works 12 hours a day.  He is also a bodaboda (motorcycle) rider and supplements his monthly savings. He rides the motorcycle around Bushenyi town and beyond to sell pineapples. He started these two businesses  to earn money for his personal development. 

He wants to use the loan  to buy a new motorbike. His dream is to buy a car.  He is faced with the challenges of poor roads (especially during the rainy season), long distances, and traffic. These conditions interfere with his business but has learned to manage them. 

He is hardworking and a new client at UGAFODE Microfinance ltd (MDI). He hopes to continue getting the services.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is a 44 year old married woman. She is a mother of two children. She adores her family and her husband works very hard so that their family can have a good and respectable life.  

Her husband has been running a small garment shop in the market. This shop is the only source of income for his family. The winter season has started in Pakistan, so he wants to purchase a variety of warm clothing, such as sweaters, coats, gloves, mufflers, and school jerseys. To do this, his wife, Nasreen, has requested a loan in the amount of PKR 50,000. The loan will help him to offer a variety of products to his clients and increase his net income as well. 

Nasreen dreams of increasing her husband's business so that her children can have a better future. Nasreen's family sends loads of prayers and thanks to all of the staff of Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of warm clothing for her husband's garment shop.

loans.name: Jonah

texts.en:
Jonah is a 40-year-old married woman with four children, three attend school.  Jonah works very hard to provide for them.

She has run a general store for 10 years and requests 25,000 PHP through NWTF to buy shampoo and groceries.

In the future Jonah would like to save enough money  to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy shampoo and groceries.

loans.name: Lyra

texts.en:
Lyra is grateful that she was granted a 25,000 PHP loan which she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Through her earnings, she is able to support her family and meet their daily basic needs. 
 
She would like to apply for another loan (26,000 PHP) which she will use to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store will mean more sales and  increased earnings. Her income from her General Store helps her to send her children to school and meet their daily personal and household needs.  She thanks God and the lenders in advance for the financial assistance provided.

Lyra wants to grow her small store into a mini grocery. She wants to give her children the best education possible and provide a bright future. She faithfully meets weekly with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work  and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items, rice, canned goods, condiments and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 34 years old and married with five children.

She has grown rice for 8 years.   She earns additional income by growing vegetables.  Nenita is borrowing 13,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional fertilizer and other farming supplies.

She works tirelessly to attain her dream which is to  save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizer and other farming supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay this semester's university bill.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma works hard to support her family. Thelma is married and has operated a general store business for 15 years.

Thelma requests 20,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase shampoo and groceries.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and requests an additional loan to further build her business.

In the future, Thelma would like to save enough money  to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase shampoo and groceries.

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline is 39 and has 4 children who are 3, 8, 11 and 14 years old. She said she is not having any more children because she is too busy with her dairy farming. 

She is a very hard-working mother, living in the rich highlands of Kisii.  She has  farmed for ten years and does not regret it  because she makes a good profit and has improved her farm. Pauline does both crop and dairy farming and is able to earn a decent and honest income. She is an early riser who  goes to her farm to earn a living. 

Pauline has space on her farm to utilize in dairy farming. She respectfully requests a loan to buy a dairy cow. Kisii is an area that has a high population and there is a high demand for milk.   Pauline, being an enterprising person, wants to take full advantage of that need and earn extra income. She hopes that  this loan will allow her to change her standard of living and expand her milk-selling business. 

Pauline plans  to open a very large milk-selling business in the nearby shopping center and to package milk. She wants to be economically empowered.  She knows that accessing funds is challenging, but with partners such as Juhudi Kilimo and Kiva, she feels relieved to know that all her dreams will be achieved and she will be able to provide a secure future for her child and improve her family's living conditions. 

Pauline patiently awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Herlin Marilin

texts.es:
Herlin de 36 años de edad,estudio hasta 3° grado, es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijas, ambos estudian, la menor 8° grado de educación básica y la mayor 3° año de bachillerato. Con ella ademas viven sus nietos.

Herlin tiene 14 años de ser comerciante minorista, se dedica a la venta de ropa de manera ambulante, cuando sale a vender visita las comunidades cercanas o bien lo hace casa por casa. Cuando no sale a vender ropa, se queda en su casa y elabora tamales para venderlos y no dejar pasar un día sin obtener ingresos económicos para su familia

El préstamo será utilizado en la compra de ropa, camisas, faldas, pantalones y ropa interior para damas, caballeros y ninos, para diversificar la oferta de mercadería, ahora que su hija le ayuda con la venta, cubren mayor área y tienen mejores resultados.

Herlin espera progresar en un futuro, que sus hijas terminen una carrera universitaria, crecer su negocio y tener un puesto estable para no tener que ir  casa por casa.
texts.en:
Herlin is 36 years old, she studied up to the 3rd grade, she is a single mother and she has 2 daughters who go to school, the younger attends the 8th grade and the older attends the 3rd year of high school. Her nephews also live with her.

Herlin has been a retailer for 14 years, working as a street vendor selling clothes (shirts, skirts, pants, underwear for women, men, and children). She sells her products either visiting the nearby communities or selling door to door. When she is not out selling clothes, she remains home to prepare tamales to sell, and she does not let one day go by without having earned something for her family.

The loan she is requesting will be used to by clothes and to vary the type of products he sells. Now that her daughter helps her with her sales, they can work in a wider area thus obtaining better results.

Herlin dreams are to progress in the future, to see her daughter complete university, to make her activity grow and to own a stall in order to stop selling door to door.

loans.use: To buy clothes (shirts, skirts, pants, underwear for women, men, and children) for her activity.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet is a single mother of four children, two attend school. She doesn’t look after additional family members.  

She has a business to sell camera batteries, envelopes, tape, and chargers. She has applied for a loan of 1,500,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy more cameras, batteries, tape, masking tape, and photo envelopes. 

She doesn’t have another income and works in a shop selling on a retail and wholesale basis. Her major business challenges include seasonal changes and theft. She wishes to  build her own business premise and  become a wholesaler.    

She decided to join MCDT-SACCO because of good customer care practices.  She resides in the family house and the family has access to electricity but not running water.  Her monthly expenses include  school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy cameras, batteries, envelopes,and reams of paper

loans.name: Nelfa

texts.en:
Nelfa is a 45-year-old married woman with  two children.  She manages their farm and  transportation services to make a living. Her husband is working and she runs the farm and transportation service in order to increase earnings. She hires someone to operate the motorcycle and provide transportation services in their community. 

She became a member of Gata Daku MPC and requests a new loan to purchase fertilizer and repair a motor.She wants to have a productive farm and expand her service-based business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and repair a  motor.

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en:
Eliza is 48 years old and chose to be single. 

She engages in cooking and selling snack foods and vegetables within the school campus to generate income. She wants to cook and sell more snack recipes but she has limited capital. For this reason, she would like to acquire a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy sugar, cooking oil, milk, rice, coconut, flour and other ingredients she needs to cook and sell snack foods.

Being patient and industrious, she believes that she will further improve her business someday.

loans.use: to buy sugar, cooking oil, milk, rice, coconut, flour and other ingredients.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 55 years old and married with two children (both in school).  Edna works very hard to provide for them.

She has run a general store for 31 years and requests 20,000 PHP through NWTF to buy shampoo and groceries.

In the future Edna would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy shampoo and groceries.

loans.name: Elenita

texts.en:
Elenita is 46 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She has run a general store for 1 year and requests 15,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase soap, milk, sugar, and eggs.

She would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase  soap, milk, sugar, and eggs.

loans.name: Yodesi

texts.en: Yodesi is a 36-year-old married woman with six children who lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She trades in cocoa and palm oil. She has seen her family's standard of living improve with the help of her husband's salary. She dreams of building a residential building and educating her children, although limited capital affects her business. She wants a loan to buy cocoa and to rent a cocoa garden.

loans.use: To buy cocoa and to rent a cocoa garden.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is a 45-year-old woman with seven children. They live in Lahore, Pakistan. She has run a general store to sell rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap, and biscuits. She manages her household from her store. Some of her relatives like to purchase from her general store. 

She speaks with a warm, impressive tone and she wins the trust of others. Due to her behavior and personality, she has built very good relationships with her customers. 

Her general store is very famous in town and her business runs well. Due to good customer service, her sales have increased a lot but she does not have sufficient inventory to meet the demand. Therefore, Parveen requests a loan to buy wheat, rice, flour, soap, shampoo, detergents, and biscuits. 

Parveen thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.  She  hopes to use the loan in a positive way and meet the demands of her family.

loans.use: to buy wheat, rice, flour, soap, shampoo, detergent, and  biscuits.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.es:
Juliana una joven emprendedora y soñadora que a sus 19 años de edad piensa en su futuro y busca la manera de obtener recursos para estudiar, para ayudarle a su madre por eso quiere iniciar un negocio de venta de mercancía como lo es ropa, perfumes, cosméticos entre otros.
Solicita un monto considerable ya que iniciara apenas su empresa, y para ella el crédito es muy muy muy importante ya que carece de recursos y valorara la oportunidad de crecer que interactuar le está brindando. 
Sueña con abrir formalmente un almacén de ropa muy hermoso y con variedad de productos donde el valor predominante sea el afecto y buen trato al cliente.
texts.en:
Juliana is an enterprising young woman. She is a dreamer, and she is already thinking about her future. She is 19 years old. 

She is looking for the resources to be able to study, to help her mother, and that's why she wants to start a business selling clothes, perfumes, and beauty products among others.

She is requesting a considerable amount to start her company. The loan is very important to her because she lacks the resources and she really values the opportunity to grow that INTERACTUAR is offering her.

Her dream is to open a beautiful clothing store, and to have a big variety of products. The main value will be serving her customers with affection and attention.

loans.use: to start her own business selling clothes, beauty products, and catalog products to help her family with an income because they are very poor.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: pay for a freezer, tables, advertising, supplies and raw materials to prepare her recipes, so she can support her children.

loans.name: Chankesor

texts.en: Chankesor is 20 years old and a student at a university. She is also an accountant in a computer shop. She has been an accountant since 2013. She is single and lives with her parents in Kandal Province, Cambodia. Being an accountant, she can earn approximately 4.66 USD a day. Because of a lack of financial support, Chankesor would like to request a loan to pay for her third-year tuition fee. This loan will help her be able to go on to her third year at the university. In the future, she is going to find a job with a better salary and renovate her present house.

loans.use: to pay for her third-year tuition fee

loans.name: Sahiba

texts.en:
Sahiba is a 34-year–old divorced woman with 2 children. She is IDP and lives with her children in the  Bilasuvar   region. 

She has farmed and raised animals since 2008 and started her business with 3 cows. Thanks to Sahiba's hard work, her business now has 4 dairy cows, 18 sheep, and 8 calves. She also grows fruit on her land. Her monthly income is 150 AZN. 

Sahiba  requests 1,500 AZN  from the "Aqroinvest CU " to buy dairy cows and resell them in the market at a higher price. She plans to reinvest the earnings in her business to further increase her livestock numbers.

loans.use: to buy dairy cows.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina lives in Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has four children, all attend school. 

She has sold charcoal at the market on retail basis for 2 years and works six days a week. She requests 900,000 UGX from MCDT- SACCO to buy bags of charcoal. Her major business challenges include transportation and the changing seasons. 

Her goal is to build a house.  She currently lives in rented house and the family has access to electricity but not running water.  Her major monthly expenses includes  utilities and food.

loans.use: to buy bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Ayub

texts.ru: Аюб молодой и энергичный человек. Он учится на первом курсе Национального университета Таджикистана. Аюб учить специальность банковское дело. Он сдал вступительные экзамены успешно, и теперь каждый день ходит на занятия в университет. Аюб читает много книг и регулярно готовится к урокам. Он не женат и живет с родителями. Аюб обратился в Имон первый раз за займом, чтобы оплатить за свой учебный договор. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 1900 долларов США для оплаты учебного договора. Он ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Ayub is a young and energetic person. He is a first-year student at the Tajikistan National University. Ayub is majoring in banking. He successfully passed the entrance examinations and now studies at the university every day. Ayub reads many books and regularly prepares for his lessons. He is not married and lives with his parents. Ayub came to Imon for a loan to pay for his university tuition. He is requesting a loan in the amount of 1900 US dollars to pay for his tuition. He awaits your kindness and hopes for your mercy.

loans.use: to pay for his university tuition

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.ru:
Махбуба в 53 года продолжает свою швейную деятельность. Она умелая мастерица. Махбуба предоставляет услуги швеи уже 4 года в своем городе Душанбе. Дочь и ученицы помогают ей с заказами. Махбуба в основном шьет женские платья национальных фасонов. Заказов у нее всегда достаточно, так как она выполняет свою работу от души.
Целью кредита Махбубы является ремонт дома. Она хочет провести ремонт в той части дома, где принимает своих клиенток. Махбуба хочет освежить комнату и создать комфортные условия для себя и посетителей. Она надеется, что ей окажут финансовую помощь и она вскоре осуществит задуманное.
texts.en: At her age of 53, Mahbuba continues her sewing business. She is a skilled professional. Mahbuba has been providing seamstress services in her city of Dushanbe for 4 years already. Her daughters and apprentices help her with orders. Mahbuba primarily sews national styles of women's dresses. She always has plenty of orders because she puts her soul into her work. The goal of Mahbuba's loan request is to repair her house. She wants to repair the part of the house, where she meets customers. Mahbuba wants to refresh the room and create comfortable accommodations for herself and her customers. She hopes that she will be provided with financial help in order to achieve her plan soon.

loans.use: to make repairs at home in order to improve living conditions

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is thankful that she was granted a 15,000 PHP loan to buy more meat and  vegetables for her food stall. Through her earnings, she is able to send her children to school and meet their household needs.

She would like  to apply for 15,000 PHP to buy more meat, frozen foods, and peanut butter to sell.  The more food products she has will result in  more sales and therefore increase her income.  Her earnings will help to support the education of her children and meet their daily needs. She  thanks God and the lenders in advance for the financial help that will be provided.

Lilia aims to grow her business and to have a bigger space for her stall.  She dreams of giving her children the best education and that the Lord will always guide and protect them.  She meets weekly with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fish, frozen foods, meat,  peanut butter, and vegetables for her business.

loans.name: Daler

texts.ru: Далер умный и трудолюбивый человек. Он студент первого курса. Далер учится успешно. Наравне с учебой, он активно участвует в общественной жизни университета. Далер после занятий занимается спортом. Он играет футбол в футбольной команде университета. Далер уже успешно показывает себя в университете. После окончания университета он мечтает работать в престижной организации и получать хорошую зарплату. Он обещал своим родителям, что он успешно окончит университет, и они будут гордиться ним. Далер запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора. Он ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Daler is a smart and hardworking person. He is a first-year student. Daler studies well. Along with his studies, he actively participates in the community life of the university. Daler is also involved in sports after his studies. He plays futball with the university futball team. Daler is already successfully demonstrating himself at the university. After graduating from the university, he dreams of working at a prestigious organization and earning a good salary. He promised his parents that he will successfully graduate from the university and make them proud. Daler is requesting this loan to pay for his tuition. He awaits your kindness and hopes for your mercy.

loans.use: to pay for his university tuition

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is a married woman with  four children. She works hard to support her family.

She has a business to sell rice and earns additional income growing rice.  Elisa is borrowing 18,000 PHP through NWTF to  buy additional rice to sell.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she requests an additional loan to further build her business.

Elisa has sustained her business activities through 6 previous loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream which is to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy  rice to sell.

loans.name: Ameeneh

texts.en:
Ameena is a 52-year-old widow living with her three sons. She became the only provider for her family after her husbands’ death. 

Ameena has been sewing clothes at home for four years. More recently, she has bought new clothes to sell and her business has been profitable. 

She wants to expand her business by bringing in a new collection of clothes but doesn't have enough money to do so. For that, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to buy a new collection of clothes to sell and a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 65 years old and married with seven children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She has runs a general store for 10 years and requests 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy shampoo and groceries to sell.

Erlinda has borrowed and successfully repaid 27 loans from NWTF. She earns additional income raising livestock.

She aspires to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy shampoo and groceries.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Jimmy

texts.es: Jimmy tiene dos profesiones, es chofer de taxi y ofrece sus servicios como disc jokey en fiestas donde tambien provee la amplificacion, es por eso que quiere un credito para comprar equipos de sonido y arreglar sus parlantes actuales JImmy es soltero, no tiene hijos pero tiene que ayudar a sus padres, ademas no tiene a quien acudir por eso quiere un credito en kiva
texts.en: Jimmy has two professions, he is a taxi driver and works as a disc jockey for parties, for which he also provides the sound system. For this reason he wants a loan to buy sound equipment and fix his current speakers. Jimmy is single, he has no children but he does have to help out his parents. He also does not have anyone else he can reach out to, and therefore would like a Kiva loan.

loans.use: to buy sound equipment and fix his existing speakers.

loans.name: Jelyn

texts.en:
Jelyn is 39 years old and married with seven children, five attend school.  Jelyn works very hard to provide for them.

She has run a general store for 2 years and requests 12,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase soap and canned goods.

In the future Jelyn would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase soap and caned goods.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Jocelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and earns additional income from poultry. Jocelyn is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to  buy additional stock to sell like coffee, milk, sugar, canned goods, etc for her general store business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Jocelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell like coffee, milk, sugar, and canned goods

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou works hard to support her family. Marilou is married and has a business selling used clothing in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional used clothing to sell.

Marilou has been in this business for 28 years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional used clothing to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more items to increase her supplies.

loans.name: Makandi

texts.en:
Makandi  is a married woman with five children. They own a house that without electricity and running water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Makandi  wants to start a vegetable and fruit selling business. Her major goal is increase profits by becoming a leading fruit vendor in the area.

She will use the loan to purchase green vegetables, and large quantities of fruit (oranges, mangoes, water melons, and pawpaw). 

She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, and large quantities of fruit (oranges, mangoes, water melons, and pawpaw).

loans.name: Entisar

texts.en:
Entisar is a 44-year-old married woman from a village near Hebron city. She lives with her husband and 10 kids in very poor conditions. Her husband works as a construction worker, where he gets a low and unstable income. Entisar started working five years ago to support her husband. She has a poultry farm next to her house. It is a good business, and earns a good income. 

Entisar took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy more chicks for her farm. By taking this loan, Entisar will be able to improve her business and increase its productivity. 

Entisar appears in the photo in her poultry farm.

loans.use: to buy more chicks for her farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for tuition fees for her second son

loans.name: Immaculate

texts.en:
Immaculate used the previous loan to buy clothes and pay school fees for her children. She has continued with the same business of selling clothes alongside earning money from rentals. Her main challenge is competition. However, she has a vision of educating her children to higher levels of learning.

Immaculate needs a loan to diversify her business of selling clothes by stocking bedsheets, blankets, towels and mattresses to sell.

loans.use: to stock bedsheets, blankets, towels and mattresses to sell.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is 32 years old and has two children. She is married and both of her children are in school.

She is in the agricultural business pig fattening in the Philippines. Margarita requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Margarita has been pig fattening for four years now and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Margarita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Aysha

texts.en:
Aysha is a 31-year-old married woman living with her family, which consists of six family members. Her husband works in construction, and his income wasn’t enough to cover his children's needs. For that reason, Aysha started running her own mini-market where she sells foodstuffs and general products. 

Aysha is now seeking to add new products to her mini-market inventory, but she doesn’t have enough money to do so. For that reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To add merchandise to her mini-market

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana esta casada, tiene un hijo, vive en La Paz en una casa de ladrillo y cemento Ana paga un anticrético. Ana trabaja vendiendo ropa usada  Ana necesita dinero para un credito de salud, su esposo esta muy delicado de salud e incluso estuvo en coma, Ana usará el crédito para pagar gastos de estudios superiores, su esposo no puede apoyarla con este proyecto por eso ella necesita su ayuda
texts.en: Ana is married and has one son. She lives in La Paz in a brick and cement house which she is leasing. Ana sells used clothes for a living, and is in need of a loan for health purposes, since her husband is in very delicate health and has even been in a coma. Ana will use the loan to cover higher education costs. Ana needs your support for this project, as her husband is unable to support her.

loans.use: to pay for higher education costs.

loans.name: Erika Merari

texts.es: Erika de 21 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su grupo familiar. Ella es una joven emprendedora que se gana la vida elaborando tortillas frente a su vivienda, dicha actividad la realiza desde hace 8 años por lo que gracias a su experiencia y un crédito adquirido con FUSAI ha logrado mejorar sus ganancias. Erika desea seguir ampliando su clientela, ya que con el crédito anterior logro mejorarla por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para seguir mejorando y ampliando su clientela invirtiendo en:  maíz, gas propano y cal. Para seguir ampliando su negocio de venta de tortillas. Erika menciona que se siente muy agradecida por el apoyo recibido por FUSAI y es por ello que desea seguir mejorando su negocio contando con el apoyo de esta institución.
texts.en: Erika is 21 years old and she lives in a house of her own with her family. She is a resourceful young woman who has been earning her living by preparing and selling tortillas outside her house for 8 years. Thanks to her experience and to a loan she obtained from FUSAI she has succeeded in improving her income. Erika wants to keep on increasing the number of her customers, as she already did thanks to her previous loan. For this reason, she is requesting a loan to FUSAI to keep on increasing the number of her customers by investing in the purchase of corn, propane gas and lime in order to keep on improving her tortilla selling activity. Erika says that she is deeply grateful to FUSAI for their support and that it is for this reason that she wants to keep on improving her activity by counting on the support of this institution.

loans.use: To buy corn, propane gas and lime for her tortilla making business.

loans.name: Rosa Maria
