texts.es: Rosa de 68 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hija, ella se dedica a la venta de calzado su negocio lo tiene ubicado en el mercado municipal, posee mucha clientela por la variedad de productos y los buenos precios, Rosa esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas calzado por mayor y así continuar con sus ventas que le generan buenas ganancias.
texts.en: Rosa, 68 years old, lives in her own house with her husband and her daughter. She works selling shoes. Her business is located in the municipal market. She has many customers due to the variety of her products and their good prices. Rosa is asking for a loan to purchase more shoes in bulk and in this way continue with her sales that provide good profits.

loans.use: to purchase more shoes in bulk to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia is a married woman with 3 children. She describes herself as ambitious. She operates a retail business where she sells furniture, and she has been involved in this business for 3 years.

Julia's business is located in a developing area and her primary customers are regulars. She states that her biggest business challenge is inadequate finances. She will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more stock of furniture.

Julia's business goal is to be a supplier within 5 years. She hopes that in the future she will have a stable business that can sustain her family. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of furniture

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has three children who all go to school. She has no additional family members. She sells fruits and vegetables at the market on a retail basis and has been in this business for 5 years. She has applied for a loan of 400,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy cabbages, carrots, onions, tomatoes, and pineapples. She also generates additional income from selling soft drinks. She sells these goods seven days a week. 

Her major business challenges include seasonality. She is aspiring to buy a plot of land to start farming so as to supplement her income. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: To buy cabbages, carrots, onions, tomatoes, and pineapples.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bales of assorted plastic shoes.

loans.name: Ageteraine Kitutu Group

texts.en:
Charles is a hardworking Ugandan married man, aged 48 years, with six children aged 16 to 4 years, all attending school. He lives in Kagadi where he has been selling bananas and farming since 1992 to earn a living. He hopes to grow his business despite banana shortages due to weather changes. 

Charles is requesting a loan to buy bananas to increase market supply. He is a member of Ageteraine Kitutu where each member guarantees the other to get a loan since they don’t pledge securities.
The extra person in photo is also a group member who has savings in the group,has guaranteed others but has not taken a loan.

loans.use: to buy bananas to increase market supply

loans.name: Jeniffer

texts.en:
Jeniffer is a 41-year-old widow with one child living in Kasese, Uganda. She operates a shoe business which she has been running for eleven years. She began the business to have a source of income to cater for her family's needs. Jeniffer is hard working however she is faced with the problem of competition and price fluctuation. Educating her child, looking after herself and business expansion are her dreams.

Jeniffer intends to use the loan to buy more shoes to sell.

loans.use: to buy more shoes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more clothing material

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy material to sew clothing

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Norah is a 24-year-old businesswoman residing in the Mwenezi District in Zimbabwe. 

Norah is volunteering as a Learner Guide for Camfed at her local school in her community. She assists students with homework and facilitates the formation of study groups. 

To support herself she started a poultry project where she produces about 100 broiler chicks and sells them to her local community. 

With the Kiva loan, Norah intends to purchase more broiler chicks and feed. She will use the profits to further her education.

loans.use: to purchase more broiler chicks and feed.

loans.name: P.a.c.p& L.a.c Foundation Group

texts.en:
Mikel is a married man with five children aged 17, 15, 12, 9, and 7. He lives in Kamwenge, Uganda. He owns a restaurant and bar, alongside farming. He started these businesses mainly to boost his family's income. His main challenges are inflation and price fluctuations. He hopes to have a financially stable home and business.

He is requesting a loan to buy more rice, matooke, and crates of sodas for his business.

loans.use: to buy more rice, matooke, and crates of sodas for his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothing and footwear

loans.name: Soviet

texts.en:
Soviet is 21 years old, a gas station attendant, and a student at a university. He lives with his parents in Siem Reap Province.

Soviet has been a gas station attendant since 2013. He can earn approximately $4 per day. Previously, he worked as a receptionist in a hotel, and then he stopped because he wanted to take time off to go to university.

Because of a lack of financial support, Soviet would like to request a loan to pay for his tuition fee. This loan will help him graduate. In the future, he wants to find a good job and have his own house.

loans.use: to pay for his tuition fee

loans.name: Impuhwe Cb Group

texts.en: Chantal is 40 years old. She is married with four children between 10 and 16 years old, and they go to school. Her group is called Impuhwe, which means honest in English. The members of the group sell different products, and they have common goals to scale their business for a better future. She sells fish and has been running a business for the past 20 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more fish for sale. The profits from the business will be used to renovate her house

loans.use: To buy more fish for sale.

loans.name: Irene

texts.es: Irene es casada, tiene dos hijos y vive en El Alto en una casa de adobe que le pertenece a sus familiares Irene se dedica a elaborar mangas de camisa y necesita un credito para compra de tela y una maquina de costura con el fin de mejorar sus ingresos Irene es la unica fuente de ingresos en su hogar por lo que no tiene a nadie que le ayude pero goza de buena salud y es una buena clienta
texts.en: Irene is married, has two children, and lives in El Alto in an adobe house that belongs to her family. Irene makes a living making shirtsleeves, and needs a loan to buy fabric and a sewing machine in order to increase her revenue. Irene is the only source of income in her household, so she does not have anyone to support her. However, she is in good health and is a good businesswoman.

loans.use: to buy fabric and a sewing machine.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen es soltera y tiene dos hijos, ella vive en El Alto en una casa de adobe que es propia, la vivienda tiene luz, agua, alcantarillado Carmen se gana la vida como vendedora de peliculas en DVDy esta expuesta a los peligros de trabajar en la calle, lo que Carmen desea es poder comprar mayor cantidad de peliculas en DVD para mejorar su ingresos y en el futuro abrir una tienda propia Carmen es la unica fuente de ingresos en su hogar y goza de buena salud
texts.en: Carmen is single and has two children. She lives in El Alto in an adobe house that she owns, that is equipped with electricity, water, and a sewer. Carmen makes a living selling DVD movies, and in doing so, she is exposed to the dangers of working in the street. Carmen wants to buy more DVD movies to improve her income and eventually open her own shop. Carmen is the only source of income in her household, and she is in good health.

loans.use: to buy a bigger selection of DVD movies to sell.

loans.name: Sevda

texts.en:
Sevda is 46 years old and married. She has a son and two daughters. Her husband is a laborer and the family lives in an IDP settlement because they are refugees. Sevda earns money for her family by growing greens such as fennel, parsley, mint, green onion, and others. She sells fresh greens in a small grocery in front of her house. Her monthly income is 240 AZN.

Local people visit Sevda’s grocery because she always sells fresh greens. Local cafes and restaurants always buy greens from her and have worked with her for a long time. Sevda has worked in this area for 22 years.

Sevda likes gardening but it’s not profitable and she can’t cover her family’s needs. She applied for a 1500 AZN loan in order to buy vegetable seeds for her garden. She plans to grow and sell an expanded assortment of seasonal vegetables in order to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds for her garden.

loans.name: Ayoko

texts.fr: Ayoko a 52 ans, Veuve et mère de 5 enfants résident à Tokoin. Elle fait la  restauration du riz et de l'igname. Elle s'approvisionne 2 Fois par mois au  marché gbossimé et revend  dans son  quaritier environnant de son domicile. Ayoko sollicite ce crédit pour agrandir son commerce afin de faire plus de profit
texts.en: Ayoko is a 52 year old widowed mother of 5, who lives in Tokoin. She prepares and sells rice and yam for a living. She sources her goods twice a week in the Gbossimé market, and sells her goods from the area around her home. She is seeking this loan in order to boost her business and drive more profit.

loans.use: to purchase two bags of rice and one can of oil

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more products for her store

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es:
Oscar de 61 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, está casado y tiene 2 hijos, uno de ellos es empleado en una empresa y el otro estudia 2° año en la universidad. Su esposa administra una pequeña tienda de artículos de primera necesidad en su casa.

Oscar es agricultor, aprendió desde muy pequeño con su padre y hoy tiene 50,0000 mts cuadrados cultivados con Jícama, lo apoyan sus dos hijos cuando pueden, además de ser agricultor, trabaja en como ordenanza en una alcaldía. 

El préstamo será utilizado para comprar fertilizantes y dar mantenimiento al cultivo de Jícama que será cosechado en noviembre.

Oscar espera que con el fruto de su trabajo logre dar el estudio completo a su hijo y tenga las oportunidades que él no tuvo.
texts.en:
Oscar, 61, studied up to high school.  He's married and has two children; one of them is an employee in a company and the other one is in his second year of college.  His wife sells staple products in a small store she runs in their home.

Oscar's a farmer.  He learned the work from his father at a very young age, and now he grows jicama on 50,000 square meters.  His two sons help him when they can.  He's also employed in a local town hall as an orderly.

The loan will be used to buy fertilizer and keep up the jicama crop, which will be harvested in November.

Oscar hopes that with the fruit of his labor his son will be able to finish his education and have the opportunities Oscar didn't have.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his jimaca crop.

loans.name: Rano

texts.ru: Рано родилась в 1960 году. Она замужем. И на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Ее муж водитель. Ее дети совершеннолетние. Рано более 30 лет занимается шитьем женской одежды. Она имеет свой швейный цех. Рано имеет большой опыт в этой сере. Благодаря большому опыту и хорошему сервису она имеет своих постоянных клиентов. Ее дочь помогает ей шитью женской одежды. Рано всегда старается для благополучия семьи. Она планирует отремонтировать свой дом, так как ее дом в плохом состоянии. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони для покупки строительных материалов для ремонта дома. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en:
Rano was born in 1960. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a driver. The children are grown-ups. 

Rano has worked with sewing women's clothing for more than 30 years. She has her own sewing workshop. Rano has long experience in this area. Thanks to her large experience and good service, she has returning customers. Her daughter helps her with sewing. 

Rano always strives for the welfare of her family. She plans to renovate her house, as it is in a bad condition. She requests a loan in the amount of 5,000 somoni to purchase building materials for renovating her house. She awaits your kindness and hopes for your charity.

loans.use: To purchase building materials for renovating her house

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.es:
Reynaldo es un hombre de 39 años de edad, casado, padre de dos hijos de las edades de 15 y 11 años, y su negocio es la venta de leche natural.
Él es emprendedor, dedicado, constante, optimista, feliz, de buena actitud, responsable y muy trabajador. Su negocio lo realiza en la comunidad de Calasaya sitio donde la mayoría de las personas se dedican a la agricultura ganadería y pesca.
Reynaldo es de tez morena, estatura mediana, cabello negro corto, su lengua materna es el aymara y utiliza el español para el comercio. Este es el segundo préstamo que solicita a la empresa para continuar con su labor. Sus hijos se encuentran en la escuela de la zona y también colaboran con la producción de leche y cuidado del ganado. Su sueño es mejorar su calidad de vida generando mayores ingresos. Él desea realizar la compra de ganado lechero para mejorar su producción y sus ingresos.
Es por esos motivos que Reynaldo solicita un préstamo para la compra de ganado lechero y con los beneficios mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Reynaldo is 39, married and the father of two children aged 15 and 11. His business consists of selling natural milk. He is enterprising, dedicated, reliable, optimistic, happy, responsible, very hard-working, and he has a positive attitude. His business is carried out in the community of Calasaya, where the majority of people work in livestock and fishing.

Reynaldo is dark-skinned, of medium height and has short black hair. His native language is Aymara, and he uses Spanish for business. This is the second loan that he is asking from the organisation in order to carry on his work. His children go to the local school and also help out with the milk production and with looking after the cows. His dream is to improve their quality of life by earning more profit. He wants to buy dairy cows to improve production and his income. This is why Reynaldo is asking for a loan: to buy dairy cows and improve his family's qualify of life with the profits.

loans.use: to buy dairy cattle and improve his family's qualify of life with the profits.

loans.name: Afandina

texts.fr:
Afandina est une femme âgée de 46ans, elle est mariée à un  chauffeur. Elle a deux enfants de 18 et 16ans qui sont toujours sur les bancs d'école.
Afandina travaille comme revendeuse de poissons fumés quelques temps. Elle achète et revend ses poissons à ses clients dans la ville de Lomé. Elle est à son troisième prêt et espère avec le profit tiré de la vente agrandir l'activité et améliorer les conditions de vie.
texts.en: Afandina is a 46 year old lady who is married to a driver. She has two children, aged 16 and 18, who still attend school. She sells smoked fish for a living to a customer base in Lomé. She is on her third loan and hopes to generate enough profit to grow the business and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fish.

loans.name: Améyo

texts.fr: Améyo âgée de 34ans est mariée à un chauffeur et maman de 02 enfants de 14 et 05ans scolarisés. Pour aider son conjoint dans les charges familiales, elle a décidé de vendre des produits d'alimentation générale. Activité qu'elle exerce depuis 2010, elle se fait aidée par 01 personne. Pour acheter plus de marchandises Améyo fait sa troisième demande pour atteindre son objectif. A l'avenir, Améyo souhaite améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille tout en gardant pérenne l'activité.
texts.en: Améyo is a 34 year old mother of two, and is married to a driver. Their children are aged 14 and 5, and both attend school. In order to help her husband with the family's costs, she decided to start selling general food products. She has worked in this field since 2010 and has one helper. In order to purchase more goods and achieve her goals, Améyo is seeking her third loan. In future, she would like to improve the living conditions for her family, and continue to drive her business.

loans.use: to purchase general foodstuffs

loans.name: Sedrack

texts.en:
Sedrack is a hardworking single man from Bundibugyo, Uganda. He used the previous loan to expand his secondhand clothing business. He has increased his stock, and he says he now sells to a bigger market.

Due to limited capital, Sedrack is not able to meet all of his customers' demands. He wants to use the loan to add more clothes to his business inventory so as to better fulfill customer demand.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a blacksmithing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional materials for her blacksmithing business, like iron, wood, charcoal, etc.

Marlyn has been in this business for 13 years now. In the future, she would like to save enough money to be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her blacksmithing business, like iron, wood, charcoal, etc.

loans.name: Yanet Cecilia

texts.es:
Yanet es una madre soltera de 35 años de edad, sus dos hijos son de 3 y 11 años de edad actualmente los tiene estudiando gracias a su éxito como vendedora de productos pro catálogo. 

Hace un tiempo se encontraba muy desesperada pues sabía que era soltera y no tenía aun trabajo, era tanto el desespero que en las tiendas ya no le fiaban y no tenía comida que llevarle a sus hijos, un día una amiga le ofreció la oportunidad de vender productos de uso doméstico y cosméticos pro catalogo y desde entonces trabaja diariamente 10 horas por día pro rebuscarse clientes. 
Solicita un crédito para la compra de productos que ya tiene encargados lo que la tiene muy motivada pues es su mejor venta y quiere comprarlos directamente de la empresa para tener una mejor utilidad y saldar deudas que tenía cuanto se encontraba sin trabajo.
Con el crédito comprara lociones, cremas de manos, productos capilares, barnices, bolsos y algunos productos de aseo como detergentes y desodorantes. 
Sueña con tener su casa propia y su propio almacén  y una estabilidad económica que no le permita recaer en las crisis que hace unos meses tenia.
texts.en:
Yanet is a single, 35-year-old mother of two children. Thanks to her success in catalogue sales, she's been able to send her children, aged 3 and 11 years, to school.

There was a time that she found herself quite desperate, being single and unemployed; the clerks at the stores she frequented no longer trusted she could pay them, so she had no food to take home to her children. One day, one of her friends offered her the chance to sell domestic and cosmetic products by catalogue and since then, she works 10 hours a week looking for clients.

She is requesting a loan to buy products that she has on order. She's very motivated and this is her biggest order yet, so she wants to buy the products directly from the company as it's more cost-efficient and pay outstanding balances she incurred while unemployed.

With this loan she'll buy lotions, creams, hand cream, hair products, nail polish, purses and some cleaning products, such as detergents and deodorants.

She dreams of owning her own house and store, as well as having financial stability, in order to keep herself from falling into the crisis she fell into before.

loans.use: buy lotions, hand creams, hair products, nail polish, purses and some cleaning products, like detergents and deodorants.

loans.name: Yorley

texts.es:
El señor Yorley es un veterano de mil batallas vividas a lo largo de su vida, vive en el municipio de Sonsón con su esposa y sus dos hijos menores.

El es un hombre muy trabajador y desde hace algún tiempo viene trabajando en el negocio del café. Su negocio consiste en la compra y venta de café que obtiene de los caficultores de la región. 

Trabaja todos días arduamente para sacar adelante a su familia y poder ofrecer una buena educación a sus hijos.

Manifiesta que es un negocio sencillo de realizar para su edad.

El solicita un préstamo para capitalizar su negocio y tener dinero disponible para comprar el producto a los cafeteros. 

El préstamo le dará la oportunidad de mejorar su negocio y de darle un impulso considerable a su actividad, permitiéndole obtener recursos para la educación de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mr. Yorley is a veteran of many battles experienced throughout his life. He lives in the town of Sonsón with his wife and two children. He is a hardworking man, and has been working in the coffee business for a long time. His business consists of the purchase and sale of coffee that he gets from the farmers of the region. He works hard every day to get his family ahead and to afford a good education for his children. He believes his job is good for his age. 

Mr. Yorley is requesting a loan to increase the capital of his business and have money available to buy his product from the coffee farmers.

The loan will give him the opportunity to improve his business and give it a significant boost, allowing him to increase his income for the education of his children.

loans.use: to buy coffee in bulk to maintain his business and to support his children.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to restock grocery items, like cooking oil, rice,  sugar, drinks, flour, and freezits.

loans.name: Eremencia

texts.en:
Eremencia is a 30-year-old married woman with two children from the Wedza District of Zimbabwe. She and her husband own a tobacco farming business, and it is their only source of income. Eremencia produces almost 30 hundred-kilogram bales of cured tobacco every season. She is also a Camfed Learner Guide at schools in her community, focusing on teaching students life skills.

Eremencia intends to use the Kiva loan to buy supplies such as fertilizers and irrigation equipment for the farm, and she looks forward to seeing her business flourishing. Most importantly, Eremencia hopes to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as fertilizers and irrigation equipment for the farm.

loans.name: Adjovi

texts.fr:
_- 
Agée de 21 ans  Adjovi est  Célibataire résidant  à Tokoin. Elle a commencée son activité de  commerce en vendant des plastiques et  sachets. Elle s'approvisionne  2 Fois  par mois  au Grand marché de lomé  et  revend  par vente  Ambulante  et  dans les  quartiers environnant.  Adjovi  sollicite  un crédit pour agrandir son commerce afin de satisfaire sa clientèle et  faire plus de profit.
texts.en: Adjovi is a single 21 year old lady, and lives in Tokoin. She began as a salesperson by selling plastic containers and sachets. She sources her goods twice a month at the large market in Lomé, and sells via ambulant sales in the nearby neighbourhoods. She is seeking a loan in order to grow her business and satisfy her customers' demands, as well as to generate more profit.

loans.use: to purchase 10 dozen plastic containers and one bag

loans.name: Ester

texts.en: Ester is a thirty-year-old woman living in Bundibugyo-Uganda. She deals in second-hand clothes and has paid off her previous loan, which she used to expand her stock. She intends to use this current loan to increase her stock, to maximize profits and to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothes for selling.

loans.name: Ruben

texts.es: Ruben vive en La Paz y se dedica a la elaboracion de ropa deportiva y tambien fabrica pantalones deportivos y poleras Ruben trabaja en este negocio con su hermana y su pareja Ruben quiere un credito para comprar maquinas y cortadoras Ruben tiene un hijo y no tiene a nadie que pueda ayudarle por eso quiere un prestamo de kiva
texts.en:
Ruben lives in La Paz and he makes a living producing sportswear clothing. He also makes athletic pants and tee shirts. 

Ruben works in this business with his sister and his partner. He would like a loan to buy machines and cutters. 

Ruben has a son, and he has no one who can help him, that is why he wants a loan from Kiva.

loans.use: to buy machines and cutters.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is a 24-year-old married to Sarah and they are blessed with one child who is four months old. He has been running a retail shop whereby he sells a variety of items and also transports goods to his customers. He has been in this business for the past two years and earns a monthly income of 30, 000 KES.
	 
He has applied for his first loan of 100,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya and intends to use the loan amount to add more stock of washing detergents and buy a secondhand motorcycle for supplying the retail goods to his customers.                                                                                           

He will use the anticipated profits to provide for the family's basic needs. He hopes to grow his business and open a bigger shop.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of washing detergents and to buy a motorcycle for supplying retail goods to customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothing and footwear

loans.name: Maria Rosa

texts.es:
María una mujer de 48 años de edad, está casada desde hace ya 25 años, por falta de recursos económicos no pudo culminar sus estudios sin embargo culminó sus estudios primaros con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación. Por la situación económica que no fue buena tuvo que trabajar para ser apoyo a su esposo, tiene tres hijos menores de 18 años, viven en la ciudad de Latacunga ubicado en la Provincia de Cotopaxi en la República del Ecuador, en un departamento junto a su esposo e hijos desde hace 1 año.
Maria es una mujer muy emprendedora, trabajadora y muy dedicada a su hogar, ha trabajado desde muy joven en la agricultura, ella está muy preocupada por ser un apoyo para su esposo y ayudar en la economía de su hogar es por eso que está solicitando un crédito para la construcción de unas chancheras y comprar mas cerdos lo cual servirá para  mejorar su estilo de vida. 
Maria agradece a Fundación Alternativa en Ecuador y a Kiva por hacer posible el crecimiento en su vida laboral y personal.
texts.en:
María is a 48-year-old woman who has been married for 25 years.  Due to a lack of financial resources, she was not able to finish her studies.  However, she was able to complete her primary education with great effort and dedication.  Since her financial situation was not good, María had to work in order to help her husband.  They have three children under the age of 18.  María and her family live in the city of Latacunga, which is in Cotopaxi Province in one of the departments in the Republic of Ecuador.  They have lived there for one year.  
María is an enterprising and hardworking woman who is devoted to her household.  From a very young age, she has worked in agriculture.  She is very concerned about helping her husband and contributing to the household finances.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan in order to build a few pig pens and to buy more pigs.  This will help to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: to build a few pig pens and to buy more pigs.

loans.name: Sadek

texts.en:
Sadek is a special needs client from Iraq. He is 46 year old, married and has two children. He is the only provider for the family. 

Sadek owns a refreshments Kiosk. He sells soft drinks, juices, water, hot drinks and other teas. He established his business in 1990. He has built up good experience in this field. He is well-known in the surrounding area and has an excellent reputation. 

Sadek is requesting a loan of 2,000 USD to renovate the kiosk, install a new ceiling and buy chairs. 

He is aiming to grow his business more and expand his shop in the future so he may increase his profits and make more income for his family.

loans.use: to renovate the kiosk, install a new ceiling and buy chairs.

loans.name: Akuélé

texts.fr:
_ -  
Agée de 38 ans  Akuélé est   Mariée  et  mère d’ 5 enfants  résidant  à Tokoin. Elle a commencée  son activité  avec  restauration  du  riz. Elle s'approvisionne  2 Fois  par mois au  marché de gbossimé  et  revend  au  marché  de  Abové   à un  emplacement.  Akuélé  sollicite  un crédit pour agrandir son commerce afin de satisfaire sa clientèle et  faire plus de profit.
texts.en: Akuélé is a 38 year old married mother of 5, who lives in Tokoin. She began her business by preparing and selling rice. She sources her goods twice a week at the Gbossimé market and re-sells at the Abové market. She is seeking a loan in order to grow her business so that she may satisfy her customers and generate higher profits.

loans.use: to purchase two bags of rice, one container of oil and condiments

loans.name: Martha Emilia

texts.es:
Martha Emilia tiene 50 años de edad, su estado civil es soltera, pero tiene un hijo menor de edad el cual esta cursando sus estudios secundarios, vive en casa de herencia de sus padres vive junto a su hijo. La vida en el lugar es tranquila, sus pobladores se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería. El lugar donde vive es un pueblo joven de aproximadamente 43 añosde creación política y está ubicado en el distrito y provincia de Morropón, región de Piura, costa norte de Perú.

La actividad que realiza Martha Emilia es la venta de abarrotes en general, pues posee una pequeña tienda y además ahi también ofrece en venta menestras precocidas, pollo pelado por kilos, verduras, entre otros. Esta actividad Martha Emilia la realiza desde hace 12 años; su negocio se encuenta en su domicilio.

El destino del crédito será para invertirlo en su negocio, pues desea invertirlo en compra de materia prima, comprando una mayor cantidad de productos(arroz, azúcar, aceite, entre otros) para poder aumentar y diversificar su stock; de esta forma poder atender todos los pedidos y gustos de su público consumidor. La inversión le ayudará a obtener mejores ingresos para su familia. El mercado presenta buenas perspectivas debido a que el pueblo donde Martha Emilia vive solo tiene 2 tiendas (contando la de ella) que ofrece todos estos servicios y productos. Piensa trabajar invirtiendo en su negocio y obtener mejores ganancias que le permitan a un mediano o corto plazo aumentar sus ingresos, mejorar sus ganancias y por ende su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Martha Emilia is 50 years old, she is single but she has a young child who is attending secondary school. She lives with her son in a house she has inherited from her parents. Life is peaceful in her community, and people there engage in agriculture and animal breeding. She lives in a village that was established 43 years ago, located in Morropón, a district of the homonymous province, in the Piura region, on the northern coast of Peru.

Martha Emilia runs a grocery store. She owns a small shop where she also sells pre-cooked vegetable stews, skinned chicken by the kilo and vegetables. Martha Emilia has been engaging in this activity for 12 years, and her shop is located in her house.

The loan she is requesting will be invested in her business by buying a greater amount of products (rice, sugar, oil, and others) in order to increase and vary her stock; she will thus be able to satisfy all of her customers’ requests and preferences. This investment will help her earn a better income for her family. In the village where Martha Emilia lives there are only 2 shops (including hers) offering these services and products, therefore her market prospects are good. She pans on investing in her activity and earning a better income that will allow her to increase her earning, improve her economy and finally improve her family’s standard of living as well as her won in the short or medium term.

loans.use: to buy a greater amount of products (rice, sugar, oil, and others) in order to increase and vary her stock.

loans.name: Nelyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Nelyn works hard to support her family. She has a general store in the Philippines and earns additional income from fishing. 

Nelyn successfully paid back her previous loan and has now requested this additional loan to further build her business. She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her general store.

Nelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money to be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Alisi

texts.en:
Alisi is a 45-year-old woman with four children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She is a very hardworking woman and is the one taking the sole responsibility of looking after her family and ensuring that her children go to school. 

She deals in fresh foodstuffs and this is where she earns a living for herself and her children. She is affected by seasonality but strives hard to succeed. 

She wants the loan to buy more foodstuffs to sell.

loans.use: To buy more food stuffs to sell

loans.name: Edwin Vinicio

texts.es:
Edwin en un joven de 19 años de edad es ecuatoriano, nacido en la ciudad de Latacunga, provincia de Cotopaxi, actualmente se encuentra soltero, gracias al esfuerzo y sacrificio de sus padres pudo terminar la secundaria y desde muy joven ha trabajado muy duro para poder ayudar a su madre y hermanos, hoy en día vive con su familia en casa propia, él se dedica a la ayudar a su padre en el negocio y desde hace mucho tiempo Edwin ha deseado poner en práctica su sueño, el de tener una pequeña carpintería donde podrá ofrecer a los clientes casa, corrales para animales como cuyes, conejos, pollos y cerdos.
Su mayor obstáculo ha sido que ninguna otra institución financiera le han querido apoyar en su emprendimiento. Edwiin está muy consciente de que este es un trabajo que demanda mucho esfuerzo y tiempo sobre esto el se dedica mucho para poder salir adelante y  sobresalir en esta vida, el arte de la carpintería lo aprendió de su padre.
Edwn agradece a Fundación Alternativa en Ecuador y a Kiva por hacer posible el crecimiento en su vida laboral ya que él invertirá en la compra de repuestos para su negocio.
texts.en:
Edwin is a young man and 19 years old. He is Ecuadorian and was born in the city of Latacunga in the province of Cotopaxi. He is single at the moment. Thanks to the efforts and sacrifice of his parents, he could complete secondary school, and since he was very young he has also worked very hard in order to be able to help his mother and his siblings. Today, he lives with the family in their own house.

He works helping his father in his business, and very recently Edwin could make his great dream come true: the dream of having his own small carpentry workshop where he can offer the construction of houses and pens for animals like guinea pigs, rabbits, chicken, and pigs. His biggest challenge was that no other financial institution wanted to help him in his undertaking. He was referred to Fundación Alternativa by his father, who has been one of their clients for many years.

Edwin knows very well that this is a job that requires a lot of effort and time, and in addition he is very dedicated to get ahead and excel in his life. He learned the trade of carpentry from his father. Edwin thanks Fundación Alternativa in Ecuador and Kiva for making it possible for him to grow in his job, because he wants to invest the money into the purchase of replacement parts for his business.

loans.use: to purchase replacement parts for his carpentry business.

loans.name: Kisoga Group

texts.en:
Elizabeth, who is in her early 30s is married with three children, two of whom go to school and one is still small. She has been running a business of selling fruits and vegetables. She buys the fruits from the market, but she  plants the vegetables in her small plot of land. She has been in her business for three years now. She works from 9 am to 7 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Elizabeth's first loan from Tujijenge, Tanzania. She will use this loan to buy more fruits and plant more vegetables. She dreams of buying many bricks to put in her plot ready for building her house. 

Elizabeth will share this loan with her loan group "KISOGA" which consists of eleven members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and plant more vegetables.

loans.name: Isidora

texts.es: Isidora es viuda y tiene dos hijos, ella vive en El alto en una casa de adobe que es de su propiedad , la casa tiene luz, agua y alcantarillado. Isidora se dedica a la albañileria y quiere un prestamo para refaccionar su propia casa para poder mejorar su calidad de vida Isidora es la unica fuente de ingresos en su hogar por lo que necesita su ayuda, ella goza de buena salud
texts.en: Isidora is a widow, is in good health and has two children. She lives in El alto in a house made of adobe (bricks made from clay and straw), which she owns. The house has light, water and a sewage service. She works as a builder and is asking for a loan to repair her own house so she can improve her quality of life. Isidora is the only source of income in her household, which is why she needs this help.

loans.use: to repair her own house.

loans.name: Mahmadullo

texts.ru: Махмадулло студент первого курса. Он учится в Национальном Университете Таджикистана. Он учится по специальности Государственное управление. Махмадулло учится упорно, чтобы получить хорошие знания и работать в будущем в государственной власти. Он не женат и живет с родителями. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 800 долларов США для оплаты учебного договора. Он ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en:
Mahmadullo is a first year student. He studies at the National University of Tajikistan. He specializes in public administration. Mahmadullo studies hard in order to obtain good knowledge and work in the public authority in the future.

Mahmadullo is not married and lives with his parents. He requests a loan in the amount of 800 US dollar to pay for his tuition. He awaits your kindness and hopes for your charity.

loans.use: To pay for tuition

loans.name: Melvin

texts.en:
Melvin offers t-shirt and streamer printing. He has been doing this kind of business for over six years. Another business involvement he has had is a loading station. Despite difficulties and hardship in his life, he still has a strong determination to overcome it.

Now, he wants to operate general store along the highway of Cordon. With regards to this matter, he decided to borrow a loan of 30,000 PHP, allowing him to purchase grocery items for the start-up of his general store. He knows that having this capital will have a lot to do with the increase of his income and becoming better-known for his skills in printing streamers and t-shirts.

He hopes and prays for approval of his loan request.

loans.use: purchase grocery items for the start-up of his general store business

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is 40 years old and married with three children.

Veronica works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Veronica has borrowed and repaid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 4 years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Veronica aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Saodat

texts.ru: Саодат молодая и трудолюбивая девушка. Ей 18 лет. Она не замужем и живет с родителями. Саодат занимается откармливанием скота. Однако она хочет развевать себя в другой сфере, например шитьем женской одежды. Она с такой целью участвовала в курсе «Добейся Успеха» организованного Ассоциация Деловых Женщин. Она получила много новой информации для себя. Саодат нуждается новой швейной машинке, чтобы начать свой бизнес. Она будет предоставлять услуги портнихи у себя дома и в дальнейшем она мечтает открыть ателье. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 6000 сомони для покупки швейной машинки и ткани. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en:
Saodat is a young and hardworking girl. She is 18 years old. She is not married and lives with her parents. Saodat works with breeding livestock. However, she would like to develop herself in a different area, such as sewing women's clothing. With this aim she participated in the course "To get ahead", organized by the Association of Business Women. She received a lot of new information. 

Saodat needs a new sewing machine in order to start her business. She will provide a seamstress service from her home, and she dreams of opening a studio in the future. She requests a loan in the amount of 6,000 somoni to purchase a sewing machine and fabric. She awaits your kindness and hopes for your charity.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine and fabric for setting up a new business

loans.name: Behruz

texts.ru: Бехруз родился в 1996 году. Он молодой и трудолюбивый человек. Бехруз живет вместе с мамой. Он студент первого курса Таджикского Государственного Технологического Университета. Бехруз учится по специальности международный экономист. Он является одним из успешных студентов. Бехруз запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора, так как у его матери нет достаточно денег. Он ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en:
Behruz was born in 1996. He is a young and hardworking man. Behruz lives together with his parents. He is a first year student at the Tajik State University. He studies International Economy. He is a successful student.

Behruz requests a loan to pay for his tuition, as his mother is does not have sufficient funds for it. He awaits your kindness and hopes for your charity.

loans.use: To pay for tuition

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr:
Madame Aminata est vendeuse dans une pharmacie depuis plus de 7 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants dont son ainé, un garçon âgée de 20 ans et la plus jeune, une fille, âgée de 8 ans. Elle loge non loin du guichet et allie son travail au commerce. Cela fait 3 ans maintenant qu’elle a démarré cette activité avec les crédits pris à l’IMCEC. Chaque année à cette période, Aminata sollicite un crédit afin d’acheter des chaussures et de l’habillement pour enfants dans le but de le commercialiser visant la fête de la Tabaski qui est prévu dans moins d’un mois.
Elle épargne petit à petit en visant son objectif de construire un jour sa propre maison.
texts.en:
Mrs. Aminata has been a sales clerk in a pharmacy for over 7 years. She is married with three children; the eldest is a 20-year-old boy, and the youngest is an 8-year-old girl. She lives close to the IMCEC branch, and she balances her work and her commercial activity, which she started 3 years ago with the help of IMCEC loans. 

Each year around this time, Aminata applies for a new loan to buy shoes and children’s clothing to sell before the Tabaski celebration coming in less than a month. 

She saves little by little to reach her ultimate goal of building her own house.

loans.use: to buy shoes and children’s clothing for resale.

loans.name: Ruth Silvia

texts.es:
Ruth es una mujer de 24 años de edad, soltera, madre de dos niños de 6 y 4 años de edad, y su negocio es la elaboración de queso artesanal.
Ella es emprendedora, sacrificada, constante, luchadora, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su labor la realiza en la comunidad Calasaya que se encuentra cercana al lago sagrado Titicaca.
Ruth es de tez morena, estatura mediana, cabello largo negro trenzado, su vestimenta es típica (manta, pollera y sombrero), su lengua materna es el aymara y habla español según sus necesidades de comercio. Ella tiene dos actividades comerciales; una es la producción de queso artesanal, para la cual es necesaria la producción de leche fresca en cantidad. Su segunda actividad es la venta de api; el api es una bebida dulce y caliente elaborada a partir de maíz y se toma mucho como desayuno. Ella sueña en mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, generando mejores ingresos y piensa que realizando la compra de ganado lechero contará con mayor cantidad de leche para la elaboración de queso.
Es por esos motivos que Ruth solicita un préstamo para la compra de ganado lechero y con los beneficios pagar los gastos escolares de sus dos pequeños hijos.
texts.en:
Ruth, 24, is a single mother of two children, aged 6 and 4 years and she runs an artisanal cheese business.

She is dedicated, self-sacrificing, persistent, a fighter, responsible and hard working. She works in the Calasaya community near the sacred Lake Titicaca.

Ruth has a dark complexion, is of medium height, has long black braided hair. She wears traditional garb (manta, pollera and hat), her mother tongue is Aymara and for commercial purposes, speaks Spanish. She has two businesses: the first is the production of artisanal cheese for which she needs a big quantity of fresh milk; her second is selling api; api is a sweet, warm beverage made from maize that is usually consumed at breakfast.

She dreams of improving her family's quality of life, generating more income and thinks that by buying cows she will have large quantities of milk for making cheese.

These are the reasons why Ruth is requesting a loan to buy cows and to pay for her children's education.

loans.use: buy cows and pay her children's schooling.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia lives in Misamis Occidental Province, in a coastal city with a pleasant climate. It is a commercial province, considered a land port that connects the mountains and coast. Letecia is 50 years old, and she lives with her two children. Letecia plays a good role in meeting her children's needs when her husband's income is not enough for the family. 

Letecia built a small shop in their village where she has her business. For more than three years, she has made a living by selling grocery goods. She works tirelessly every single day to bring home enough to sustain her household.

With this loan, Letecia wants to invest in purchasing more merchandise, such as additional grocery goods to sell. By purchasing these items, she will be able to increase her sales because many of her customers ask for more goods. She is happy that this loan will allow her to improve her sales and provide more variety to her customers. She is grateful to GDMPC for giving her an opportunity to improve their lives.

loans.use: to invest in purchasing more merchandise, such as additional grocery goods to sell.

loans.name: Mosharif

texts.ru: Мошариф является одной из таких женщин, которая всегда старается для благо получения своей семьи. Ей 50 лет. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Мошариф всегда хотела заниматься бизнесом, и теперь она решила организовать бизнес скотоводством. Мошариф с такой целью обучилась в курсе «Добейся Успеха» организованного Ассоциация Деловых Женщин. Мошариф нуждается финансовой поддержке, чтобы начать новый бизнес. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони для покупки скота. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en:
Mosharif is one of these women who always strive for the welfare of their family. She is 50 years old. She is married and has three children. Mosharif always wanted to have her own business, and currently she decided to set up a livestock breeding business. With this aim she attended the course "To get ahead", organized by the Association of Business Women. 

Mosharif needs financial support in order to start the business. She requests a loan in the amount of 5,000 somoni to purchase livestock. She awaits your kindness and hopes for your charity.

loans.use: To purchase livestock for setting up a new business

loans.name: Nawal

texts.en:
Nawal, who was born in 1962, lives with her husband and two sons and daughters. Her husband works in agriculture, while she has been running her own business for two years. 

Nawal started by selling blankets, and now she is planning to expand into clothing sales to help her husband cover their household expenses. She is therefore requesting this loan to buy a new collection of clothes for resale.

loans.use: To buy clothes to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a refrigerator and an oven to bake cakes.

loans.name: Hakob

texts.en:
Hakob is 41 years old and he lives in the frontier village Vazashen in Tavush region. Hakob is the head of a large family; he lives with his mother, wife, and three children. 

With his nice wife, Hakob is engaged in farming and agriculture. On his farm, Hakob has 2 cows, 2 heifers, two calves, and 50 chickens. On his plot of land, Hakob cultivates a great range of vegetables (tomatoes, cucumbers, beans, potatoes, greens, onions, and garlic) and fruits (apples, persimmons, peaches, pears, plums, and cornel). The main products on his farm—such as milk, meat, eggs, persimmons, and cornel—Hakob’s mother sells to their loyal customers. 

In addition to farming, Hakob uses his own car to provide taxi services around his village, and he also, on his own synthesizer, plays during wedding parties. 

Thanks to his multidisciplinary work he covers his family’s needs, and yet there still remain some problems which need financial support. Hakob asks this loan since he is sure that, thanks to it, he will manage to buy 2 bulls, enlarge his farm, and also buy fodder for his farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy 2 bulls, enlarge his farm, and also buy fodder for his farm cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fabric and dishes for resale.

loans.name: Edith Rocio

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal SEÑOR DE HUANCA-TERMINAL, él banco esta ubicado en el departamento de Cusco.
La socia continua dedicándose a trabajar en una empresa privada de transporte interprovincial, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este trabajo el cual le trae satisfacciones personales.
 La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de llantas.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank "Senor de Huanca-Terminal", the bank is located in the department of Cusco. The member continues to provide interprovincial transportation services. She wants to continue doing this job to be able to support her family. She has been working on this for a good amount of time and this brings her a lot of personal satisfaction
The member is requesting a loan to buy tyres for her car. She is grateful for the loan and commits to meet the repayment terms.

loans.use: to buy tyres.

loans.name: Lucio

texts.es: Lucio vive en concubinato desde hace doce años y tiene dos hijos  Lucio viven en Avichaca en una casa de adobe que es propia Lucio es agricultor y ademas trabaja como albañil Lucio necesita un credito para comprar una motobomba de agua para el riego de su sembradio La pareja de Lucio le ayuda en el cuidado de su ganado y en la produccion de leche Lucio goza de buena salud
texts.en:
Lucio has lived in a common-law marriage for twelve years and has two children. He lives in Avichaca in an adobe house that he owns. He is a farmer and he also works in construction. 

Lucio needs a loan to buy a motorized water pump for irrigating his field. His spouse helps him take care of his livestock and milk production. Lucio enjoys good health.

loans.use: to buy a motorized water pump to irrigate his field

loans.name: Abla

texts.fr:
- 
Abla a 54 ans, Mariée et mère de 4 enfants résident à Tokoin. Elle Vend de la  boule d'akassa. Elle s'approvisionne 2 Fois par mois au  marché gbossimé et revend a sa  devanture  de son domicile. Abla sollicite ce crédit pour agrandir son commerce afin de faire plus de profit
texts.en:
Abla, age 54, is married with four children. She lives in Tokoin. 

Abla sells akassa balls (a local dish made with maize starch). She buys her ingredients twice a month at the Gbossimé market, and she conducts her sales in front of her house. 

With this loan, Abla hopes to expand her business and bolster her profits.

loans.use: to buy 2 sacks of maize.

loans.name: Juana Veronica

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal SEÑOR DE HUANCA-TERMINAL, él banco eta ubicado en el departamento de Cusco.
La socia  Juana Verónica, la socia continua dedicándose con su negocio de transporte interprovincial, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando  a su familia, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le trae satisfacciones personales.
La socia solicita el crédito para realizar el mantenimiento de su carro.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank "Senor de Huanca-Terminal", the bank is located in the department of Cusco. The member continues to provide interprovincial transportation services. She wants to continue doing this job to be able to support her family. She has been working on this for a good amount of time and this brings her a lot of personal satisfaction
The member is requesting a loan to pay for car maintenance. She is grateful for the loan and commits to meet the repayment terms.

loans.use: to pay for car maintenance.

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es: Bertha es soltera y no tiene hijos, ella vive en El alto en  una casa de adobe que le pertenece a sus familiares con quienes comparte techo.  Bertha es una habil elaboradora de chalecos  y quiere un credito para comprar una maquina de costura para poder mejorar sus ingresos y apurarse con sus labores. Bertha es la unica fuente de ingresos en su hogar pero goza de buena salud
texts.en: Bertha is single, in good health and doesn't have any children. She lives in El alto in a house made of adobe (bricks of mud and straw) that belongs to her family, with whom she lives. Bertha is a skilful waistcoat maker. She wants a loan to buy a sewing machine so she can improve her income and do her work faster. Bertha is the only source of income in her household.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Norma Felicidad

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal SEÑOR DE HUANCA-TERMINAL, él banco eta ubicado en el departamento de Cusco.
La socia continua dedicándose a  trabajar en una empresa privada de transporte interprovincial, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando  a su familia, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le trae satisfacciones personales.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de vivieres.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank "Senor de Huanca-Terminal", the bank is located in the department of Cusco. The member continues to provide interprovincial transportation services. She wants to continue doing this job to be able to support her family. She has been working on this for a good amount of time and this brings her a lot of personal satisfaction
The member is requesting a loan to buy foodstuffs. She is grateful for the loan and commits to meet the repayment terms.

loans.use: to purchase foodstuffs.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal SEÑOR DE HUANCA-TERMINAL, él banco eta ubicado en el departamento de Cusco.
La socia Lucila tiene 44 años de edad tiene 03 hijos y es casada, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el  negocio de transporte interprovincial, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando  a su familia, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le trae satisfacciones personales.
La socia solicita el crédito para realizar el mantenimiento de su carro.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank "Senor de Huanca-Terminal", the bank is located in the department of Cusco. The member continues to provide interprovincial transportation services. She wants to continue doing this job to be able to support her family. She has been working on this for a good amount of time and this brings her a lot of personal satisfaction.
The member is requesting a loan to pay for car maintenance costs. She is grateful for the loan and commits to meet the repayment terms.

loans.use: to pay for car maintenance costs.

loans.name: Yeni Roxana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal SEÑOR DE HUANCA-TERMINAL, él banco eta ubicado en el departamento de Cusco.
La socia  Yeni Roxana continua  trabajando en una empresa privada de transporte interprovincial, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando  a su familia, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le trae satisfacciones personales.
La socia solicita el crédito para pagar los estudios de su hijo.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank "Senor de Huanca-Terminal", the bank is located in the department of Cusco. The member continues to provide interprovincial transportation services. She wants to continue doing this job to be able to support her family. She has been working on this for a good amount of time and this brings him a lot of personal satisfaction.
The member is requesting a loan to pay for her child's study fees. She is grateful for the loan and commits to meet the repayment terms.

loans.use: to pay for her child's study fees.

loans.name: Henidina

texts.en:
Henidina, a married mother of two, lives in Tudela Misamis Occidental with her family. She helps her husband on their farm to make a living. 

Henidina became a member of Gata Daku MPC this year and has requested a new loan to finance the cost of buying fertilizer for her rice production. She is hoping to harvest more grains to earn more revenue to sustain their farm as well as improve the general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her rice production

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to connect to Haiti's first solar hybrid smart electricity grid.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Kiva lenders! Meet Catherine, 26-years-young, an energetic and hardworking mother of two lovely children. Catherine resides in the Kenyenya area of Kenya. This area experiences one of the best weather patterns that favours crop and animal farming. Catherine has been farming for the past 15 years and the income from it has enabled her to take care of her family and her parents, making sure that they have their basic needs. 

Due to the high unemployment rate in Kenya, Catherine could not find a job to support her family, but she didn’t surrender to that. She started farming, and through mixed farming, she has been able to earn a decent income. Catherine is seeking a loan of KES 20,800 to buy a quality dairy cow. Catherine wants to take advantage of the increased market in milk products. Having an entrepreneurial mind, she cannot let this opportunity pass by. Profits generated from selling milk and its products will be used to repay the loan and to assist her family and the community. 

Catherine intends to use the income generated to improve her living conditions and to impact society positively. Catherine is very visionary and she intends to start a big dairy shop where she will sell milk products such as yoghurt and cream. Catherine is hoping for your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to connect to Haiti's first solar hybrid smart electricity grid.

loans.name: Rosane

texts.en: Rosane has started selling the Sunking Pro solar light and has seen increased demand for this product. Her children have just started the school year so she is looking for a loan to help her purchase inventory for 40 lamps.

loans.use: to purchase inventory for a clean energy retail business.

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr:
_ -   
Demeurant  à  Lomé dans le quartier  Tokoin,  Afi  est  âgée de 46 ans. Elle est Mariée . Adzo  vend  des Pots,balaies,paniers  et  s’approvisionne  2 Fois par  mois  au  marché de Tsévié  et  revend  à  domicile  . Afi  sollicite un prêt pour agrandir  son commerce et faire plus bénéfice.
texts.en:
Afi, age 46, lives in the Tokoin district of the city of Lomé. She is married. 

She sells pots, brooms and baskets, and she buys her stock twice a month at the Tsévié market. She conducts her sales from her home. 

With this loan, Afi hopes to expand her business and bolster her profits.

loans.use: to buy 30 pots and brooms for resale.

loans.name: Komla

texts.fr: Revendeur d’articles scolaires dans une boutique depuis 1987, Komla marié est père de 04 enfants. Avec ce quatrième crédit, il va acheter des articles scolaires pour vendre. Avec cette augmentation, il souhaiterait voir sa famille s’épanouir et devenir grossiste.
texts.en:
Reseller of school supplies in a boutique since 1987, Komla is the married father of four children. 

With this fourth loan, he plans to stock up on school supplies for resale. 

Komla hopes that increased profits will help him to see his family thrive and allow him to become a wholesaler.

loans.use: to buy school supplies to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to connect to Haiti's first solar hybrid smart electricity grid.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to connect to Haiti's first solar hybrid smart electricity grid.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to connect to Haiti's first solar hybrid smart electricity grid.

loans.name: Gary

texts.en: This loan helps Gary get connected to his local prepay microgrid. Gary is a 40-year-old father of three, all going to school. He is a farmer and lives in a small green wooden house in Les Anglais, in southern Haiti. He is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders to be able to connect to the local solar-powered microgrid, and to finally get rid of his dirty, costly kerosene lamp. After running pilots since 2012 that proved the benefits of prepay quality electricity to people in Les Anglais (first with 14 households, and up to 54), EarthSpark International is developing a full-scale, solar-powered microgrid. This micro-grid is expected to meet the needs of up to 500 households. Kiva loans allow EarthSpark to increase the number of beneficiaries by reducing the up-front costs for customers, and will be repaid over time by electricity sales. To see a video of Les Anglais and the hybrid solar grid, please click here.

loans.use: to connect to Haiti's first solar hybrid smart electricity grid.

loans.name: Melicia

texts.en: This loan helps Melicia get connected to her local prepay microgrid. Melicia is a 47-year-old mother of seven, with five going to school. She is a farmer and lives in a small white and blue wooden house in Les Anglais, in southern Haiti. She is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders to be able to connect to the local solar-powered microgrid, and to finally get rid of her dirty, costly kerosene lamp. Mainly, she is looking forward to being connected as it will allow her to save money. Melicia and her family will now be able to benefit from a reliable, durable, and clean power source. After running pilots since 2012 that proved the benefits of prepay quality electricity to people in Les Anglais (first with 14 households, and up to 54), EarthSpark International is developing a full-scale, solar-powered microgrid. This micro-grid is expected to meet the needs of up to 500 households. Kiva loans allow EarthSpark to increase the number of beneficiaries by reducing the up-front costs for customers, and will be repaid over time by electricity sales. To see a video of Les Anglais and the hybrid solar grid, please click here.

loans.name: Miclaine

texts.en: Miclaine lives with her husband and her seven kids in the town of Les Anglais in southern Haiti. Their white wooden house has no reliable access to electricity and thus Miclaine is forced to use costly and harmful kerosene for lighting. With three of her kids still at school, she wishes they had better light for studying at night. A solar-powered microgrid is being installed in Les Anglais, giving Miclaine and her family the opportunity to connect to a higher quality, lower-cost energy source. Miclaine is looking forward to being connected as it will allow her to save money. An electrical connection dramatically reduces the cost of lighting in towns such as Les Anglais while offering far superior light quality and more generally providing opportunities for people to dramatically improve their quality of life. Miclaine is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders to cover the upfront cost of connection to the grid. Her loan will help her get connected to her local prepay microgrid. Miclaine will repay her loan through her electricity payments. To see a video of Les Anglais and the hybrid solar grid, please click here. .

loans.name: Eleuterio

texts.es: Eleuterio es soltero y no tiene hijos, el cliente vive con sus padres en Avichaca en una casa de adobe que es de su propiedad Eleuterio es agricultor  y quiere un prestamo para la compra de una motobomba de agua para riego de sus sembradios  Eleuterio es la unica fuente de ingresos en su hogar y no tiene a nadie que le ayude por eso quiere la colaboracion de Kiva
texts.en: Eleuterio is single and doesn't have children. He lives with his parents in Avichaca in an adobe house that he owns. He is a farmer and wants a loan to buy a water pump to irrigate his fields. Eleuterio is the only source of income in his household and doesn't have anyone to help him. This is why he wants a collaboration with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a water pump to irrigate his fields.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is settled for a living in Poblacion, Pana-on with her family.  To make a living, Josephine manages a fish pond where she raises fish, crabs and shrimp for sale. She has been running the business for many years. She has been able to sustain it and has earned a better income from this. 

She has successfully repaid her previous loan which was used for purchasing fingerlings (juvenile fish). She took a new loan recently to buy feeding supplies for her fish pond. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to buy feeding supplies for her fish pond.

loans.name: Virgie

texts.en:
Virgie is 36 years old and married with three children who are in school. She works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has been in this business for 3 years. 

She requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. In the future Virgie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Aldomaine

texts.en: This loan helps Aldomaine get connected to her local prepay microgrid. Aldomaine runs a small business and lives with her four kids in the town of Les Anglais in southern Haiti. Their blue house has no reliable access to electricity, and thus Aldomaine is forced to use costly and harmful kerosene for lighting. With four of her kids still at school, she wishes they had better light for studying at night. A solar-powered microgrid is being installed in Les Anglais, giving Aldomaine and her family the opportunity to connect to a higher quality, lower-cost energy source. She is looking forward to being connected, as it will allow her to save money. She is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders to cover the upfront cost of connection to the grid, which she will repay through her payments for electricity. An electrical connection dramatically reduces the cost of lighting in towns such as Les Anglais while offering far superior light quality and more generally providing opportunities for people to dramatically improve their quality of life. To see a video of Les Anglais and the hybrid solar grid, please click here.
